Name: Business Analyst
Description: Description: "As the health care industry continues to rapidly transform, our IT team conceives, develops and delivers impactful technology solutions to support access to quality, affordable health care for our members. We are driven by our collective company purpose: To do everything in our power to stand with our members in sickness and in health®. Our IT team unleashes the power of this purpose through technology. We come to work every day to make a difference, and we deliver the highest quality and best solutions to our members." Job Purpose: This position is responsible for leading the development of functional and non-functional business requirements; working with the Business Solutions Lead to understand business strategy and translate into product requirement. Name: Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client that is seeking a Business Analyst in Chicago, Illinois (IL).  Responsibilities:  Performs and coordinates the analysis and design of business systems Develops and maintains a thorough understanding of the needs of the assigned customer group from the business and technical perspective Works closely with clients and with other system groups to capture business requirements and see them through implementation Develops and executes systems testing Acts as a liaison between the business user groups and the technical systems groups Review and analyze client tax information across various systems Perform data and tax package analysis as well as year-end controls and verification Create and distribute the 1099s, 1042S forms, and tax packages Ensure adherence to procedures, control policies, and service level agreementsREQUIREMENTS: Knowledge of IRS requirements with focus on information reporting and withholding (preferred) Proficient computer skills with an emphasis in Microsoft Office (Advanced Excel & Database) Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Analyst
Description: Who we are We help our clients build brand relationships that matter, that are commercially and emotionally rewarding. We do this by understanding people and closing the relationship gap between businesses and people.  Our positioning is as a strategic brand consultancy, powered by data and insight. We work with some of the world’s biggest companies shaping their brand relationships for them.  We do this through disciplined strategic thinking. This then acts as a driving force to extract hidden insights from further research investigation and data analytics.  Role  We have an exciting opportunity for an Analyst to join our team. You’ll work on a range of projects and client accounts, analyzing and interpreting data and providing engaging, actionable insights for our clients.  We’d love someone with a passion for communications and a keen interest to expand their skills in all types of research techniques and solutions including qual and quant techniques as well as mobile, digital and social media.  You’ll need to be proactive and have excellent organizational skills to respond to a wide range of requests and challenges. This role will be perfect for someone who loves getting under the skin of brands to passionately and confidently deliver the latest insight stories for our clients.  We are open to a variety of backgrounds including people with a passion for marketing, digital, analytics, social media, mobile, semiotics, human behaviour and psychology. Core responsibilitiesSupports the team in managing positive day to day client relationships.Develops an awareness of the client’s business, including press coverage, their media laydown and digital strategy and previous projects, research and campaigns.Understands our strategy and embraces new products, technologies and methodologies in client work.Takes opportunities to present at internal meetings or training sessions to develop skills.Develops a strong understanding of different research methods.Develops key research skills including drafting and managing the execution of complex surveys; presenting data clearly and accurately; planning and undertaking analysis; interpreting data and preparing summaries.Manages and optimizes timelines for research projects, collaborating with experts as needed. Ensures accuracy and attention to detail in all phases of a project.  Writes clear and inspiring insight stories for clients.Shows a passion for the digital media landscape, actively applying our Digital Dos and using tools to analyze social data, developing bespoke reports for clients. Capable of gathering and analyzing data from different sources.Stays up to date with developments in our industry and beyond with particular attention to trends, social media, consumer behavior and data/analytics.Helps identify ways in which to improve efficiencies on client accounts and develop automated solutions. Key attributes  Courageous. Proactive, gets involved and makes decisions when needed.  Creative. Demonstrates a love of people and brands, steps outside the ordinary to surprise and delight clients. A problem solver, thinking pragmatically to make the complex simple.  Curious. Shows a hunger to learn, innovating and experimenting at work. Embraces new ideas and ways of working. Willing to learn integrated approach to research and expand skills into strategic consultation.  Collaborative. Great at working within team environments and getting stuff done together.  Strong organizational skills. Able to prioritize to deliver outstanding quality on time.  Good presentation and storytelling skills.  Highly motivated and driven, with a hunger to understand our business and grow.  We’ve been told that our culture is unique, it’s a difficult thing to put into words but it’s all about being challenging yet treating each other with respect. We are naturally curious and we love to learn and discover new things.  We nurture opinions and really respect people who have a point of view and aren’t afraid to share their thinking. We work as teams and responsibilities sit with everyone in that team, whatever their job title. A can-do attitude goes a long way in our business and we don't tolerate egos!  We are passionate about helping our people to learn, stretch and grow. We want this to be a place where people feel challenged, as well as guided and supported.  We have a Learn calendar packed with opportunities to attend interactive training sessions. From “OutsideIn” sessions with industry experts to “15 minutes of Fame” sessions with colleagues to share the amazing work we do, there are lots of ways to build your skills for the future.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?  With the advent of genomic sequencing, we can finally decode and process our genetic makeup. We now have more data than ever before but providers don't have the infrastructure or expertise to make sense of this data. We're on a mission to connect an entire ecosystem to redefine how genomic and clinical data is used in clinical settings.  We are looking for an Operations Analyst to work with our Clinical Data team.  Responsibilities: Maintain clinical data abstraction pipeline, set team priorities to appropriately match commercial delivery timelinesMaintain research pipeline and capacityManage clinical data infrastructure, reporting, and KPIsCollaborate cross-functionally to ensure data is appropriately reflected and consumed by all Tempus teamsAd hoc projects to ensure operational excellence is maintained Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in analytics, business, computer science, finance or economics1-2 years of consulting, investment banking or operationsFamiliarity with SQL, Excel, and TableauExcellent project management skill, with proven ability to execute highly complex projects with multiple cross-functional stakeholdersAbility to effectively prioritize in a dynamic, and time sensitive environment with minimal guidanceImpeccable written and verbal communication skillsAbility to create tactical action plans and solve complex problemsHighly analytical, entrepreneurial, and self-motivatedSolution oriented mindset

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Apply Now Business Analyst Chicago, IL, USA Req #149  Tuesday, October 9, 2018  Sphera, the former Operational Excellence and Risk Management business of IHS Inc. (“Company”) is a leading global provider of enterprise software and services that enable companies to manage and optimize their environmental, health, safety and sustainability (“EHS&S”) processes. Amongst a wide variety of use cases, the software allows customers to standardize and automate processes such as incident reporting, to monitor emissions and ensure regulatory compliance and to track chemical inventory throughout a manufacturing cycle. The company was recently spun off by IHS and acquired by Genstar Capital, essentially positioning it as a $100MM start up. Responsibilities:  Work with key project stakeholders and the customer to understand the overall business vision for a project and translate that into actionable objectives.  Provide a communication conduit between the business and technical community by interpreting and translating business needs into technical requirements.  Comprehend and document requirements from multiple stakeholders and conceptualize solutions.  Develop deep understanding of current systems and processes and analyze impact of changes as new solutions are introduced to the environment.  Collaborate directly with business owners, sales, QA and development teams.  Collaborate with other BSAs to manage interdependencies across the product suite.  Assist in developing and validating test plans.  Develop and provide product presentations and/or training to existing customer, and potential customers. Qualifications:  Must be able to qualify and maintain clearance to work on a U.S. military installation.  Communicate excellently with diverse groups of people inside and outside of the organization.  Ability to envision, document and clearly communicate end-to-end solutions.  Skilled in creating process flows and swim lane diagrams in Visio.  Ability to forge relationships with various business and technical team members and managers.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  Strong sense of ownership and accountability to deliver planned results  Extremely detail-oriented  Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast paced, rapidly changing environment.  Knowledge of development processes and methodology including Agile and Waterfall techniques  Aptitude to understand business impact and business value of technical solutions.  Experience working with Department of Defense is a plus.  Knowledge of Environmental and/or Logistics Processes is a plus.  Ability to travel up to 25% of working time Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a technology related field. Equivalent work experience may be substituted for education. Minimum 7+ years’ experience in an IT organization, preferably in software development.  At Sphera, we are working together to help our customers keep their people safe, their products sustainable and their operations productive. The best people don't want a job, they want to change the world and themselves. The best want to challenge the status quo. The best want to grow themselves and their careers. Come check out what Sphera has to offer and how that matches up with your career goals.  Sphera is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: This position can sit in either Chicago, Houston, Washington D.C. or New YorkPosition Summary:Reporting to the Manager, Technology Portfolio Management in Information Services, the junior-level Business Analyst I’s primary responsibilities are to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of project stakeholders, including customers and end users. The role will work with firm personnel to define the functional, data and process requirements for various projects, facilitating the creation of sound, efficient and supportable solutions that meet the firm’s needs and improve current processes. In addition, this role will serve as the liaison between the customer community and the technical team, ensuring that documented requirements are implemented to the project stakeholder’s satisfaction. The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented critical thinker who can explain difficult concepts to non-technical users with ease.JOB DUTIES:Partner with project sponsors or subject matter experts to document a project’s business requirements with a focus on increasing business effectiveness and efficiencies, including development of project feasibility and cost-benefit analysesElicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, use cases, user stories, task and workflow analysis. Lead requirements validation activities to confirm that a solution based on the requirements would meet customer needs and achieve the business objectivesWrite requirements specifications using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously and conciselyLead and facilitate ongoing requirements prioritization including managing changes to baselined requirements through effective and appropriate application of change control processes and toolsContinuously improve upon existing requirements practices. Assist with the expansion of the firm’s requirements engineering policies, procedures, and toolsImplement ways to reuse requirements across projectsPrepare recommendations for technological and business solutions based on project requirementsDevelop and maintain project objective(s), scope and work plan related to software development, implementations of new or modified applications and business processesCommunicate with project teams and management regarding the status of all ongoing projects including project issues and accomplishments. Ensure completion of project deliverables based on identified requirements and approved timelineWork closely with the Quality Assurance Manager to monitor and track defects identified during testing through resolutionCoordinate project rollout to the user community, including communications, documentation, reference guides and demonstrationsResolve user issues, questions, and inquiries, as well as other post-implementation tasksUnderstand integrations between all applications/systems maintained by the FirmResearch and analyze new technologiesWork on special projects as assignedMaintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, and establishing personal networksQUALIFICATIONS:Must be specifically listed on resume in order to be considered for this position:Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in Business Administration, Project Management, Computer Science, or Information SystemsUp to 5 years of experience of law firm or relevant professional services environment experience, preferably on a global scale requiredCompetencies:2+ years overall business analysis or process improvement experienceExperience in information systems and/or applying technology solutions to business processesDemonstrable experience in eliciting requirements using interviews, meetings, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, tasks, and workflow analysisSkilled in conveying business requirements to the appropriate business leaders, and/or IS team members, and where necessary, with vendorsCapable of overseeing technical creation and implementation of business solutionsExperience with testing to ensure that project deliverables are metAbility to develop and maintain ongoing relationships with firm leadership, customers, stakeholders, and project sponsorsStrong information gathering and problem solving skills. Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking to complex situationsExcellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to present detailed or complicated information in an understandable way to firm attorneys and staffExperience with non-US operations, especially in Europe and Asia, are beneficialClearance of Firm standard background checks is required. We value diversity in our workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled

Name: Analyst, Business Analytics

This is the most exciting time to be a part of Astellas, a company with a uniquely collaborative and patient-focused culture. There's something special about working at Astellas. It's reflected in our focus on the people we serve, the way we treat each other and the results we achieve together as a company.  Astellas is announcing an Analyst, Business Analytics opportunity in Northbrook, IL. Purpose & Scope: The Analyst, Business Analytics is responsible for conducting analysis and reporting to provide actionable insights and recommendations to Sales, Marketing, and related internal functions to support achievement of brand objectives. Name: Business Analyst II
Description: What you will do: Establish relationships with specific business partners and within IT; understand business processes to participate in the creation of IT solutions to meet business needs; participate in various efforts to support business processes. Translate abstract ideas into effective solutions that enable the business area to improve their processes and effectiveness. Determine the best way to integrate new functionality into existing business solutions. Assist the business area in determining how new technologies can be utilized to solve business problems. Main focus is on currently assigned functional area. Manage and/or coordinate and develop the requirements for small to medium projects. Understand and validate defined requirements to ensure requirements meet overall business strategy. Determine how ROI delivers added value to the business area.  . What you need to succeedCollege degree preferred or 5+ years of business analyst or IT experience or business analyst certification.Working knowledge of operational processes.Knowledge of systems development life cycle processes.SAP experience a plusUnderstanding of Project Management Methodology, Agile environment highly preferredGeneral knowledge of technical enterprise architecture.Merchandising or Ecommerce experience a plusSuperior communication skills.Ability to work in a team environment.Integrity.Sense of urgency.Personal accountability and ownership.Personal organization and attention to detail.Fundamental understanding of existing business solutions in order to Assist in integrating the existing business solutions and processes into longer term directions and plans.Enhance or replace solutions to integrate new functionality and meet business needs.Understanding of current technologies used by Ace to deliver business solutions.Strong facilitation skillsWe want to hear from you! When most people think of career opportunities with Ace Hardware, they often think of the helpful cashiers and sales associates at their local store. However, have you also considered the people behind the scenes who select, promote, ship and process the invoices for more than 75,000 products? Maybe you haven't, but we'd like you to. Because together we help our customers take care of their homes. Come find out why a career with the Ace Hardware Corporation is one of America's best kept secrets. Equal Opportunity Employer Ace Hardware Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to a policy of promoting equal employment opportunities. The company recognizes the importance of diversity and leveraging the skills and talents of all people to the mutual advantage of each individual and the organization. The company is committed to the prevention of employment discrimination related to race, religion, color, sex (including sexual harassment), gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability and military discharge, or any other action covered by federal or state laws.

Name: Business Analyst / Financial Modeler
Description: Job DescriptionWhat You’ll Do at BTS The greatest ideas in the world will die on the vine if not properly implemented. At BTS, we turn our clients’ ideas and strategies into results. We do this by designing customized learning experiences that drive innovation, alignment, and performance.  As a BTS consultant, you’ll work directly with leaders from some of the world’s leading corporations. Global 100 and 500 largest companies. You’ll learn how their business works and what their strategies are, and you’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of their senior management.  Business Simulation Developers are responsible for designing and building the business simulations that are the foundation of the learning experiences we create. These simulations are often Excel-based, using VBA tools. The developer is key to conceptualizing and brainstorming with the design team to design challenges and experiences that will elegantly simplify and get to the core dynamics and tradeoffs of executing the client’s strategy in a competitive business simulation experience. In order to design these learning experiences, you’ll interview our clients’ executives and leaders, identifying the metrics and levers that are essential to the learning program. On site at a workshop, developers are responsible for processing the simulation results and presenting them to client audiences between 15-50 key decision makers.  There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you won’t fly to the same city every week for three straight months, sitting in a spare cube at the client’s office. You’ll work on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams. You’ll travel when your team is facilitating a program. This comes out to approximately 50% of the time.  The rest of the time is spent creating the amazing experiences we provide for our clients. You’ll laugh a lot and have a lot of fun. And this is all done in a team-based setting where our entrepreneurial culture of freedom and responsibility empowers you to contribute from your first day.  Are you ready for an adventure? Read below to see if you’ve got what it takes…Required SkillsWhat We’re Looking For Curiosity. Creativity. Good listening skills. Executive presence. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.  Intellectual horsepower with strong business and financial acumen. A love for problem solving and a structured approach to scoping and developer solutions to those problems. Excel skills and experience with programming languages are big pluses. Backgrounds in engineering, finance, science, math, or economics are well-suited. We have developers from all kinds of backgrounds, work experience, and education. We love diversity and variety.  We do have a few requirements. A Bachelor’s degree. Strong communication skills. Willingness to travel as indicated above. And eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship.Job Location  Chicago, Illinois, United States  Position Type  Full-Time/Regular

Name: Analyst
Description: Analyst: Business Intelligence/Competitive IntelligenceBulletin Intelligence, Remote- U.S.Bulletin Intelligence: A news-monitoring and analysis boutique within Cision, Bulletin creates bespoke, expert-curated briefings and dashboards for approximately 150 of the most demanding clients in the world; chief executives who are household names, and their Comms and other teams. Client contracts are for as much as $1mm per year. Annual client-retention rates are typically in the mid-90% range. Bulletin was acquired by Cision in March 2017. Location: Bulletin’s primary office is in Reston, VA. The company’s analysts are able to use the company’s cloud-based software to work anywhere in the U.S. that has a high-speed internet connection. Responsibilities: Our Analysts live at the intersection of digital information, public policy and markets and apply layers of sophisticated human judgment to the information explosion in order to deliver the essence of what our clients -- a who’s who of government and corporate leaders -- need to know to start their day.  Analysts work overnight, utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.  Successful analysts distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends. Qualifications:Excellent writing and editing ability.Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis.Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams.Excellent computer skills and comfort learning advanced technical tools.Ability to work overnight and under tight deadlines.Demonstrated intellect and curiosity, often via a bachelor’s degree from a leading university; MBA, JD or industry-specific advanced degree helpful.US citizen or permanent resident.A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business. Bulletin Intelligence and Cision are Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity and sexual orientation or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Human Resources at Recruiting@Cision.com.  Company Insights:Seamless, cloud-based workComprehensive health benefitsFlexible time off (PTO) programCasual dress codeFree parkingClose to Wiehle Metro (VA)On-site gym and deli (VA)Formal quarterly reviews that facilitate your success About Cision: Cision Ltd. (NYSE: CISN) is a leading global provider of software and services to public relations and marketing communications professionals. Cision's software allows users to identify key influencers, craft and distribute strategic content, and measure meaningful impact. Cision has over 3,000 employees with offices in 15 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. For more information about its award-winning products and services, including the Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow Cision on Twitter @Cision. EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V, 41 CFR 60–1.4

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Sales & Marketing  Location: Chicago, IL  Terms: Fulltime  About Trianz  Trianz is a global professional services firm committed to enabling leaders to develop and execute operational strategies, leverage new business and technology paradigms, and achieve results expected by senior management in their organizations- predictably.  What We Stand For  Our clients are transforming their businesses, competitive strategies, product and service portfolios, customer-partner-employee interactions and their ecosystem. The cost of misses is not financial alone but a lost window of opportunity. So getting things right the first time is absolutely critical.  As a result, Trianz is focusing on three important themes in our engagement model with clients. Crystallize business impact from a top management point of viewHelp Clients achieve results from strategy-by making execution predictable through innovative execution techniquesCreate a positive, enriching partnership experience in everything we do Industries, Clients & Practices  Trianz works with clients across High Technology, Banking, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecom, e-businesses and Public Services. Most clients are Fortune 1000 organizations and our relationships are sponsored by senior leaders in Enterprise Analytics Sales, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Operations and Information Technology. We partner with our clients to address the following key service areas: CloudAnalyticsDigitizationInfrastructureSecurity POSITION SUMMARY  The primary responsibility for the Sales & Marketing Business Intelligence Analyst is to participate in the maintenance and integrity of data, reports, dashboards, and scorecards used throughout the company. Under general direction the Business Intelligence Manager, this role supports the tracking, reporting and analysis of products, promotions and marketing initiatives and provides the sales team with monthly results. This position will be responsible for assisting in efforts such as compiling data in support of marketing initiatives, creating data sets to enable sophisticated quantitative analysis, marrying internal data with external data to identify opportunities, etc. The individual in this role will partner with the business from a broad perspective, working with staff in Operations, Finance & Accounting, Sales, Marketing, Business Intelligence, and the entire Credit & Risk team to provide strategic and tactical support. a back-up to the Business Intelligence Senior Analyst.Administer weekly trigger reports on the individual product lines.Assist in the recurring production management with targeted, incisive and succinct dashboards, analysis, and supporting reports that enable data-driven decisions.Track and results of promotions.Support dealer incentive trip reporting.Ensure all recurring reporting requirements are created in a timely and accurate manner; analyze the results.Support ad hoc data requests.Collect and provide analytical support for the sales team, the commercial and consumer marketing groups, and other groups as needed.Collect and provide the sales and marketing groups with report packages on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.Ensure the company continues to evolve in its data integrity, analysis, and reporting capabilities in an environment of continuous improvement.Maintains a current awareness and understanding of appropriate banking laws, regulations, internal policies and procedures, and to comply fully with those laws, regulations, policies and procedures.Bachelor’s degreeSuccessful candidate will have 2+ years of financial services industry experience, preferably in consumer financeExcel, MS Access, and VBA expertise is a mustTechnical hands-on experience with data tools such as Business Objects, Cognos, SAS strongly JOB REQUIREMENTS  Experience/Knowledge/Other Skills Excellent analytical skillsAbility to quickly interpret business requests related to existing and new reportingReport, dashboard, and scorecard design/implementation experience preferably using data visualization software (e.g. – Tableau)Ability to handle multiple projects on short deadlinesGood verbal and written communication skills Competencies  Group Level: Professional Superior analytical skills and ability to innovate and create solutions to obstaclesA performance-oriented, resourceful and competitive individual with a high sense of urgencyAble to prioritize analytical requests in face of changing priorities and competing demandsGood organization and project management skillsUnderstanding of financial services data platforms and ability to quickly and efficiently integrate appropriate data sources into analyses and initiativesA good listener, capable of understanding the restraints and possibilities of the business, able to translate Name: Analyst
Description: Please only respond if you have previous experience working for an investment bank. No recruiter calls will be accepted.Job Description Dresner Partners, a leading middle-market investment bank based in Chicago is currently seeking to hire an experienced investment banking analyst. Dresner offers our analysts the opportunity to gain extensive experience across multiple industries and transaction types including mergers & acquisitions, financings, restructuring and valuations. Analysts at Dresner work on small deal teams and interface directly with senior-level client executives and bankers. The analyst will work directly with clients, private equity firms and other institutional investors. The investment banking analyst program is a highly competitive two to three year program and analysts who exceed our expectations may be invited to remain with the firm as an associate. Location: Chicago, ILResponsibilities: Preparing presentations for new business development Industry research Extensive financial modelingConfidential Information Memorandum preparationManagement presentationsClient interactionData room management Qualifications: Minimum of one year investment banking experienceStrong undergraduate academic performance An undergraduate degree in finance, accounting or economics is preferred but not necessaryStrong accounting and financial statement analysis skills Strong written and verbal communication skillsAdvanced Microsoft Office skills, including Excel, PowerPoint and WordThe ability to work a highly demanding schedule in an entrepreneurial environmentDresner Partners is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst - Product Owner
Description: Job Description:The Product Team is seeking a Senior Business Analyst (Product Owner) to lead local and remote development delivery initiatives. The ideal candidate has experience in the financial services sector or product management exposure with an equivalent balance of motivation to quickly learn the needs of our users. Name: Product Business - Senior Delivery Analyst
Description: Product Business - Senior Delivery Analyst  21-Nov-2018 Position Summary The Senior Delivery Analyst will play a critical role in delivering, implementing, and supporting BCG's client facing end-to-end reorganization software solution, OrgBuilderTM– taking direction from senior business leaders in our Practice Areas. Key activities will include gathering requirements from internal and external clients, advising them on the application's usage best practices, and recommending processes to optimize the business value delivered by the application; then sourcing and preparing data, managing required client processes changes, overseeing installation, setting up, configuring the application according to the requirements, and training client's end users.  The Senior Delivery Analyst will interact directly with clients and must understand and be able to navigate the clients' requirements. He or she should be able to quickly learn methodologies and approaches used in the software, understand data powering it and learn analytical approaches used to transform data into business insights. This person should also be able to work with the BCG team and clients to co-create new approaches for further development of software solutions. On the solution deployment side this person must be able to determine what is needed for compliance with client's business needs, security policies, deployment, and support, and leverage the right resources to complete the implementation with the highest level of customer satisfaction. When confronted with technical challenges, he or she must work with the BCG technical team and working together find creative, economical, and elegant solutions within the application's technical specifications. Job ID7472BRCompany Information The Boston Consulting Group (BCG) is a global management consulting firm and the world’s leading advisor on business strategy. We partner with clients from the private, public, and not-for-profit sectors in all regions to identify their highest-value opportunities, address their most critical challenges, and transform their enterprises. Our customized approach combines deep insight into the dynamics of companies and markets with close collaboration at all levels of the client organization. This ensures that our clients achieve sustainable competitive advantage, build more capable organizations, and secure lasting results. Founded in 1963, BCG is a private company with offices in more than 90 cities in 50 countries. For more information, please visit bcg.com. Youll work with external clients to gather business needs and determine how TMP products and services meet those needs. Name: Senior Business Analyst - CHI
Description: DescriptionTeam Daugherty is looking to add a Business Analyst to the Chicago team! This individual will be involved in the creation, design and build of new business models and, upon completion, integration and operation of them. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activity and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for the following: Serving as knowledge owner for a single system or business process area.Working with a team to analyze, diagnose and resolve unpredictable and varied problems using diverse methods and tools.Advising client users on application design alternatives and business process change opportunities.Connecting user needs to emerging technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results.Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology.Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts.Identifying, addressing, managing and escalating risks and issues within a project. Name: Analyst, Business Applications
Description: Vista Consulting Group helps drive value creation through operational excellence, and the tip of the VCG spear is the Business Applications team (BOSS). The BOSS team gets involved in every new portfolio company early in the investment in order to help the company transition to best practice processes by implementing a best practice systems footprint. BOSS is widely recognized as one of the most important steps in the entire value creation process.  We are hiring entry-level Business Applications Analysts responsible for helping Vista companies manage the migration to new business systems (including CRM, ERP, CPQ, marketing automation, and others). The analyst will partner with employees of the portfolio company to map existing business process flows and determine future state processes and systems design that will enable the company to implement Vista Best Practices. Business Applications Analysts will participate in an in-depth, rigorous, and rewarding training experience which will prepare them for delivering successful outcomes for the Vista family of companies. Duties and ResponsibilitiesSupport an implementation track (e.g., Sales, Finance, Support, etc.) within Business Applications transformation projectsBecome an expert on Vista Best Practices and how VCG implements business systems to enable them, including creating workflows, reports, and dashboards requiredPartner with project team to map future state data flows and determine data transformation requirements to meet future system needsBuild relationships with and guide working teams at portfolio companies and within VCGWork with the VCG Program Manager to develop and deliver recommendations for business process improvements and support implementation of recommendationsSupport business users in developing training on the new systems and help train end usersParticipate in internal initiatives to improve VCG and Business Applications tools and processesBachelors or Masters degree; all majors considered.Possess strong presentation and group facilitation skillsStrong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage to a tight scheduleExcellent problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills, including using ExcelStrong ability to ascertain tasks from open discussion, develop a plan of action, and guide others through executionWillingness to travel 2-3 nights per week on a consistent basis, with longer and/or weekend travel required at critical periodsPrior experience in CRM, ERP and/or experience with SQL a plus

Description: Waystar is the combination of Navicure and ZirMed, the two top-rated providers of revenue cycle technologies. Waystar brings together the industrys two highest-rated organizations and offers cloud-based, end-to-end revenue cycle technology to its more than 440,000 providers, 21,000 healthcare organization, and 550 hospitals and health system clients. Waystar technology solutions simplify and unify the revenue cycle to enable healthcare organizations to collect more and reduce the cost and stress of managing payer reimbursement, patient billing and payments. If youre looking to advance your career with a one of the most respected and fastest growing companies in healthcare IT, youve come to the right place. If you are eager for the rewards of contributing to one of healthcare technologies fastest growing companies, were eager to talk with you!What is the purpose of this position?We are searching for an experienced, brilliant, driven Business Analyst with experience working in a provider, Healthcare IT or consultancy setting. The Business Analyst will serve as a business contact for our clients and is responsible for client satisfaction by building and maintaining lasting relationships and providing best-in-class service, resources and support. You must have hands-on experience implementing or supporting technology solutions preferably in the hospital revenue cycle space, with critical thinking and problem solving skills. As a successful candidate for this Business Analyst role you will establish yourself as a trusted advisor to the client and can approach problem-solving challenges independently, with strong attention to detail, who enjoys working in a fast-paced and collaborative team-based environment. Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Salem Tech, a division of The Salem Group, is currently hiring a Business Analyst for a contract position at our client in Chicago, IL.  We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst who has experience working in customer-facing roles, providing consultancy and analysis services on a broad range of assignments.  As a Business Analyst you will work in our team of analysts on large and commercially important projects. Together with your team you will perform the business and software requirements analysis for external customers. Your team will also identify business opportunities and product features for products and work with an agile development team to deliver feature rich solutions.  Successful candidates will need to have the following in terms of experience:  ? Strong experience in a business consultancy or equivalent role  ? Good awareness and understanding of commercial bid and tendering processes  ? A proven background in working on software development projects in a requirements analysis role  ? Can articulate examples of large multiple system implementation projects in a customer environment  ? Experience of working as the analyst in an agile software delivery team  ? Experience of working on multiple and varied projects, delivering a variety of software applications, with lottery or gaming experience being an advantage  And will have the following in terms of skills and knowledge:  ? Perform the business, process and software requirements analysis on large projects  ? Analyze products, suppliers and competitors and advise on which actions to take  ? Possess a variety of analysis techniques that can be adapted to suit different projects and customers  ? Define the logical architecture for large product developments and implementations  ? Consult and advise customers on a variety of topics  ? Have an excellent knowledge of digital channels and e-commerce products and services  ? Have a good understanding of software/application architecture and design methods  ? Have sufficient technical skills in order to contribute to the design and architecture of technology solutions  In order to complement our team, it’s important to us that new team members have the following personal characteristics:  ? Excellent interpersonal skills  ? A professional, credible and measured demeanor  ? Engaging, influential, dynamic and authoritative  ? Flexible, pragmatic and capable of adapting to customer and project needs  ? Capable of operating in wide range of environments, cultures and customer situations  EEO  The Salem Group considers applications for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status or any other legally protected status.

Name: Structured Credit, Analyst - CHI
Description: Fitch Ratings is seeking a Credit Analyst to join its Structured Credit group. The candidate will be responsible for assigning and reviewing ratings on various structured credit transaction types including collateralized loan obligations (CLOs), which involves modeling cash flows, legal documentation review, analyzing collateral, preparing credit committee reports, and communicating credit opinions to investors and issuers.  The ideal candidate will possess:  · Over one year of experience with Structured Finance, CLOs, or leveraged loans  · Excellent proficiency in Excel  · Strong quantitative and analytical thinking  · Superb attention to detail and time management skills  · Strong communication skills  · Working knowledge of VBA and SQL is a plus  · Bachelor's degree in finance or a business related field with significant coursework in Finance  Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.  For more information about this policy, please visit the code of ethics and conduct page - http://www.fitchratings.com/web/en/dynamic/about-us/code-of-ethics-and-conduct.jsp

Name: Manager, Business Systems Analysts
Description: Start a Rewarding Career with AlliantWhy Alliant? We’re not a typical financial institution – we’re better. We’re an innovative, strengths-based, highly-engaged group of professionals that are committed to our company and the communities we serve. We love to recognize and celebrate each other and get to wear jeans every day.  Over 90% of our employees say we are a great workplace that is focused on our mission, vision and the future of banking. What makes this role rewarding? You will be responsible for managing a team of project-based Technical Analysts and Business Analysts who support enterprise programs and projects. This individual is also responsible for leading and enhancing best practices and consistent technical and business analysis processes, artifacts and tools. Additionally, drive the requirements gathering process to ensure that the business and technical needs are accurately captured and participating on enterprise projects. Work involves managing multiple projects and initiatives while working collaboratively with stakeholders and business process improvement team. Resources to do the job require reliance on in-depth knowledge of credit union products and services with project management and relationship management skills. The individual must have the ability to understand, conceptualize, and model effective and efficient business processes that drive employee and member advocacy. Name: Technical EDI Healthcare Systems Analyst –
Description: Title Technical EDI Healthcare Systems AnalystSalary DOELocation Chicago, ILJob Information The EDI Lead SystemsAnalyst provides systems analysis guidance and consultation on the most complex systems. Leads or participates in the analysis of existing business rules, processes, and systems to recommend process and system enhancements to improve business performance and maximize the effectiveness of available technology.  Primary role and responsibility is to be the Subject Matter Expert on EDI, Electronic Data Interchange, for the company. Experience with X12 Standards, particularly X12 Companion Guide and X12 transactions sets would be the secondary skill to have. And, lastly experience with Tibco would be a great bonus.  Other responsibilities include: Acting as a liaison between Business Analysts and IT technical team,  Develops sizing estimates for project requests and determines feasibility of implementing new systems or modifying existing systems Documents complex system requirements and oversees documentation of the technical solution for the most complex systems.  Supports the development of technical specifications and provides ongoing assistance and consultation to software developers and software testing engineers to resolve problems to ensure that the applications software meets the client’s requirements.  Manages, tracks, and communicates status of technical requirements documentation. Manages changes to baseline technical requirements documentation. Works closely with Application Developers to help create proofs of concept and alternative solutions to create, maintain and enhance business value. Educates Business Analysts and stakeholders about the underlying capabilities of the technology stack and helps developers understand the business impacts of technical decisions.  Performs team administrative duties including status reporting. Assists manager or supervisor with other administrative tasks as requested.  Provides ongoing client support for technical system questions and problems; serves as subject matter expert for designated systems; analyzes and researches more complex system problems, coordinating with vendors and other parties as necessary, and tracks them to resolution; develops, documents, and communicates alternative workarounds for system defects until system solutions can be implemented. Supports the installation of software releases, including critical and emergency installs. Provides ongoing assistance to software developers and testers to resolve more complex defects during the development and testing process. Tracks and manages open technical solution issues and plans for their resolution. As needed, develops and executes test plans and documents test results. QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Required Experience, Skills & Abilities:  This position requires a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Business or relevant work experience in systems analysis/design and 6+ years of direct SystemsAnalyst experience.  • Advanced understanding of business processes related to systems supported.  Recognized as true systems subject matter expert (EDI, X12 Tibco )  • Advanced knowledge of and demonstrated experience with current relevant  technologies used in the development, implementation, and support of software  solutions. (e.g.., Pega, Tibco, Amberpoint, Webservices, XML, X12,Oracle  SQL, MQ Series, Java, C++, etc)  • Experience in accurately modeling requirements using at least three or more of the  following: State Diagrams, System Context Diagrams, User Interface Prototype, Activity  Diagram, Workflow Diagrams, External Interface Diagrams, Dataflow Diagrams.  • Experience with complex systems projects. Includes demonstrated experience with  development of technical solutions and technical specification documentation.  Demonstrated ability to lead projects with limited prior system/business knowledge of  affected system.  • Demonstrated leadership skills. Experience with coaching/mentoring other  associates as well as leading small teams of junior analysts.  • Demonstrated experience in systems design with working knowledge of multiple  formalized DBMSs.  • Strong understanding of systems solution architecture and data architecture  processes and practices. Preferred: • Experience with the health insurance industry.  • Experience with the development, implementation, and maintenance of large-scale systems, preferably across multiple hardware and software platforms.  • Experience with business analysis and requirements (business, user, and  technical – functional/non-functional) development and management) processes and  tools.  • Experience with software testing and/or defect tracking and testing tools.  • Experience with relational databases, to include development of queries and reports.  • Prior experience as an application programmer or developer.  • Prior experience with project management and/or project management software.  • Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)  Two years minimum working knowledge related to X12 Companion Guide  Three years minimum experience with X12 transactions sets (834/835/837/837D.Apply Here

Name: Product Analyst

understand business objectives as they relate to project goalsRequirements:Bachelor degree or equivalent business experience in math, economics, actuarial, or statistics emphasisStrong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail and accuracyStrong written and verbal communication skillsMust be able to work effectively as a team member as well as independentlyMust be highly organized with excellent time management skills and an ability to synthesize informationAbility to determine accuracy of data and reasonableness of results and identify and resolve errorsFamiliarity with Excel spreadsheets, Access database skills are preferredA background or understanding of pricing and/or underwritingChubb offers a competitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits package including life, health and dental, vision, a generous retirement savings plan, disability coverage, stock purchase plan, flexible spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, and business casual dress. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst Client-savvy professional with strong analytical skills, a background planning robust web applications, and exposure to user-centric design methodologies. Candidate should be able to work effectively with clients, developers, peers, and management. Strong interpersonal, client service, oral and written communications, organizational, and task management skills are a must. In addition, the candidate should have a general understanding of web standards, usability, UI design and be familiar with web 2.0 capabilities. ResponsibilitiesBusiness Analysis. Candidate will be expected to lead or assist in the day-to-day management of multiple client-facing sites running on a shared web platform. Candidate will become familiar with Tukaiz service offerings and client business needs so as to develop timely practical solutions for client requests and efficient account management, including, potentially, platform improvements. Candidate must be able to clearly communicate solutions to audiences of varying technical expertise. Candidate should be able to translate solutions into design specifications and software requirements for our development team in the form of user stories with acceptance criteria. Candidate should understand the software development process well enough to provide guidance and recommendations as well as be capable of assisting developers with the proper interpretation of requirements. Project Management. Candidate must be strong in guiding, documenting and tracking bug fixes and feature requests through the project lifecycle. Candidate should possess the ability to follow project change control guidelines, track deliverables, and identify risk factors and issues. Candidate will be expected to manage client expectations while balancing the competing demands of client needs, technological constraints, project timelines, and developer performance. Time management and collaboration skills are key. Quality Assurance. Candidate will be responsible for ensuring client needs are met as expected by working as a part of our Quality Assurance group to build suitable test strategies and methodologies as well as by performing User Acceptance Testing to improve developer performance and reduce defects during the QA cycle. Client Service. Candidate will provide cheerful, solution-focused support over phone and email for client contacts. Candidate should be comfortable leading presentations to win projects and to show projects underway. Candidate will be expected to conduct internal training sessions to prepare the test group for QA cycles and may be asked to conduct pre-/post-implementation client training sessions as well. Technical RequirementsBachelors degree or equivalent professional experienceUnderstanding of project management & requirements gatheringAbility to write clear, concise and effective documentationFamiliarity with concepts of web-based software applicationsStrong interpersonal presentation and communication skillsExposure to Agile programming methodology is a plusExposure to QA test procedure development, maintenance, and execution is a plusPMP / PMI Certification is a plus Applicants must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents. We are unable to provide visa sponsorship.Company DescriptionTukaiz is a results-driven marketing services production company based in Franklin Park, IL. Founded in 1963, Tukaiz is a family-owned and operated company providing products and services to organizations nationwide. The infrastructure of Tukaiz includes services comprised of creative and advertising, software development, print production, inventory management and fulfillment services.  Tukaiz is a passionate marketing partner focused on solving problems for small to large national organizations through centralized, relevant, and technology-driven solutions.  Tukaiz is centrally located in the Chicago land area with over 250,000 square feet and nearly 150 employees.  We dramatically improve speed to market  We enhance organizations abilities to implement relevant and timely communications  We provide production efficiencies that reduce costs and help businesses remain competitive

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTCS Education System is seeking a Business Analyst to join the IT Applications department.  The Business Analyst works to improve overall operations efficiency and effectiveness in efforts to grow the organization. The BA applies strong analytical/problem solving skills to work with stakeholders to find what is really needed to improve work flow, data sharing, and reporting. Efforts include working to identify tasks that are consistent with overall organizational goals and then "solutioning" for the best path to take given new technologies and capabilities. This further means working with stakeholders to ensure smooth interactions between parties involved and the documentation of functional, non-functional, and transitional requirements. This is followed through work to include execution that ensures proper implementation of efforts with ongoing monitoring so they remain consistent with overall goals. Position responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Uses professional concepts in accordance with company objectives to solve complex problems in creative and effective waysDemonstrates expertise in functional area business processes and understands assigned and cross-functional areas.Independently initiates, identifies and coordinates the analysis of complex client needs in project areas such as: new/existing business operating models, innovative approaches to solutions support, market research of emerging or available product functionality and operational readiness assessment.Identifies opportunities for increasing business efficiency through improved manual and automated process systems.Coordinates the development of comprehensive business cases with cost, service, and benefit dimensions of proposed projects that are used at management and executive levels for funding and scope decisions.Acts as project lead in the coordination of solution development and the implementation of the final product/service.Acts as a liaison between business clients and technical staff and/or with development staff throughout the development life cycle.Position Requirements: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Below are the minimum requirements of the education, experience, knowledge, and skills required to competently perform in this position. Experience education industry a plusStrong analytical and technical skillsExperience with CRM systems (Salesforce, Dynamics 365 preferred).Experience with Document Imaging system a plus.Strong understanding of technical support processes and troubleshooting.Strong customer relations background.Experience with SQL a plus.Position Qualifications:BA/BS in related fieldTwo to three years of CRM supportThree to five years of systems support or business analysis Company DescriptionFor more information, visit TCS Education System  At TCS Education System we make it a priority to foster a sense of community. We believe that feeling connected to the organization and fellow colleagues is vital to our employees’ well-being and helps them to feel fulfilled in their daily lives. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst with SAP implementation. Location : Spring field, IL Duration : 1 year Contract Job description : BAs will perform the following services related to the implementation of the SAP system to support HFS financial and accounting operations:BAs shall conduct an analysis of the migration to the SAP solution of the HFS accounting system, the Programmatic and Administrative Accounting System (PAAS) and related subsystems.The BAs will work with the HFS team members on General Ledger (GL), Accounts Payable (AP), Asset Management (AM), Procurement (PR), Project Systems (PS), Funds Management (FM), Controlling (CO), Supplier Resource Management (SRM) and Public Sector Collections and Disbursements (PSCD) modules emphasizing knowledge transfer regarding functionality of the SAP system and procedures.The BAs will review SAP design documents and identify functional and technical gaps in the prior design activities, support development of programming logic to convert legacy data into SAP, assist in the development of extracts for data cleansing for interfaced systems, and support the design of interfaces and reports.The BAs will work with HFS personnel to develop SAP user procedures, training materials, review policies and accounting procedures and process and prepare end user documentation for SAP modules.The BAs will work with the state-wide ERP SAP team and the Department of Innovation and Technology (DoIT) to identify problems with SAP programs and offer technical solutions, and facilitate project rollout and implementation.The BAs will coordinate with HFS staff during the rollout and implementation (Go-live) of ERP. The BAs will participate in post implementation activities and tasks that are developed jointly by HFS and the state-wide ERP project management team.The BAs will review workflows within the Bureau of Fiscal Operations (BFO), evaluate alignment with SAP processes and provide suggestions for improvements. The BAs will identify backlogs and bottle necks related to accounting functions and activities and recommend solutions prior to and after Go-live.The BAs will assess staffing needs based upon SAP systems impact on general operations and provide recommendations. The BAs will directly support Go-Live and Post Go-Live activities by triaging user issues to provide immediate assistance to production issues, providing continued training and education for HFS staff, evaluating performance in each SAP functional area, and providing work around solutions to issues encountered during Go-live or Post Go-live operations. The BAs will provide the first line of support for HFS during Go-live.The BAs will assist in the evaluation of the SAP system*s performance after Go-live including, but not limited to data integrity, responsiveness of system-speed, business, procedural, financial control, and legal and regulatory requirements.The BAs will attend regular team meetings as well as meetings with the state-team, the Program Manager (PM) and the systems integrator.The BAs will use advanced technical skills in Microsoft Excel, Access, Crystal, Web Intelligence (WEBI) and SQL software to develop queries and reports using HANA views from the following HFS information technology systems: Enterprise-wide Data Warehouse (EDW) ,the (SAMS) and the ERP/SAP accounting modules related to financial reporting, federal draws and federal claiming for the Bureau of Federal Finance (BFF) and the Bureau of Fiscal Operations (BFO). The BAs will map changes to support HANA views, interface designs and system componentsThe BAs will plan, develop and implement processes and procedures to effectively implement the fixed asset module of the ERP system and conversion from Warehouse Asset Management System (WAMS).The BAs will provide assistance during User Acceptance Training (UAT) and Operational Readiness Training (ORT), including support for HFS staff.Perform an analysis review post implementation and provide recommendations.Provide functional consulting support for HFSIdentify SAP defects and gaps for input into the Problem Resolution Log.Provide Transition Support; post-implementation documentation, monitoring and assessment.Evaluate system performance after Go-LiveIdentify SAP defects and gaps for Input into the Problem Resolution LogMILESTONES AND DELIVERABLES:The Vendor shall submit timely, complete and accurate reports or documents as set forth below at the request of HFS. Reports shall be in a Microsoft Office format or other format as agreed upon by HFS and Vendor. Reports for the following in a form and interval to be determined by HFS (as needed):* A weekly Project State Report documenting hours worked and services provided.* Functional and Technical gaps in the prior design activities.* Programming logic to convert legacy data into SAP.* User procedure manuals.* Updated accounting procedures and processes.* Training materials.* End user documentation of SAP modules.* Recommendations to modify the BFO workflow to align with SAP processes, including staffing needs based upon SAP system impact on operations.* Issues and Backlogs related to accounting functions and activities and recommend solutions prior to and after Go-live, including work around solutions.* Mapping changes to support HANA views, interface designs and system components.* System problems and recommended solutions.* New processes in areas of implementation for each module and functional area* Post implementation review results and recommendations System performance evaluation after Go-live.VENDOR / STAFF SPECIFICATIONS: The Vendor shall provide resumes for the BAs with the bid document. The resumes must demonstrate that the BAs meet all education and experience requirements outlined below. If the resumes are inadequate, the Vendor*s bid will be deemed non-responsive.Qualifications of the Business Analysts:Requires minimum of three (3) years of experience implementing SAP financial and cost accounting modules.Requires Bachelor*s Degree or higher in IT or Finance related field.Requires minimum of two (2) years* experience with SAP ERP implementations at federal, state, or local government entities.Requires advanced level technical skills in Microsoft Excel, SQL and SAP business object web intelligence software; and knowledge of Data warehouse structure and HANA views for developing SAP queries and reports.Prefers* 1 year of experience with state government accounting systems, processes, methods and procedures, Comptroller*s State-wide Accounting System (SAMS), HFS Program and Administrative Accounting System (PAAS), DHS Consolidated Accounting and Reporting System (CARS) or other government accounting systems. - provided by Dice  Business analyst, JAD Sessions, Retirement  Associated topics: analyst, analyze, business finance, business intelligence, forecasting, law, legal, refinement, regulation, strategy

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Business Intelligence Analyst Location  Chicago Job Department  TradingApply NowTitle: Business Intelligence AnalystLocation: ChicagoDepartment: TradingPosition SummaryAs part of the Equity Options Market Making Team, you will work with traders, software engineers, and partners to translate business needs and data into reports, and dashboards that can be used in decision making. You will be part of a small team with high exposure to partners and high level management. Your work will include gathering needs from team members that will be essential to helping us improve our trading strategies. You will take these needs and provide the team members with dashboards and reports in Tableau or SQL. You will be responsible for maintaining and optimizing any data sources used in these reports. You will also have the opportunity to slice and dice data and have your discoveries contribute to business decisions.Our small team and flat structure encourages you to flex your creativity, allows you to obtain quick feedback, and gives you the opportunity to take on increasing responsibilities.Responsibilities· Gather business needs from traders, software engineers, and partners.· Design dashboards, reports, visualizations, and alerts that drive business decisions· Create and maintain data sources· Scan reports for anomalies and opportunities and provide business recommendations· Identify and communicate observations to senior management and team members which could contribute directly to the bottom line. Qualifications· Bachelor’s degree in financial engineering, computer science, finance, economics, mathematics, or related field· History of academic excellence· Strong analytical skills· Problem solver· Knowledge of SQL· Experience with Tableau or other BI software· Ability to gather and analyze large sets of data· Statistical background· Ability to work well with others in a group· Ability to communicate effectively· Ability to be creative with visualizations that display a lot of information in a small spaceAbout WolverineFounded in 1994, the Wolverine companies comprise a number of diversified financial institutions specializing in proprietary trading, asset management, order execution services, and technology solutions. We are recognized as a market leader in derivatives valuation, trading, and value-added order execution across global equity, options, and futures markets. With a focus on innovation, achievement, and integrity, we take pride in serving the interests of both our clients and colleagues. The Wolverine companies are headquartered in Chicago with offices in New York and San Francisco and a proprietary trading affiliate office located in London.Visa sponsorship is not available.

Name: Fraud Data Analyst
Description: The Opportunity Vivid Seats is the largest independent online ticket marketplace, sending tens of millions of fans to live events every day. Experiences Matter. The importance of them is expanding rapidly as the industry continues to grow year over year. Working at Vivid Seats puts you front and center at the opportunity to scale our best in class platform that allow our fans to sit closer and see more.  At Vivid Seats, you will have the opportunity to work with flexibility and the speed of a startup while operating at massive, profitable scale. We keep our teams lean, giving every single employee direct accountability to creating a positive ticket buying experience. We are relentless and move quickly to release new features and content to the site and mobile app daily. Your ideas are heard and implemented, your hard work rewarded. Being a part of our team means that have the ability to drive impact and own the innovation that allows us to connect our tens and millions of unique monthly users to the memorable experiences that live events create.  Our Risk Analyst works between the Fraud and Risk team, Legal, and senior management to monitor for fraud and mitigate any issues by using best practices to identify and stop fraudulent transactions.  You are the company's first line of defense against criminal activity; assisting in the prevention, detection, and reporting of suspicious activity and other unusual high-risk issues using a variety of tools, including Spotfire, Excel, Accertify, and SQL. We are looking for you to bring your analytical expertise to improve our existing tools and reporting.  ResponsibilitiesIdentify fraud patterns, create and track fraud metrics and implement accurate, data driven policies and review methodologies to prevent attacksWrite SQL queries to extract, transform, and aggregate data and provide key insights on performance and assist management in the early identification of fraud trendsConduct ROI analysis on fraud tools and services and use results to provide recommendations, reduce operations costs, and increase operations efficiencyPerform investigative analysis using SQL and Spotfire dashboard toolsStay up to date on fraud prevention techniques and emerging trendsImprove and enhance database table structures and data collection methods to increase reporting efficiencyTo be successful, you’ll need3+ years in an analytical roleAt least two years of experience reviewing and investigating alerts, flagging unusual and suspicious activity, including fraud patternsProven experience with advanced Excel and strong math competenciesFamiliarity with transaction monitoring systems and proceduresExperience conducting enhanced customer due diligence and ongoing monitoringExpert in managing multiple projects simultaneously with a strong results/goal orientationCreativity, fearlessness and an unwavering commitment to putting the customer first, elevating your team and ownership over outcomesLocation: 225 W Randolph, 30th floor  Chicago, IL 60606
