Name: Support Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As an Associate Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Your primary task will be to provide level one support to customers who contact the Oracle Solution Center and maintain high level of customer satisfaction while meeting guidelines (mostly through electronic means).  Work involves some problem solving with assistance and guidance in understanding and applying company policies and procedures. As this is an entry-level technical position at Oracle, a technical degree is preferred i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA. OR functional degree technical higher degree or in lieu of degree may substitute 4 years professional experience & professional certification (i.e., CNE, MCSE, CPA, Oracle, etc.). Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.About UsOracle  Textura Payment Management (TPM) is a cloud-based software service that  streamlines the construction billing and payment process. It is the first of  its kind in the industry, and since 2004 has helped clients manage $500B in  construction more efficiently and with less risk. TPM is offered within the  Construction and Engineering Global Business Unit (CEGBU) vertical at Oracle  alongside many other products that serve this fast-growing industry.  The  Textura Client Services team is uniquely responsible for all aspects of the  client lifecycle, including sales support, implementation, account and  relationship management, and ongoing support of the TPM application. You will  collaborate with all levels of the Client Services group, as well as the  Production Support and Product teams, to deliver TPM to our clients and  support project implementations by ensuring delivery timelines are followed  and issues are tracked and escalated as needed.  Detailed Description and  Job Requirements  As  a Client Services Support Analyst, you will work directly with Oracle’s  clients and collaborate with team members to ensure our clients are  successful in their use of TPM. By providing exceptional service over  the phone, through e-mail, and occasionally in person at client locations,  you will help our clients improve productivity, mitigate risk and enhance project  communication through our cloud-based solution, Oracle Textura Payment  Management. The Client Services team is a fast paced, energetic, ever  changing environment. We are goal oriented and driven to exceed client  expectations. With that, come many opportunities for growth including career  development support and exposure to a thriving industry!  Key responsibilities  include Answer support calls/emails  and work with clients to fully understand, troubleshoot and resolve  issuesAssist your team with the  implementation of the Oracle Textura Payment Management solution for  both new and existing clientsLead web-based training for  both new and current Oracle clientsWork with team members to  identify, define, prioritize, and implement new system functionalityLead internal initiatives  within Client Services teamWork closely with cross  departmental teams to resolve issues in a timely mannerDemonstrate initiative to  taking on increasingly challenging projects Skills and  Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in information  systems, business, communications or related area of studyEntry level (0-3 years)  experience directly servicing clients via phone / email / in personPreferred experience  providing technical support and training on software systemsEntry level technical  troubleshooting and analytical skillsBasic high-level understanding of Accounting processesProficient in Microsoft Office suite (specifically Excel, Word,  Outlook)Professional written and verbal communication skillsAbility to solve complex  problems under pressureConstruction industry  knowledge helpful, but not requiredAbility and willingness to  travel infrequently (up to 5  )Oracle is an Equal  Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive  consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex,  national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected  veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Rush St. Chicago, IL 60611-2030Hours:Full timeDescription:Be part of our mission. The Archdiocese of Chicago (“the Archdiocese”), the third largest Catholic Archdiocese in the United States, serves more than 2.2 million Catholics in 344 parishes in Cook and Lake Counties. The Archdiocese's 217 elementary and secondary schools comprise the largest U.S. private school system, and have garnered more U.S. Department of Education Blue Ribbon Awards than any system of any type. The Archdiocese, pastored by Cardinal Blase J. Cupich, has more than 15,000 employees. In addition, we offer paid vacation, holiday, sick and personal time.If you are interested in being considered for this opening, please visit the list of open positions on AppliTrack. Please complete a letter of interest, a profile, or submit your resume.  Thank you for your interest in the Archdiocese of Chicago.Return to Pastoral Center Job Opportunities

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Do you want to have an impact one of an organization’s key strategic initiatives? We are looking for a talented and entrepreneurial Business Analyst to join the Buy Product Leadership team. This individual will contribute to building out our next generation Connected System platform by working closely with our engineering team to take ideas from concept to delivery. If you are passionate about unlocking “big data”, read on. Key Responsibilities:Manage Strategy - Collaborate with product leadership and technology for the strategic vision, roadmap planning, and prioritization in order to maximize Nielsen revenue and global client value and for internal Nielsen operations and technology efficiency and effectiveness.company.  - Support Product management’s alignment on requirements and acceptance criteria between Tech, Product and Ops cross-functional and global teams  - Identify areas of improvement using feedback from User Acceptance Testing, dashboard and metrics, then propose solutions and plan for implementation. Manage Requirements - Manage key stakeholders to understand, analyze, and elicit the business needs and technical design and solutions for the Connected System Platform (CSP), in order to enable Nielsen to develop and establish a new platform to better serve its clients and the industry.  - Own readiness of documentation for functional & nonfunctional requirements, service-level agreements, high-level design and change requests in order to ensure clarity for development and delivery.  - Write user stories and acceptance criteria based on user base feedback Plan and Validate Delivery - Oversee and understand technical design, systems development and testing to ensure requirements are met and impact to users and features are understood.  - Support and execute product’s feature acceptance testing  - Provide support to Project Managers to ensure projects meet required timelines and deliverables  - Support client and internal user adoption of Connected System platform capabilities. Knowledge & SkillsAbility to effectively lead and influence multiple levels of an organization across global and functional boundaries (Product, Technology, Operations, etc.).  - Strong oral and written communication skills including catering your communication to your audience (strategically with Product/Business leads and technically with Engineers/Tech), and building interpersonal relationships.  - Proven organization and time management skills (ability to prioritize workload, multitask and meet deadlines).  - Proven track record of evaluating big-picture strategic approaches and communicating vision, working directly with clients to define technology solutions that enable their business objectives, ability to facilitate group discussion and build consensus and making significant contributions to team efforts.  - Proficient at complex business process modeling and data modeling concepts.  - Ability to work independently with little supervision and direct the work of others.  - Passion and enthusiasm for learning and innovating  - Possesses solid working knowledge ETL/ELT processes, relevant technology concepts (e.g. relational databases, cloud/web-based architectures, etc.), Business Intelligence concepts (e.g. spreadsheets, reporting, querying software, OLAP, dashboards and data mining) and tech development management tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence, Swagger, Github, APIGEE, etc.)Education & ExperienceBA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical discipline or equivalent experience.4+ years experience in business/systems analysis, and/or application design & development.3+ years prior experience in full systems development life cycle on multiple concurrent projects (following agile or waterfall practices). #LI-US

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:This position is accountable for providing leadership and business analysis to managers and business owners for projects and ongoing process improvement. The business analyst performs needs assessments, feasibility analyses, and requirements gathering, and prepares basic cost/benefit analyses. S/he negotiates agreement and commitment by facilitating communication between business units and IT from initial gathering of requirements through implementation. S/he provides business analysis leadership in the planning and execution of process and technology projects. S/he identifies process improvement opportunities. The business analyst is responsible for completing assigned activities and projects on schedule according to cost, benefit, and quality objectives..Primary functionsActs as a resource for colleagues to lead projects, document requirements, manage risks and resources, and deliver solutionsSolves complex problems by designing optimal solutions to best satisfy business requirementsWorks collaboratively with business leaders and IT to achieve objectivesJob ResponsibilitiesProvide leadership to assigned projects that are broad in scope or deep in complexity operating through staff in a project environment. Work collaboratively with business resources, IT, and business analysts for the purpose of needs assessment, work direction, and issue resolution.Analyze business operations to understand strengths and weaknesses and perceived and unperceived needs, and identify improvement opportunities in the three areas of people, process, and technology. Balance all three and ensure each is optimized appropriately in conjunction with the others.Exercise initiative and creativity in seeking solutions to business issues and problems. Consult with key stakeholders in understanding the impact of process or technology changes, evaluate alternatives, and design solutions.Oversee development of requirements, and work with steering committees, business owners, and project teams to prioritize activities and estimate resources. Participate in vendor negotiations and contract development. Share responsibility for business results.Effectively utilize the Requirements Management, System Development, and Project Management methodologies to deliver assigned activities which meet business and project goals and objectives. Use technical concepts and techniques such as business process modeling, context diagrams, use cases, and state transition diagrams to scope, communicate, and document requirements.Oversee the effective and efficient use of technology to support business process modeling, the development and maintenance of business rules, and documentation as defined by business process, system, and product owners.Work with staff to coordinate the quality assurance phases of test planning, testing, defect resolution, and test tracking. Help ensure software meets or exceeds specified requirements.Provide project supervision, coaching, and guidance to business analysis and testing environment in support of projects and assigned activities.Job Specifications / QualificationsBachelors degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or related professional work experience.5+ Years of related work experienceDemonstrated ability to effectively use and practice the Requirements Management methodology.Demonstrated ability to effectively use and practice the Project Management methodology.Thorough knowledge of technical concepts, including software development and design and business process modeling, and ability to understand mathematical formulas and algorithms.Demonstrated organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Demonstrated planning and facilitation skills and ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities.Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work with minimal direction.Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly, concisely, logically, tactfully, and effectively, both verbally and in writing, including presentation and negotiation skills.Demonstrated strong leadership, team-building, and coaching skills.Demonstrated ability to challenge, influence, and persuade, directing a group of stakeholders to the best decision. Proficient in XML.Proficient Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server.Proficient in Agile project methodology.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: PCMI Corporation is looking for a Business Analyst who will be responsible for providing business analysis services to clients who seek to implement or have implemented PCMIs PCRS software. The focus of this position is to work closely with clients to gain in-depth understanding of customers business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. This role will be key to understanding the documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges and support software implementation.  The Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency. Responsibilities will include assisting project managers on larger more complex projects as well as actively supporting client account requirements capture. The Business Analyst provides documented requirements to the Project Manager who shall incorporate into a release plan. managing project scope; meeting project schedules; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer relationshipsCollaborate with others within the Chicago office Consumer team; articulate ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identify client needs early; and assist the Consumer team in driving the resolution of issuesIdentify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing onesProduce required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan)Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA processElicit and clearly document business and systems requirementsDemonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiationUnderstand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholdersMeet with project team regularly to review project deliverables and deadlinesDevelop and execute test plansSupport system conversions, upgrades, and enhancementsRequirements:BA/BS Degree2-4 years prior experience in a Business Analyst roleMust have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the businessMust have technical knowledge and understandingRequirements & Design: must be able to document client solution needs in a timely mannerData analysis: must have proficiency with SQL, Microsoft ExcelExperience following Agile methodologiesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong problem solving, client management, and multitasking skillsMust have the ability to be a team player and desire for teamworkExperience Preferred:Previously employed at a software companySoftware Development Lifecycle exposureExperience in the Extended Warranty or Service Contract industryTicketing software like JIRA, Confluence, Service Bench, etc.Webinar tools such as GoToMeeting, Skype for Business, Microsoft Teams, etc.Company Overview: PCMI Corporation is a growing international software development company. Our modular platform, Policy Claim and Reporting Solutions (PCRS), supports and automates the full administration lifecycle of all extended warranties, F&I products, and service contracts mainly for the automotive industry.  Our team members are given the opportunity to develop and grow professionally in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial work environment. Everyone is given the opportunity to work towards career goals by attending classes and achieving certifications that are eligible for bonuses. Our other Benefits offered include: Health and dental insurance401k with company matchingPaid time offPaid holidaysMaternity/paternity leaveAnd more! Name: Operations Business Analyst
Description: Home Chef is building new ways to navigate the booming meal kit delivery industry. Our team is a unique mix of creators, chefs, entrepreneurs, and trailblazers and were growing quickly. Our customer-first mentality, combined with a zest for supporting our peers, helped us bring home Built in Chicagos Startup of the Year Moxie award in 2017. If youre ready to be part of the action, were ready to connect with you. There are no limits to where we can go together. The Operations Business Analyst will play a role in helping maintain the smooth running of our business and at the same time answer key questions about opportunities to further improve our product. The role will be responsible for owning and improving our demand forecasting process for the online side of our business. The role will also dedicate substantial time to doing data analyses for various teams to inform decisions such as new feature launches, business cases, retention and acquisition trends, etc. We are looking for an individual who is equally comfortable updating a programmatic script as he/she is explaining order numbers to our ingredient buyers. Own and maintain our eCommerce demand forecastingContinuously improve accuracy of meal-level forecasts through testing and implementing new methodologiesGenerate and communicate the forecast on daily basis to our facility and supply chain teamsOptimize process of communicating forecast to aforementioned teams as well as downstream actions taken on changes in forecastWork to automate parts of forecasting process through programmatic scriptingWork and present cross-functional data analyses (examples below)Understand key drivers of customer retention and acquisition, in what direction each is trending and why, and implications to our businessAnalyze customer ordering patterns to model out potential upside of offering new and different meal typesInvestigate the impact of geography and temperature on willingness of customers to order and recommend actions based on findingsData tracking and automationDesign and maintain tools to track performance of new product features, key decisions, etc.Help drive automation beyond forecasting within our operational and product toolsQualifications: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability needed for this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities.Bachelors degree, preferably in quantitative field1-2 years working experience in a fast-paced data analysis role preferredExcellent spreadsheet and data analysis skills (e.g Excel or Google Sheets)Basic working knowledge of SQL and PythonStrong communication and organizationIndependent solution orientated thinker

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Rasmussen CollegeBusiness Analyst Rasmussen College is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to support the Institutional Analytics of the College. The Business Analyst is responsible for preparing and maintaining reports that support the operations of the college, as well as the maintenance and development of the financial planning systems, templates, and tools. The position manages a variety of projects and maintains a deep knowledge of the various data available to, and reported by, the college. Responsibilities:Ad Hoc Analysis& Support (40%)– At the direction of the Manager, Business Intelligence, analyze and explore data sources. Includes the assessment of requests for information, or analyses, as well as proactively interpreting available data and reports to support the operations of the college. Topics for analysis can cover all aspects of the college, including, but not limited to, finance, human capital, and student performance.Financial, Operational,& Regulatory Reporting (40%)– Supporting the ongoing maintenance and development of effective tools and reporting to ensure timely and actionable information availability throughout the college. Includes the development of new reports out of pertinent ad-hoc analyses. Regulatory reporting requires supporting various departments from the college to ensure they are submitting accurate information to regulatory bodies, as well as directly reporting to certain regulatory agencies.Exploratory Analyses& Research (20%)–Identifying and exploring available data to research for recommendations or action by the college. Includes proactive analyses to identify new insights and concepts to bring forward for discussion or consideration at the college.Reporting Relationships: This position reports to the Manager, Business Intelligence, who reports to the Director, Analytics& Finance. The position does not have any direct reports. Required Qualifications:Must have at least 2 years of work experience, preferably in a financial reporting, data analyst, or business analyst role. Experience in higher education industry a plus.Clear and professional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent organization and time-management skills.Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Office Suite, experience with VBA a plus.Ability to work independently and as part of a teamBachelor's degree requiredAbout Us: Rasmussen College is a regionally accredited private college that is dedicated to changing lives and the communities it serves through high-demand and flexible educational programs. Since 1900, the College has been committed to academic innovation and providing the highest standard of education while empowering students to pursue a college degree. Rasmussen College offers certificate and diploma programs through associates, bachelors and master’s degree programs online and across its 22 Midwest and Florida campuses. A pioneer in online education, the College is helping lead advancements in innovations such as competency-based education and comprehensive student support services that help working adults advance their careers. The College is also committed to providing a positive impact on society through public service and a variety of community-based initiatives. For more information about Rasmussen College, please visit rasmussen.edu. At Rasmussen, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed supporting and encouraging diversity in the workplace. We welcome our employee’s differences regardless of race, color, creed, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, marital status, age, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Job Summary  Responsible for collecting and summarizing data that will assist Pharmacy and Retail Operations management in both long- and short-range strategic planning, and the development and implementation of programs. Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of business processes pertaining to all aspects of Pharmacy and Retail Operations. Analyzing data to develop cost benefits of proposed programs through collection and data. Work on projects in Pharmacy and Retail Operations including process improvement, strategy development, industry trends, competitive analysis, and company positioning.  Job Responsibilities Responsible for collecting and summarizing data that will assist Pharmacy and Retail Operations management in both long- and short-range strategic planning, and the development and implementation of programs.Develops and maintains a comprehensive understanding of business processes and practices pertaining to all aspects of Pharmacy and Retail Operations within the Retail Hub.Analyzes corresponding data to effectively recommend system and operational procedure changes, enhancements, development of functional specifications or interface opportunities with costs and or return on investment summarized.Serves as operation point of contact for various projects to drive project execution. Communicates relevant project information to stakeholders, both corporately and in the field.Collects, analyzes, makes specific recommendations, and presents information pertaining to proposed programs to meet the business and strategic goals of Pharmacy and Retail Operations and Company.Plans, designs and deploys appropriate reports and tools.Collaborates across Pharmacy and Retail Operations, IT, legal and regulatory, process improvement teams, and others, to develop operational solutions. Walgreens, one of the nation's largest drugstore chains, is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., the first global pharmacy-led, health and wellbeing enterprise. More than 10 million customers interact with Walgreens each day in communities across America, using the most convenient, multichannel access to consumer goods and services and trusted, cost-effective pharmacy, health and wellness services and advice. Walgreens operates 8,175 drugstores with a presence in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Walgreens omnichannel business includes *************. Approximately 400 Walgreens stores offer Healthcare Clinic or other provider retail clinic services.  As the neighborhood drugstore and retailer, our goal is to make health and happiness simpler, easier and within reach. And we remain a trusted wellness provider offering convenient access to important health services, such as immunizations and an array of pharmacy services that can help patients improve their health. To our team members, Walgreens represents a unique opportunity to excel in their careers in a welcoming and inclusive environment. We offer the chance to work in a truly supportive environment, and be a part of a progressive organization dedicated to the well-being of our customers, team members and the communities we all call home.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree and at least 2 years of experience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions; OR, High School Diploma/GED and 5 years of experience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions.Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Word (for example: inserting headers, page breaks, page numbers and tables and/or adjusting table columns).Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using SUM function, setting borders, setting column width, inserting charts, using text wrap, sorting, setting headers and footers and/or print scaling).Intermediate level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: applying a theme, formatting character spacing, inserting a picture, changing slide layout and theme colors, adding transitions, customizing slide numbers, changing chart style and/or formatting font).Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree or MBABachelor's DegreeRetail Pharmacy Experience

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Overview  Baker Tilly Virchow Krause, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a nationally recognized, full-service accounting and advisory firm whose specialized professionals connect with clients and their businesses through refreshing candor and clear industry insight. With approximately 2,700 employees across the United States, Baker Tilly is ranked as one of the 15 largest accounting and advisory firms in the country. Headquartered in Chicago, Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 147 territories, with over 33,000 professionals. The combined worldwide revenue of independent member firms is $3.4 billion.  It's an exciting time to join Baker Tilly!  Due to the continued growth of our Consulting practice we are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to join our Chicago office. As a part of Baker Tilly Consulting, you will find that our global brand and entrepreneurial environment will give you the support you need to apply your industry and technical experience to build your career across a wide range of services to meet our client's most important needs.  As a member of our consulting team at Baker Tilly you will provide clients with best practice knowledge in application development and manage application development through the lifecycle of a project. In addition, you will work with clients in all phases of development from project envisioning through deployment and support.  Baker Tilly Annual Report 2017 ResponsibilitiesManage application development team members through the lifecycle of a project. Create and facilitate solution architecture designs and provide the overall management of the process.Manage forecasting, negotiating and tracking project costs/budgeting throughout the application development project lifecycle.Performs risk based assessments of new projects or in-flight projects to determine potential project issues.Develop long term roadmaps which describe delivering large scale solutions via a series of projects. Identify, foster, and incorporate application development industry best practices.Act as the liaison among the executive committee members, stakeholders, and development team.Manage third party vendor relationships to resource specific development needs.Manage and execute test plan activities.Work to build Project Services capabilities within Baker Tilly.Build project approach and proposals for Project Services opportunities with new clients.QualificationsBachelor's degree in accounting, business, finance, engineering, computer science, management information systems, or related field.Minimum of one (1) year of related experience; previous related industry and consulting experience highly preferredDemonstrate management, analytical, organization, interpersonal, project management, communication skills, and highly developed Microsoft Suite skills (Word, Excel) required.Ability to lead and supervise others, provide exceptional client service, demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategies, see the "big picture" as well as the details, display appropriate ethical knowledge and commitment, and exhibit a sense of urgency and commitment to quality and the timely completion of projects.Project experience with full lifecycle application development (e.g. requirements gathering, use case development, system analysis and design, integration, testing, deployment).Excellent Project Management skills with proven success leading projects.Flexibility to travel to client site as needed and work outside of normal business hours due to client demands.SDL2017

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Apply Now Business Analyst Chicago, IL, USA Req #149  Tuesday, October 9, 2018  Sphera, the former Operational Excellence and Risk Management business of IHS Inc. (“Company”) is a leading global provider of enterprise software and services that enable companies to manage and optimize their environmental, health, safety and sustainability (“EHS&S”) processes. Amongst a wide variety of use cases, the software allows customers to standardize and automate processes such as incident reporting, to monitor emissions and ensure regulatory compliance and to track chemical inventory throughout a manufacturing cycle. The company was recently spun off by IHS and acquired by Genstar Capital, essentially positioning it as a $100MM start up. Responsibilities:  Work with key project stakeholders and the customer to understand the overall business vision for a project and translate that into actionable objectives.  Provide a communication conduit between the business and technical community by interpreting and translating business needs into technical requirements.  Comprehend and document requirements from multiple stakeholders and conceptualize solutions.  Develop deep understanding of current systems and processes and analyze impact of changes as new solutions are introduced to the environment.  Collaborate directly with business owners, sales, QA and development teams.  Collaborate with other BSAs to manage interdependencies across the product suite.  Assist in developing and validating test plans.  Develop and provide product presentations and/or training to existing customer, and potential customers. Qualifications:  Must be able to qualify and maintain clearance to work on a U.S. military installation.  Communicate excellently with diverse groups of people inside and outside of the organization.  Ability to envision, document and clearly communicate end-to-end solutions.  Skilled in creating process flows and swim lane diagrams in Visio.  Ability to forge relationships with various business and technical team members and managers.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  Strong sense of ownership and accountability to deliver planned results  Extremely detail-oriented  Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast paced, rapidly changing environment.  Knowledge of development processes and methodology including Agile and Waterfall techniques  Aptitude to understand business impact and business value of technical solutions.  Experience working with Department of Defense is a plus.  Knowledge of Environmental and/or Logistics Processes is a plus.  Ability to travel up to 25% of working time Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a technology related field. Equivalent work experience may be substituted for education. Minimum 7+ years’ experience in an IT organization, preferably in software development.  At Sphera, we are working together to help our customers keep their people safe, their products sustainable and their operations productive. The best people don't want a job, they want to change the world and themselves. The best want to challenge the status quo. The best want to grow themselves and their careers. Come check out what Sphera has to offer and how that matches up with your career goals.  Sphera is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary: Who are we? Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company, comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, and Live Nation Media & Sponsorship. Ticketmaster is the global leader in event ticketing with over 500 million tickets sold annually and more than 12,000 clients worldwide. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 30,000 shows and 95+ festivals annually for nearly 4,000 artists in over 40 countries. These businesses allow Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to create strategic music marketing programs that connect over 900 brands with the 86 million fans that attend Live Nation Entertainment events each year. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com. Who are you? Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!The Role:Seeking a data-driven individual with an interest in the music business to join the US Concerts Analytics team. Reporting to the Manager of FP&A, this position plays an important role in the analysis of ticketing sales and operations. The individual will produce reporting and analyses that will inform important business decisions, as well as track progress against key initiatives. The individual must be fluent in reporting and business intelligence tools, with a proven ability to leverage large data sets to solve problems. He/she must also demonstrate strong independent reasoning and problem-solving skills, with the capability to think proactively.Responsibilities:Build automated Reporting and Dashboards to support Ticketing Dept. and Management ReportingPrepare ad hoc Analysis to answer Business Questions as neededWork with IT organization to validate ongoing Data Integrity and Integrity of new DatasetsWork collaboratively within the U.S. Concerts Analytics team to improve upon Reporting PracticesProvide Analysis to support annual and ongoing Strategic Planning for US ConcertsOther Duties, as assignedQualifications:Bachelor’s Degree (Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics)Strong Academic Performance1-3 years of relevant Business/Financial Analyst ExperienceMust have Advanced MS Excel skillsMust have Experience with BI tools and Reporting Utilizing Large Data SetsBusiness Objects or Tableau Experience a plusExperience using SQL or other Coding Languages a plusHealthy Curiosity and “outside the box” Critical Thinking SkillsElevated Pride of Ownership regarding Work ProductStrong Attention to Detail and Ability to Critically evaluate DataAbility to turn Data into Actionable InsightsHighly Organized and Confident Self-StarterAbility to work Confidently within all Levels of the OrganizationAbility to participate in a Collaborative Team EnvironmentStrong Written and Verbal Communication SkillsAbility to Balance and Prioritize Multiple TasksWilling to work when necessary to help get Overall Team Goals AccomplishedEntertainment Industry Experience a plus If the above description sounds like you and fits your background, apply online at www.livenationentertainment.com/careers to join the Live Nation Entertainment team today!  Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Live Nation Entertainment strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. HIRING PRACTICES The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Live Nation Entertainment recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation Entertainment may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job Posting TitleSr. Business AnalystPosition SummaryPrimary Purpose This position is responsible for leading and managing the life cycle activities of the company’s product portfolio to ensure that residual inventory and obsolescence targets are met. This person will manage and own the specific discontinuation activities and sku transitions as well as create, document, and follow the policies, process, and procedures for governing and managing a sku’s life cycle. Major ResponsibilitiesCreate, document, and follow the policies, processes, and procedures for governing and managing a sku’s life cycle to meet residual inventory and obsolescence targets. This includes process flow, roles and responsibilities, and master-data changes.Directly manages the end of life processes for “to be” discontinued skus in the portfolio. Name: Delivery Leadership: Business & Operations Management Consulting
Description: Delivery Leadership: Business & Operations Management Consulting Work Location  Chicago Job Code 2293Apply NowDelivery Leadership: Business & Operations Management Consulting Centric Chicago offers a fast-growing, dynamic environment for entrepreneurial management consultants looking to build a business and deliver high-impact result for our Clients. Seeking a leader to drive development, growth and quality execution of all our Business Consulting capabilities.Exciting Opportunity to provide thought leadership to our clients and drive sales and delivery of business consulting solutions.Candidates should have consulting experience applying their skills across a variety of industry and functional areas, working in small, flexible engagement teams.Candidates will work directly with our senior leadership team, and partner closely with other Centric practices on strategy and roadmap development, assessments, operational process improvements, and execution.The position located in Chicago, Illinois. Centric operates under a local consulting model and we treat travel as an opt-in only. Seeking local candidates only. To be successful in this role, we are looking for leaders who are comfortable driving overall growth of our practice area through a combination of: Business Development – Leading business development activities: developing proposals, presentations, and statements of work (SOW) while recommending strategies to grow the Business Consulting Practice presence in existing accountsCollaborating with account and sales teams to manage the sales process with clients and provide the leadership throughout the opportunity lifecycle, from initial qualification to closure of the dealTeam & Individual Development – Maximizing team performance through an effective team approach that increases productivity and job satisfactionEngagement Management – Exceeding client expectations, managing project economics and risks, and ensuring buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the clientA successful candidate will have the following characteristics:A track record of successful professional services management experiences10+ years management/leadership experience including a history of increasing leadership responsibility and career growthAbility to communicate effectively and tactfully across all levels of an organizationExcellent negotiation, conflict management, and problem-solving skillsAbility to assess and leverage strengths of a diverse group of people to maximize team performance along with proven success developing individualsAdaptable to balancing the demands of multiple client assignments with team development while pushing the intellectual envelope in search of solutions to complex problemsAn entrepreneurial mindset with the desire to develop her/his practice area within a larger organization by leveraging existing resources and capabilities in new and unique ways to achieve successWhy Centric?Supportive environment – We expect a lot from our Project Managers. But, you won't be asked to do it alone. You will have the full support of the Chicago office leadership and all of Centric. We love to help people succeed. Growth opportunities – as a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.Special culture – Hands down, the people are the best part of Centric. But you shouldn’t take our word on it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook or Twitter to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.Want to start on a contract basis?Contractor friendly environment – Contractors are an important part of our Centric family and we treat them as such. You will find that our policies and practices make it easy for you to contract with us.Benefits eligibility – As a W2T temporary employee, you are eligible for Centric’s W2T benefits package which includes medical and dental coverage. We are also open to Corp to Corp arrangements (no benefits in that case, however).Full-time potential – Many of our full-time employees originally started as contractors. If that’s something you are interested in, we can explore those options. That said, if you want to remain a contractor that’s fine too. We are flexible!Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.

Name: Advanced Analytics Analyst
Description: Advanced Analytics Analyst  Rush Health is looking for an Advanced Analytics Analyst to join our growing advanced analytics team of Rush Health, serving some of the most prestigious hospitals and top physicians in Illinois. Excellent opportunity to create meaningful and impactful analytics on the cutting-edge of healthcare. Rush Health is a clinically integrated network that includes Rush University Medical Center, Riverside Medical Center, Rush-Copley Medical Center, Rush Oak Park Hospital and more than 1,100 physician members and 300 non-physician network clinicians. Position Highlights: The team is seeking experienced healthcare analysts with knowledge of claims and Electronic Medical Records (EMR) data; skills in advanced analytics, data science and statistical algorithms; experience working hands-on with large, complex healthcare data; and advanced skills with analytic software such as SAS, SQL, R, Tableau and similar. Advanced degree (Masters, PhD, MD) in relevant discipline required. Knowledge of value-based care and related plans a plus (e.g., MSSP and/or commercial Accountable Care Organizations, Medicare Advantage, BPCI, bundled payments, plans with capitation, quality bonus programs using HEDIS- or CMS-logic based metrics). Other strong pluses include experience creating analytics to identify healthcare quality and efficiency opportunities, and reporting of key performance metrics for physicians and hospitals. Position involves activities (and requires corresponding skills) across the entire spectrum of healthcare analytics, from processing of raw claims and EMR data, to building advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms.  The Advanced Analytics Analyst will be responsible for conducting and overseeing analysis of research data from all Rush Health hospitals and care providers to further both clinical and business goals of Rush Health Members. Incumbent will be advanced in SAS Stat, SAS MACRO, SAS SQL and other advanced SAS tools, as well as R and/or equivalent programming tools. Contingent on organizational needs may supervise Master's Level Statisticians. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures. Position Responsibilities:Independently design, write, run, and evaluate programs in SAS, VBA, R and/or SQL to provide descriptive summaries of database files, including frequencies, lists, and plots; examine data to track down potential data inconsistencies.Independently design, write, run, and evaluate programs in SAS to carry out statistical analyses of biomedical data including categorical data, generalized linear models, longitudinal data, censored failure time data, nonparametric tests, and graphical analyses. Familiarity with HEDIS and PQRS measures and system is critical.Independently design, write and run programs to support development and implementation of statistical theory, and evaluate the performance of proposed new methods. Prepare clear written documentation of methods, programs, and results.Independently document basic to complex datasets, programs and output clearly to permit their checking and use by other biostatistics personnel.Determining content based on project needs; prepare clear and written summaries of complex analyses for other analytical leadership and staff.Track multiple analytic requests; delegate and carry out tasks in a sequence appropriate to the communicated priorities of all projects.Contingent on organizational needs, may hire, supervise, complete evaluations for and carry out disciplinary actions for group of Master's Level Statisticians.Contingent on organizational needs, may train a group of Master’s Level Statisticians in order to meet the needs of numerous projects.Works closely with the senior IT data managers and research administrators, be responsible for short-term and long-term projects to improve the statistical analysis group’s efficiency and ability to interface with RADC investigators and investigators elsewhere at Rush and at other institutions.Consult with executive leadership to develop, implement, evaluate, write, conduct, and edit plans for complex statistical analyses of research data.Manage the dissemination of information on how to use the statistical analysis system to staff who are using SAS and other tools for their work.Continually seek out, learn to use, and apply new statistical techniques necessary to meet the demands of funded studies. Develop, foster and share expertise in new types of statistical analyses.Independently run advanced analytical algorithmsParticipate in meetings of Biostatistics section.Position Qualifications Include:Master's degree requiredAt least 3-5 years of work experience performing statistical analysis of biomedical or social science data required.Supervisory experience preferred.Proven knowledge of different data aggregation techniques and statistical manipulation techniques in SAS environment to include SAS base, SAS Stat, SAS SQL, SQL, SAS Macro, and SAS Info Maps.Superior data aggregation and data step skills in the SAS environment pulling data from disparate sources using SAS Macro and SAS SQL.Ability to independently design, write, run, and evaluate programs in SAS (SAS Stat and SAS Maps) and other tools required. Must demonstrate knowledge of advanced SAS language.Familiar with advanced statistical techniques in SAS Stat.Competence in SQL, R or other programming language beneficial.Competence in Tableau or other data visualization software beneficial.Knowledge of Unix or PC environment required.Demonstrated expertise in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.Superior written and oral communication skills.Attention to detail required.Familiar with HL7 lab data formats, claims file formats, and EHR / EMR data formats.Demonstrated expertise in statistical programming and analysis and project management experience required.Ability to function in a team environment essential.Must be able to prioritize workload and be self-directed.Ability to handle multiple complex projects with a low turnaround time required.Ability to adapt to rapidly changing environment.Company Highlights:Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care.Rush University Medical Center is a four time Magnet facility, the highest recognition given for nursing excellence. Rush was also the first hospital in Illinois serving adults and children to receive Magnet status.Leading academic medical center, acute care hospital w/ 664 licensed bedsRush offers a competitive salary, valuable healthy living benefits to include: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future. Whether you’re saving for retirement or a child’s education, Rush offers benefits to help you make the most of your money…now and in the future.Rush University is home to one of the first medical colleges in the Midwest and one of the nation's top-ranked nursing colleges, as well as graduate programs in allied health, health systems management and biomedical research. Ten programs are nationally ranked by U.S. News & World Report.As one of the most popular cities in the nation, Chicago is a cultural, historical and diverse city. Located on the shores of Lake Michigan, Chicago in known for its nearly 200 distinct neighborhoods and its extensive park systems, along with its sports teams, museums and vibrant theater community. Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Name: Senior Analyst
Description: dunnhumby is looking for a talented Senior Analyst  You’ll have the opportunity to learn amongst a community of the world’s best Data Scientists & Analysts, and we offer extensive training opportunities for both technical & soft skills (internal & external courses) from Python to Line Management coaching.  You’ll have access to varied, large & complex data sets, and perform analysis using Python, SQL, Spark & Hadoop. We look for candidates flexible and enthusiastic in picking up new languages and technologies, as we continuously improve our tech stack to remain global leaders in Data Science.What you'll be doing:Analyse the retailer database using the full suite of dunnhumby technical tools (Python, SQL, R, Excel, and specific dunnhumby internal tools) to create timely, relevant and actionable insights. Identify opportunities to roll out new data science methods, technologies and thinking, bringing in best practices from the global data science team. Contribute to shaping and delivering the work plan, ensuring that best practice and innovative ideas are adopted. Scope and manage projects from beginning to end, including all commercial elements to ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget and to brief specification.Work closely with stakeholders to ensure sound knowledge of client objectives and customer insight, to subsequently design best-in-class solutions. Proactively manage the adoption of world-class science, and champion the capture and sharing of knowledge across the analytical community. Guide and direct analysts in realising efficiencies and creating standard processes, such as ways of automating code, removing manual tasks, or re-engineering processes. Role model best practice analytical behaviours such as project management and QA to ensure brilliant client work is delivered on time.Who who’ll get to work with:In this role you’ll work with world class and passionate people using cutting-edge techniques on projects that will have both short and long-term impact. You’ll work within a analysis team, alongside Capability Consulting Managers, the Data Team, and Account Leads. Externally you’ll be working with the insight contacts at Retailers and Suppliers.What you'll need: [Essential]A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a numerate subject e.g. Stats, Maths, Physics, Economics etcData interpretation / insight analysisData visualisationInsight storytellingProgramming (Python, SQL, R or other)Analytical techniquesStatistical modellingQuality assurance and testingExcel/ TableauA plus if you also have: [Desirable] A Master’s degree or equivalent in statistics or similar field Qualitative & Quantitative Market Research Analytical technology Desk researchLife at dunnhumbydunnhumbians are passionate people who always start with the Customer, we are ambitious and decisive, we listen and understand, innovate and explore, and work together to grow one dunnhumbyHere you'll be part of a culture that welcomes participation and discussion at all levelsYou’ll get to work in an internationally collaborative environment alongside teams of ambitious, inquisitive and forward-thinking individualsWe believe that learning and development never stops and provide opportunities to feed your curiosity to understand, improve, and learn; encouraging everyone to build on the best of what we doYou'll have the opportunity to work with ground-breaking technology delivering extraordinary impact for our customersWe’re a great believer in work-life balance offering early finish Fridays plus an extra day off on your birthdaydunnhumby's spirit of community and the diversity of our people's skills, backgrounds and experiences makes us stronger. We continuously seek to build an environment of inclusion, equality and respect because we know that will make us the best business we can be Discover where a career with us can take you. Meet our people on YouTube to learn about the diversity in career paths across dunnhumby. For more about our culture and to explore the benefits we offer visit our Careers site.*** dunnhumby is unable to offer visa sponsorship for external candidates ***

Name: Operations Business Analyst
Description: Home Chef is building new ways to navigate the booming meal kit delivery industry. Our team is a unique mix of creators, chefs, entrepreneurs, and trailblazers and were growing quickly. Our customer-first mentality, combined with a zest for supporting our peers, helped us bring home Built in Chicagos Startup of the Year Moxie award in 2017. If youre ready to be part of the action, were ready to connect with you. There are no limits to where we can go together. The Operations Business Analyst will play a role in helping maintain the smooth running of our business and at the same time answer key questions about opportunities to further improve our product. The role will be responsible for owning and improving our demand forecasting process for the online side of our business. The role will also dedicate substantial time to doing data analyses for various teams to inform decisions such as new feature launches, business cases, retention and acquisition trends, etc. We are looking for an individual who is equally comfortable updating a programmatic script as he/she is explaining order numbers to our ingredient buyers. Own and maintain our eCommerce demand forecastingContinuously improve accuracy of meal-level forecasts through testing and implementing new methodologiesGenerate and communicate the forecast on daily basis to our facility and supply chain teamsOptimize process of communicating forecast to aforementioned teams as well as downstream actions taken on changes in forecastWork to automate parts of forecasting process through programmatic scriptingWork and present cross-functional data analyses (examples below)Understand key drivers of customer retention and acquisition, in what direction each is trending and why, and implications to our businessAnalyze customer ordering patterns to model out potential upside of offering new and different meal typesInvestigate the impact of geography and temperature on willingness of customers to order and recommend actions based on findingsData tracking and automationDesign and maintain tools to track performance of new product features, key decisions, etc.Help drive automation beyond forecasting within our operational and product toolsQualifications: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability needed for this role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities.Bachelors degree, preferably in quantitative field1-2 years working experience in a fast-paced data analysis role preferredExcellent spreadsheet and data analysis skills (e.g Excel or Google Sheets)Basic working knowledge of SQL and PythonStrong communication and organizationIndependent solution orientated thinker

Name: Sales Analyst
Description: The Organization At Kaufman Hall, we believe that sustained success is never an accident. It is the result of sound decision making, based on data-driven analysis and disciplined thinking, and guided by the fundamental principles of corporate finance.  Kaufman Hall provides management consulting and software to help organizations realize sustained success amid changing market conditions. Since 1985, Kaufman Hall has been a trusted advisor to boards and executive management teams, helping them incorporate proven methods into their strategic planning and financial management processes, and quantify the financial impact of their plans and strategic decisions to consistently achieve their goals.  Kaufman Hall services use a rigorous, disciplined, and structured approach that is based on the principles of corporate finance. The breadth and integration of Kaufman Hall advisory services are unparalleled, encompassing strategy; financial and capital planning; cost transformation; treasury and capital markets management; and mergers, acquisitions, partnerships, and joint ventures. Kaufman Hall’s Axiom Software provides sophisticated, flexible performance management solutions that empower finance professionals to analyze results, model the future, and optimize organizational decision making. Solutions for long-range planning, budgeting and forecasting, reporting and analytics, consolidations, capital planning, and profitability and cost management are delivered on a single integrated software platform. Kaufman Hall’s Peak Software empowers healthcare organizations with clinical benchmarks, data, and analytics to provide a higher quality of care for optimized performance and improved patient outcomes. The Position Kaufman, Hall & Associates, LLC, is seeking a Sales Analyst to serve as an operational resource for a fast growing and successful software sales team. The Sales Analyst will be responsible for processing order forms and contracts, as well as collecting and analyzing sales and customer information for the broader organization.  Working in conjunction with the sales team, industry solution leaders, marketing, finance and sales leadership you will be a key resource for Kaufman Hall’s to software sales team. In this role, the successful candidate must be able to manage multiple requests simultaneously, be meticulous to both timelines and quality of work, and produce content that exemplifies the professional aspect of Kaufman Hall.  The essential functions of the position are: Support the sales organization in the coordination of order form and contract requests between sales, legal, accounting, and servicesDevelop and deliver legally binding proposal documents for order requestsUpdate re-usable form library for multiple types of contract and order requirements, to improve and expedite response timeAssist with RFP/RFI/Questionnaire completion, combining technical knowledge with industry expertise and professionalism in a manner that creates credibility and value to customersListen closely to sales and business development team requests and provide routine competitive and industry trend updates to the field sales organizationDemonstrates working knowledge of business unit sales organizations and field sales operating practices (business analytics, compensation analytics, contract analytics, sales tools and basic training)Creates business analytics and reporting by synthesizing information from multiple sources of dataUses and leverages Salesforce to provide decision supportFacilitates/manages processes in a relatively non-complex environmentPulls reports from a variety of tools and systems and organizes information in to usable action planQualifications: The ideal candidate will possess excellent interpersonal, organizational and verbal communication skills to work with multiple aspects of the software organization, including Field Sales, Sales Support, Sales Management, Accounting, and Legal. In addition, the successful candidate will possess the following: 2-3 years relevant experience preferred in sales operations or proposal writingStrong organizational and communication skillsStrong working knowledge of Microsoft applications, particularly advanced Word capabilitiesExperience with CRM systems, Salesforce.com a particular plusPrevious experience with Form software and mail merge a plusDemonstrated ability to work across functionsWilling to commit high effort to ensure successHigh energy, entrepreneurial spirit, passionate about being part of a growing businessKnowledge of healthcare and banking performance management topics a plus, notably in the areas of budgeting, productivity monitoring, capital planning, strategy management, or cost accounting and decision support a plusEducation:Bachelor’s degree required Kaufman, Hall, & Associates, LLC. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation or preference, or physical or mental disability or other legally protected category.

Name: Analyst/Associate - Valuation & Financial Opinions

With 17 offices in the U.S. and Europe, we serve a range of clients, from Fortune 100 corporations to privately held companies in numerous industries throughout the world. Our clients and their advisors rely on our premier expertise, deep industry knowledge, and unparalleled responsiveness on complex financial matters.  Stout is a trade name for Stout Risius Ross, LLC, Stout Advisors SA, and Stout Risius Ross Advisors, LLC, a FINRA-registered broker-dealer and SIPC member firm. The terms "Stout" or the "firm" refers to one or more of these independent advisory practices. Name: Experienced IT and Management Consulting Recruiter
Description: Experienced IT and Management Consulting Recruiter - Chicago  Work Location  Chicago  Job Code  2294  Apply Now Experienced IT and Management Consulting Recruiter - ChicagoCentric Chicago is in search of a talented, experienced recruiter to join our fast-growing, dynamic team. We are looking for a candidate with a passion for identifying top performing IT and management consultants in program/project management, technology services, business consulting and organizational change management. Success in this role means promoting the Centric brand, possessing excellent communication skills, and having the ability to find and close senior level professionals who are not necessarily looking for a change in their career. Hunting, cold calling, and finding quality candidates based upon the Centric profile are all essential components of this position. You must be able to build and strengthen relationships internally and externally, as well as drive recruiting efforts through a variety of methods and techniques. As an Experienced IT & Management Consulting Recruiter, you will be a key strategic partner with our leadership and recruiting team.As an Experienced IT & Management Consulting Recruiter, you will be responsible for the following:Sourcing, interviewing, checking references and negotiating offers.Understanding and selling the Centric brand, our business model and our offerings.Providing timely updates and feedback on candidates to hiring managers and/or directly to candidates.Ensuring the recruitment process is completed in a timely, efficient and professional manner.Working with other recruiters and operations management teams to understand short- and long-term talent objectives and hiring forecasts.Proactively targeting, pursuing, meeting and closing top-performing candidates.Building and maintaining a network of prospects through proactive market research and ongoing relationship management.Capturing and reporting on key metrics that show results, trends and opportunities.A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:A 4-year college degree.7+ years of professional recruiting experience, with a strong preference for a background in technology and/or professional services.High energy and a passion for recruiting.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, confidence, and a natural ability to sell.Polished presence with a high level of professionalism and integrity.Creative, strategic and entrepreneurial spirit, and a high level of comfort developing and trying new methods.Deep problem-solving skills with the ability to bring forward strategic ideas and initiatives.Demonstrated ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.Ability to work independently and as an integral part of a team in a collaborative environment.Ability to understand and adapt to the culture of a professional services organization that strives to be a leading services organization in Chicago.Aptitude and familiarity with Applicant Tracking System utilization and optimization.Why Centric?Supportive environment – We expect a lot from our Recruiters. But, you won't be asked to do it alone. You will have the full support of the Chicago office leadership and all of Centric. We love to help people succeed. Growth opportunities – as a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.Special culture – Hands down, the people are the best part of Centric. But you shouldn’t take our word on it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook or Twitter to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.Want to start on a contract basis?Contractor friendly environment – Contractors are an important part of our Centric family and we treat them as such. You will find that our policies and practices make it easy for you to contract with us.Benefits eligibility – As a W2T temporary employee, you are eligible for Centric’s W2T benefits package which includes medical and dental coverage. We are also open to Corp to Corp arrangements (no benefits in that case, however).Full-time potential – Many of our full-time employees originally started as contractors. If that’s something you are interested in, we can explore those options. That said, if you want to remain a contractor that’s fine too. We are flexible!Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.

Name: Revenue Integrity Analyst/Coder
Description: Coding auditor will be responsible for validating coding based on various Fee Schedules, CMS and Correct Coding guidelines. Generate an audit utilizing Excel and formulating explanation of benefits that correlate with coding determinations. For claims that do not fall under a set fee schedule, a negotiated rate must be agreed upon between the auditor and provider based on guidelines provided by various insurance company policies. Open communication and accurate documentation must be maintained in order to adhere to strict processing deadlines.  Will assist in the evaluation of medical records and claims submissions to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable federal and state regulations and guidelines. This individual will also provide guidance and training on medical coding to physicians and staff.  Develop and use analytical tools to regularly review and confirm appropriate usage of the CDM for clients. Provide appropriate follow-up with clients. Reviews Medicare intermediary and other third-party payer bulletins to keep current on billing requirements, and communicates information to all applicable staff and clients. Participate in initiating, developing and establishing facility specific and regional models for financial analyses as it relates to pricing change recommendations to a clients charge master.
