Name: Senior Transportation Analyst
Description: Position Description Cambridge Systematics, Inc. is shaping the future of transportation. We are industry leaders, transportation specialists dedicated to ensuring that transportation investments can deliver the best possible results. By providing innovative policy and planning solutions, objective analyses and technology applications, we help our clients anticipate and meet future transportation needs while improving the performance of existing infrastructure and operations. Above all, we are committed to our clients’ success in making transportation better for future generations. The Integrated Planning and Policy group provides fully integrated planning and management as well as project development services for our clients. The group encompasses four national practice areas: Planning and Policy; Freight and Economics; Safety; and Transit and Shared Mobility. We apply our national knowledge and leadership while leveraging the strength of regional expertise to bring experience from across the country and extensive Federal level to intimate understanding of our clients’ needs. The Senior Analyst provides leadership and support in business development, offering definition, project delivery, and project management. S/he prepares proposals and reports, and conducts research as needed. The Senior Analyst collaborates with other technical leaders and project managers across business lines to develop integrated technical approaches and serves as a company-wide resource in areas of expertise. S/he trains, manages and mentors junior staff and motivates staff and sub consultants to deliver work products on time and within budget. The Analyst develops collaborate relationships with current and prospective clients, proactively identifies future leads and leads teaming negotiations with other consulting firms as part of proactive and reactive marketing. Functionally, the Senior Analyst in the area of transit and shared mobility service planning is expected to: •Be a recognized leader in transit service and shared mobility network design and project delivery for both systems and corridor analysis •Bring strong relationships with planning and innovation leaders at transit agencies across the US, and with transit executive and management staff within his/her region •Have a strong understanding of fixed route transit service design principles and best practices for bus and rail, including those articulated by TCRP and the TCQSM •Have strong knowledge of public and private mobility choices and modes, including TNCs, microtransit, on-demand and flex rides, peer-to-peer and ride-sharing networks, and active transportation options •Have a strong understanding of customer behaviors, preferences, travel patterns, and market demand as the basis of transportation service design and effectiveness •Have a strong understanding of FTA rules, requirements, and guidance related to transit formula and discretionary grants, including Section 5300 funding, CIG, BUILD, and MOD Sandbox programs •Have strong knowledge of transportation service technology options, such as connected and autonomous vehicles, and their implications for travel behavior and policy Other desirable capabilities by which the Senior Analyst could provide benefit include: •Paratransit and public on-demand service principles, expertise, and experience •Health and wellness transportation principles, expertise, and experience •Active transportation principles, expertise, and experience •Land use, complete streets, curb management, and station/mobility hub design principles, expertise, and experience •Equity and social implications, regulations, and analysis •New data sources and technology platforms for designing and analyzing transportation systems •Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS) principles and progressive business models for transportation service Name: Senior Consultant, HR Transaction Advisory Services
Description: About FTI Consulting FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organizations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes: financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges and make the most of opportunities. The Company generated $1.81 billion in revenues during fiscal year 2017. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTIConsulting) , Facebook and LinkedIn .  FTI Consulting continually strives to offer employees and eligible dependents, including domestic partners and eligible domestic partner children, a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please click here for more information.  FTI Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. FTI Consulting will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.  FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. About Corporate Finance & Restructuring Our Corporate Finance and Restructuring practice, a trusted partner to companies, boards of directors, investors, lenders and creditors around the world, is focused on delivering restructuring and business transformation solutions. Committed to our clients' success, our professionals address the full spectrum of financial, operational and transactional risks and opportunities. Among our core strengths is providing expertise in guiding companies through the value creation lifecycle. Our targeted offerings include restructuring, insolvency, litigation support, interim management, capital market advisory, post-acquisition integration, valuation, tax advisory as well as financial management and performance improvement solutions. Our clients demand our industry expertise, which includes emphasis in the energy, healthcare, real estate, retail and consumer products, and telecom, media and technology sectors. Our Corporate Finance & Restructuring services are delivered through a global network of 41 offices in 15 countries situated in Asia, Australia, Europe, Latin America and North America. ABOUT BUSINESS TRANSFORMATION - TRANSACTION SERVICES: We advise corporate and financial clients across the deal life cycle, bringing deep deal experience coupled with on-point industry experts to structure, conduct due diligence, integrate, value and communicate around the transaction. Being a public corporation and consulting firm, we are free from audit-based conflicts and restrictions, allowing us to provide a full suite of services, including projected financial information. ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: The HR Transaction Services (HRTS) group is a practice within FTI which will support our internal M&A teams across all stages of the deal continuum - from pre-Sign to Sign and Close. We combine deep technical expertise in the HR, compensation and benefits space to help our clients make informed decisions. Clients served tend to be 75% private equity, and 25% corporate clients. PRIMARY DUTIES: We are currently seeking a Senior Consultant for our HR Transactions-Services (HRTS) group within our Transactions & Restructuring practice. Responsibilities: Perform buy and sell-side financial HR due diligence, as well as global HR post-deal integrations with respect to mergers, acquisitions, spin-offs, carve-outs, and other similar transactions for Fortune 1000 and middle market companies and private equity investors  Work with FTT's TS teams in the due diligence stage to analyze target company data to identify key HR-related financial exposures, including those related to pensions, postretirement medical, executive agreements, change in control / severance plans, Section IRC 280G ("Golden Parachutes"), active health and welfare, multiemployer, deferred compensation (IRC 409A), equity compensation plans, and collective bargaining agreements.  Work with FTI's carve-out and merger integration teams (and other outside advisors / vendors) on HR transition and integration engagements, focusing on the establishment and merging of HR, compensation and benefits platforms, providing PMO oversight across the various key HR workstreams, including Day 1 readiness, SPA / TSA maintenance, employee transition & offer letters, HR target operating model, retention / severance / RIFs, payroll / HRIS, compensation and benefit plans, and employee communications.  Participate in the engagement process from start to finish, including assisting with setting scopes, budgets, creation and coordination of client-ready deliverables with FTI's engagement teams, and direct communication of results with clients.  Team with staff at similar levels to knowledge share and develop others. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree from an accredited university/college;  Is on track to attain their ASA, FSA, Enrolled Actuary (EA), or JD designations.  At least 2 years of actuarial experience in the valuation, design, and implementation of pensions, post­ retirement medical, health and welfare and / or compensation plans with a top accounting or benefits consulting firm.  Experience in M&A due diligence, carve-outs and/or HR integrations, including implementation of compensation and benefit plans preferred but not required.  Ability to travel up to 30% of the time. PREFERRED SKILLS: Highly motivated, self-starter, team player, with positive attitude and strong relationship-building skills.  Advanced analytical and issue resolution intelligence. Problem solving is essential.  Strong written and verbal communication skills, as report writing is required to serve TAS clients.  Ability to interface with team members and client personnel in demanding, deadline-driven situations.  Proficient with PC environments and related software, including Microsoft Office applications. Especially advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint preferred.  A strong aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis and the ability to link business strategy to performance and due diligence findings.  Ability to work independently in fast-paced, multi-tasked environment.  Ability and willingness to learn and adapt in an ever-changing environment to meet client needs.  POSITION CLASSIFICATION: Exempt  FTI Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer #LI-LF1

Name: Business Analyst
Description: What you will do: ShopperTrak is on a mission: we are revolutionizing the bricks-and-mortar retail world with innovative products that fuel their success. Our path forward includes active exploration of IoT, Computer Vision, Machine (Deep) Learning and other technologies. We believe this is a thrilling journey and providing clarity on our future and empowering people to do their best work is the key to our success. We are inspired by people who are passionate, curious and want to push the envelope on innovation. Around here, we know that if we “build great stuff” that helps solve problems for our customers, great things will follow. How you will do it: We are working on some challenging problems that require bright minds and grit to help us solve. We work in an agile environment. We have taken our analytic products ‘to the cloud’ and are entering the arena of big data and the “internet of things.” It is an exciting journey that will allow you to:  · Partner with our technology team to help build the products our customers need  · Partner with product owners to help define those products, and refine their required functionality  · Speak the language of both the product owner and the developer, translating business requirements into technical requirements  · Communicate key insights and findings with product owners  · Become an expert in our products  · Report on common sources of technical issues or questions  · Report progress, issues and status at daily and weekly stand-ups What we look for:Required · Bachelor’s degree  · 2 years of business analysis (with a strong preference for experience with analytics platforms/products)  · Agile methodology experience, refining business requirements into agile stories and tasks  · Take pride in effective written and verbal communication  · Ability to understand complex systems, and trace the effects of a change throughout those systems  · Sharp critical thinking skills, including systems analysis, problem analysis and resolution, and sound judgment/decision making ability  · Advanced understanding of agile methodologies and Atlassian products like Jira and Confluence  · Background in software development  · The ability to build queries against both SQL and NoSQL databases  Johnson Controls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/tomorrowneedsyou

Name: Entry Level Technical Business Analyst, Detroit
Description: The Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Business Analysis team collects and analyzes requirements and solves client problems using CRM solutions. It serves as a liaison between Avanade clients and CRM consultants, particularly during initial project phases.  As a CRM Business Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying, developing and deploying end-user solutions in CRM systems. Through deep functional knowledge and familiarity with the CRM application in use, you will ensure that client business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training.  Day-to-day, you will: Support the translation of client business requirements into CRM solutions, including requirements approval, communication, traceability and reuseContribute to the transfer of functional requirements to development and test teamsUse CRM workflow technology to automate business processesStay abreast on updates and new releases in CRM technologiesEducate end users on CRM functionalityTravel as needed About Avanade  Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. We welcome all, and seek talented individuals who can bring their whole self to work, build inclusive teams and encourage diversity inside and outside the organization. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com.  Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran, military or marital status, genetic information or any other protected status.  Qualifications You are a strong analytical thinker. You enjoy translating client business needs into software capabilities and making sure that end users are adept at using those features. You are a big-picture thinker who knows how to bring improvement to complex systems.  Your skillset likely includes: Knowledge of CRM systems and business solution implementationsSome knowledge of CRM issue diagnosing and troubleshootingSome experience consulting with external clientsPreferred experience working with global and offshore project teamsGreat communication skillsFour-year Bachelor's Degree You likely have around one year of relevant work experience; though sufficient education will suffice.  To qualify for this position, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment-based work authorization Requisition ID - 55452 Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital and cloud-enabling services, business solutions and design-led experiences, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation and has 30,000 professionals in 24 countries. Visit us at www.avanade.com.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: ParkWhiz is looking for a Business Analyst who will dive into the core functions of business operations to uncover opportunities, answer important questions, and help us scale efficiently. We're constantly looking for ways to improve our operations, product, and customer experience - this position drives how we use the massive amount of data we aggregate to deliver on that mission. As a Business Analyst you'll have direct impact on organizational success by providing accurate, timely analysis and insights to all departments. Are you passionate about leveraging data to solve business problems? If so, read on.What you'll doWork with variety of data sources - extracting knowledge and actionable information from massive datasetsBuild and flesh out data models in our Redshift database for use in regular and/or automated reporting and analysisBe a passionate problem solver - breaking down problems and developing analytical insightsConvey your work and results to a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders – nerds and non-nerdsEvaluate operations for inefficiencies and identify areas where you can create, automate, and develop tools (SQL-based or otherwise)Diagnose data-related bugs and ensure they are resolved in a timely mannerSupport the business with ad hoc reportingContinuously strive for a deeper understanding of our business driversOffer insight to all aspects of the organization – product, marketing, engineering and financeWhat you bring to the table2+ years supporting business operations in an analytics capacityA love for insights, innate curiosity, and a deep desire to find ways to create valueSolid communication skillsPassion for automationComfort in a complex data environment and understanding of data structuresExperience with SQL and Excel (Experience with Python or R is a plus, but not expected)Experience with some flavor of data visualization (we use Looker)Familiarity with transactional and data warehouse environments (Postgres, Redshift)The business sense to understand why you're pulling data and whether it seems accurate...not just pulling itYou like to formulate the right questions versus just seeking answers to make sure the best and smartest decisions get madeWhat you getA data environment that isn't a total messThe tools - or additional tools, if need be - to get the job doneSolve big problems across departments and for leadershipHigh functioning, collaborative, and capable teammates with a desire to both share their knowledge and learn from youOpportunity to directly impact success for a rapid-growing business in a fast-paced industryAbout ParkWhizThe ParkWhiz mission is to bring smiles to drivers around the world by making parking more convenient, efficient, and delightful. We seek to remove friction for our users and to become integrated into the daily life of drivers across the country.Our CultureThe ParkWhiz Product Team consists of user advocates, collaborators and innovative thinkers. We strive to create products people love using, we test and iterate on our ideas. We have a firm, non-negotiable no jerk policy. We accept you for who you are and consider everyone on an equal opportunity basis without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Pangea Real Estate is a privately held real estate owner/operator headquartered in Chicago, IL. Our mission is to be the best property managers on the continent. We are accomplishing our mission by incorporating technology and excellent customer service to all units under management. We strive to deliver service, value and care, to all our residents. Since 2008, our portfolio has grown to over 13,000 apartment units owned and operated in Chicago, Indianapolis, and Baltimore.  Watch this video to learn more about Pangea!  This role will support Pangea’s field and back office operations through data analytics and continual process improvement. The successful candidate must be comfortable managing multiple high priority, high value, and highly strategic projects at the same time. After a period of proven performance, you will begin to manage individuals and eventually entire teams at Pangea. We are looking for entrepreneurial, self-driven candidates who are excited by the thought of crafting initiatives and executing projects to help bring Pangea into the next phase of its growth. Name: Entry Level Business Analyst
Description: Summary: Looking for candidates who are willing to work on a one-year contract full time basis with the company. The candidate must be willing to re-locate themselves as per company requirements. Job Description: Entry level jobs are available to those candidates with little or no experience. Such positions provide training and the prospect of future advancement. Entry-level business analysts work under supervision and perform a variety of tasks including developing and maintaining various databases, generating reports, and receiving continuous training while working on a variety of projects.  The primary responsibility of an entry-level business analyst includes supporting data gathering and providing review and analysis of data. Other day-to-day duties include ensuring data integrity, participating in data quality control and validation, and producing requirements documents for various business development activities. An entry-level business analyst may also create and execute test scripts under supervision. Principle Duties and ResponsibilitiesInteracts regularly and directly with the Operations function and has close user working relationship to ensure industry and best practices are employedDevelops intimate knowledge of business strategy, business model, and processes in order to identify improvement opportunities and value-added capabilitiesProvides end-user support to a diverse, non IT-technical user baseQualification: Masters Degree

Name: Business Analyst
Company: Archdiocese of Chicago, Office of Catholic Schools
Description: Be part of our mission. The Archdiocese of Chicago ("the Archdiocese"), the third largest Catholic Archdiocese in the United States, serves more than 2.2 million Catholics in 344 parishes in Cook and Lake Counties. The Archdiocese's 217 elementary and secondary schools comprise the largest U.S. private school system, and have garnered more U.S. Department of Education Blue Ribbon Awards than any system of any type. The Archdiocese, pastored by Cardinal Blase J. Cupich, has more than 15,000 employees.  Basic Function  The Business Analyst is responsible for leveraging IT best practices and data-driven decision making in order to oversee the selection, design, and implementation of software and hardware resources. S/he will also be responsible for translating business needs into IT solutions taking into account a wide-range of Archdiocese programs and priorities. Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: On any given day, every moment matters to someone, somewhere. And every moment, Motorola Solutions' innovations, products and services play essential roles in people's lives. We help firefighters see around buildings and police officers see around street corners. We keep utility workers connected and visible to each other with real-time voice and data communication across the smart grid. And we provide the situational awareness first responders need when a moment brings catastrophe. We help people be their best in their moments that matter.Our IT organization isn't just here to support our business. We're here to reinvent it - by changing the way our customers, partners and employees interact with our company. To do that, we're looking for people who bring great ideas and who make our partners' ideas better. Intellectually curious advisors (not order takers) who focus on outcomes to creatively solve business problems. People who not only embrace change, but who accelerate it.Our company is undergoing a CEO sponsored digital transformation to improve the way our customers and partners do business with us. We have a multi-billion dollar revenue model online today and we aspire to do more! As a Business Analyst you are a key member of this team. This role will partner with our business leaders to create and implement technical & business process solutions to enable frictionless digital interactions, next gen product enablement and transform this company. Summary:As an IT Business Analyst intern, you will translates Motorola Solutions tactical and strategic objectives into workable capabilities and solutions for our digital marketing and website redesign team.You will work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems.You will performs best-in-class benchmarking and identifies all possible solutions, performs cost-benefit analyses, implements solutions, and measures results.You are a self starter & visionary with an entrepreneurial spirit! We want and love new ideas to improve our business with that latest technologyJob Duties:Assist with defining and analyzing project scope and system requirements to meet both business and end-user needs.Gather data regarding a business unit's or functional group's business strategy and objectives.Assist with establishing the desired end state of a business unit or functional group.Gather, analyze, and document current practices, workflows, and business needs.Assess business needs and technical solutions to fill gaps in business desired state execution.Assess available technology and suggest alternatives.Assist with project scopes, timeframes, and budgets.Gathers and documents requirements.Inspect test plans to mitigate risks and to ensure the systems meet functional and performance requirements.Make recommendations to immediate team to enhance performance and improve productivity.Assist with cost/benefit analysis when investigating purchase and development decisions.Ensure user acceptance and that business results are met with minimal risk.Assist with a business unit's or functional group's short- and long-term planning Currently pursuing a Bachelors or Masters degree with a graduation date on or after December 2019Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to no discrimination because of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, status as a disabled veteran or veteran of the Vietnam era, or any other legally protected characteristic or activity.

Name: Operations Analyst (Strategy Performance Team)
Description: Combined Insurance, a Chubb Company, is seeking an Operations Analyst to join our fast-paced, high energy, and growing company. For nearly 100 years in the insurance industry, our company has been passionate about serving our customers and providing them peace of mind and protection when they need it the most. Come build your career here, along with other positive, hard-working, talented professionals—just like you!JOB SUMMARY: The mission of the Combined Operations team is to provide quality service to our customers and producers that provides a competitive advantage in the market and supports revenue growth for both existing and new sales channels and markets. Our vision for Operations is to be a unified customer-focused organization emphasizing integrated service, cost effectiveness, efficiency and value.The Operations Strategy & Performance group is responsible for developing key strategies to improve the effectiveness of our Operations in the U.S. and Canada, providing the project leadership and support needed to implement these strategies, and assisting the Operations team with thought leadership and other consulting assistance as needed. The group also provides key support activities related to operational performance and quality including resource planning, scheduling, capacity management, performance measurement and reporting, quality assurance, etc.The Operations Analyst role is a key position within the Operations Strategy and Performance group reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Process Management. This role is focused on business process design and improvement, project management and execution, and impact measurement.This individual will provide business consulting, analytical support and implementation leadership for Operations projects. This person will lead a portfolio of initiatives with multiple deliverables occurring simultaneously. He or she will ensure timely and accurate completion of all team members’ assigned duties to execute and complete the project and meet leadership’s expectations.RESPONSIBILITIES:Work closely with business leaders to evaluate, analyze and define business opportunities, potential solutions, and potential impacts on the organization. Support management in the planning phases, including development of project plans, detailed cost-benefit analyses, resource plans, and other materials required for formal approval.Facilitate the design of new or improved business solutions, processes, and management tools.Coordinate and implement department-level projects, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality project deliverables.Track and communicate project performance to management and key stakeholders.Maintain accurate and complete project records.Support implementation of strategic business initiatives and major projects on behalf of the business by performing additional assignments upon request from management.Build broad understanding of products and systems.Develop working relationships with management and staff across all functional areas.Actively contribute to the development and continuous improvement of the new Operations & Strategy Performance group.SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong strategic and decision-making skillsVery strong consultative and client engagement skillsExperience facilitating workshops or focus groupsExperience integrating business needs with technology capabilitiesExperience defining, documenting, analyzing and improving business processesStrong knowledge of business process management practices as well as LEAN and Six Sigma methodologiesStrong knowledge of project management practicesAbility to multi-task in a fast-paced environmentAbility to work independently on assignments of moderate to high complexityProficient in Microsoft Office; strong Excel, PowerPoint and Visio skillsCOMPETENCIES:Problem-Solving – Takes an organized and logical approach to thinking through problems and complex issues, breaking down issues into manageable parts and looking beyond the obvious to get at root causes.Solution Development – Understands business problems and requirements and develops practical, cost-effective solutions and recommendations.Continuous Learning / Improvement – Demonstrates a desire and capacity to expand expertise, develop new skills and grow professionally as well as think of better ways to do things.Adaptability – Ability to re-direct personal efforts in response to changing circumstances and being receptive to feedback.Results Orientation – Effectively executes on plans, drives for results and takes accountability for outcomes.Relationship-Building – Is helpful, respectful, approachable and team-oriented, building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.Influencing Others – Ability to influence others with facts, trend analysis and other supporting data, to negotiate effectively to effect win-win outcomes, and to engage and motivate team members.Business Acumen – Understands the relationship between the activity and the business / customers impacted and applies business knowledge.EDUCATION:Bachelor’s Degree is required; MBA or other advanced degree is preferred5 to 7 years of business operations, consulting or project management experiencePMP or Six Sigma Black Belt certification is a plusExperience in the insurance industry is preferredOUR BENEFITSAs a Combined corporate employee, you have access to one of the most comprehensive benefit plans in the business, designed to meet your needs and help you reach your financial goals. Our Company is committed to supporting its employees with a comprehensive compensation package that is appropriate in the market where they work. Below are several of the many benefits we offer our employees: Health insurance Dental insurance Tuition reimbursement A company-match 401(k) plan Disability insurance Life insurance Employee referral bonusesABOUT COMBINED INSURANCECombined Insurance is a leading provider of individual supplemental accident, disability, health and life insurance products. With a field sales force and corporate staff in excess of 5,000 people worldwide, Combined Insurance meets the growing coverage needs of policyholders around the globe. We pride ourselves on being customer-centric, people-driven, accountable, performance-minded, and ethical. We invest in our employees and take the time to focus on their development, needs and career aspirations. Our parent company is one of the world’s largest multiline property and casualty insurers. With operations in 54 countries, the Company provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Google

Name: Client Finance Analyst
Description: Are you energized by working with passionate people in a creative environment to help them produce award winning work for clients? Then read on…A Golin Client Finance Analyst is a results driven, team player that works in conjunction with the Lead Client Business Manager, providing the highest level of customer service to internal clients/business leads. You’re the numbers guy/gal, supporting reporting, analysis and initiatives of a book of client business for Golin’s Chicago office. Golin is at the center of the marketing universe with expertise ranging from public relations, brand-building and cutting edge digital content, to corporate reputation, healthcare advocacy and measurement. Our client roster includes many of the largest CPG, retail, food, healthcare technology and consumer service companies in the world, including enviable partnerships with Fortune 500 clients like McDonald’s, Walmart, Unilever, Discover and Amgen.With 50 offices around the world and 60 years of experience, Golin’s purpose is to create change through relevant, brave work worthy of awe and action. “Go All In” is the agency’s ethos and commitment to bravery over mediocrity. We Go All In. In everything we do…. We’re especially committed to Go All In for our people. We challenge our employees to be Courageously Happy, and have empowered them to do so by offering our LifeTime benefits program. Lifetime offers unlimited time off, enhanced family care, ridiculously good health and wellness benefits, the ability to work from anywhere one day a week and a monthly LifeTime stipend for the gym or hobbies. We really do want you to play as hard as you work!Are you ready to GO ALL IN?What You'll Do:Partner with Account / Project Management teams to ensure revenue forecasts, staffing plans, and agency pipeline are up-to-date and accurateInterface with the other Golin finance teams in the US to ensure consistency and compliance with company policy and client contractual agreementsProvide regular reporting & analysis on client programsAct as a trusted business partner to account team membersProvide account teams with budget spend information, partnering with billing team and finance leads to ensure information is timely & accurateReview Aged WIP and work with Local Finance teams to ensure that billings are current across client rosterAssist in resolving client A/R issues as neededSupport Client Compliance audits Special Projects as requiredWhat You Have:Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting with 2-3 years of experienceAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft ExcelKnowledge of SAP a plus but not requiredExcellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skillsStrong organizational and time management skillsAttention to detail, with the ability to balance and prioritize multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentProactive, collaborative dispositionWho You Are:Intellectually curiousProblem SolverAccountableMotivatedStrong Collaborator and CommunicatorGraceful Under PressureDrivenGolin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Name: Senior Business Analyst, Credit Card
Description: Avant is revolutionizing the world of lending by lowering the costs and barriers of borrowing for everyday people. At our core, we are a technology company that builds advanced platforms and uses custom analytics. Today, we help underserved consumers, the majority of whom get fast funding on our online platform without having to talk to anyone. While we believe the perks and benefits that we offer are terrific, nothing excites us more than having the ability to collaborate with intelligent, highly-motivated and talented people on challenging problems as we work to change the face of online lending.

Name: Product Analyst Intern
Description: Product Analyst Intern at Belvedere Trading  Belvedere Trading is looking for team-players who express interest in the financial and technology markets to join Team Belvedere as Product Analysts. At Belvedere Trading, the Product Analyst is responsible for working directly with traders and software developers to invent and improve our proprietary software. After ideas and enhancements are clearly identified, the Product Analyst defines the requirements of the project, prioritizes an effective workflow, and assigns the project to the correct development team. Product Analysts are involved with every project from inception to completion by communicating daily with the Business Process team to ensure that each project is effectively deployed to the traders. Successful candidates are detail-oriented, organized, and able to communicate efficiently with all levels of the organization; they must display a high aptitude for and interest in problem solving! Being a team player is a must; Product Analysts excel in an entrepreneurial and highly collaborative environment.  What our Product Analyst Interns do Work with business project managers and other product analysts to identify and document trading application issues and improvementsAssist with prioritizing projects for software development teams – organization is key!Communicate effectively with all roles, ranging from developers and traders all the way to business ownersEnsure each company-wide software product launch is successful by properly assigning traders to test featuresContinuously liaise with traders and the tech teams to promote the business value of proprietary software products Key qualities in great candidates Undergraduate Computer Science, CIS, Business, Engineering Degree, or Relevant ExperienceSelf-starter and proactive problem solverThrives with minimal direction to create effective business solutionsExcellent written and oral communication skillsDemonstrated ability and desire to learn and use new technologiesGraduation date of December 2019 or May/June 2020 All internships span 10 weeks over the summerRegular on-site attendance is an essential function of this position Who we are  Belvedere Trading is its core values: We strive for excellence as a team and individually (Team Belvedere) and expect merit based responsibilities and compensation (Me in Team)We value innovation delivered incrementally (Iterative Innovation) and expect all to act like owners (Own it)We communicate passionately and with compassion to reach the best solutions (Passionate Discourse) These values help guide us as a firm and as individuals. We are excited to bring those who have similar beliefs to join our family.  What we offer  Rated as one of the Top 25 Best Places to Work for Recent Grads by Symplicity, Belvedere Trading places a great emphasis on an employees’ overall well-being. We offer a casual work environment that promotes innovation and creativity. Our employees’ health is important, so we provide full benefits and a robust wellness program including: in-office yoga, health seminars, and discounted gym memberships. Belvedere also recognizes the positive effects of a strong work-life balance by having an unlimited, paid time off policy. Most importantly, Team Belvedere likes to have fun, both inside and outside the office walls! Sponsorship is not available for this positionAll candidates must have GPA listed on their resumesIt is recommended that candidates apply to only one of our 2019 Summer Intern Roles: Trader Trainee Intern, Hybrid Trader Trainee Intern, Software Engineer Intern, Product Analyst Intern, or FPGA Developer InternPlease apply for the role that most interests you and best fits your skill-set. If we believe you are better suited for a different role at Belvedere Trading, we will let you know!

Name: Senior Business Consultant
Description: Description BT Partners is changing the way Executives manage their business through Domo. Pivotal within the most innovative business management platform, our Domo consulting team is a game changer in providing strategic deployment services. BT Partners is in need of an experienced Business Consultant who has advanced domain knowledge in one or more vertical industry (e.g. Finance, Retail, Media & Entertainment) is also an asset. A successful candidate will have demonstrated sustained exceptional performance, innovation, creativity, insight, and sound judgment.Team CultureWork - A Business Consultant on the Client Services team at BT Partners works within an engagement team and is responsible for identifying business requirements, requirements management, functional design, prototyping, process design and supporting implementations. Fight - We fight to satisfy all Domo customers. Our goal is to do everything possible to make the implementation a smooth, timely, and positive experience for the customer.Innovate – We aren’t just gathering requirements for the customer. We are leading strategic conversations around how data can transform the way our customers’ run their business.Create – Our Domo Consultants needs to be able to create long-lasting relationships with our customers. We need to build trust, so our customers know we will deliver on our promises and deadlines.Serve - We serve the customer. In short, we deliver unparalleled quality and value, so our customers tell us.Key ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Consultant owns end to end deployment processes and resources while managing relationships with Domo customersWorks with customers, end-users, technical architects, and application designers to define the data requirements and structure for Business Intelligence (BI) applicationsAt least two years of experience managing cost, schedule, and performance for all aspects of requirements definition and management activities for simple to moderately complex deployment projectsExperience working with business users to gather requirements, writing functional and technical specifications and communicating technical requirementsAbility to have discussions around customer data maturity and strategy while recommending appropriate solutions Job RequirementsThe successful candidate will 5+ years of consulting (or related) experience. This individual will join an enthusiastic, fast-paced and dynamic team at BT Partners.Demonstrated excellence in presenting complex development topics to both executive and technical personnel.Working knowledge of specialized BI tools and solution providers.Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments.Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint).Strong knowledge and application of data literacy.Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.Leading discovery sessions with C-suite individuals to identify data maturity strategies.Experience conducting requirements analysis, meeting with business owners, and performing current state analysis.Experience developing conceptual and technical designs, including the use of object-oriented analysis and design techniques.Experience in recognizing business problems and recommending/developing solutions.Ability to effectively manage customer expectations and project deliverables.College degree in related field, and equivalent experience.

Name: Senior Financial & Strategic Planning Analyst
Description: Job Summary: Responsible for budget development, financial analysis and strategic planning activities for the Central Bank Services (CBS) division. Provides analytical support for more complex financial projects in the Division, ensuring compliance with financial and cost accounting rules and Federal Reserve System policies. Interacts with internal project teams and work groups regularly including management within the Division. Manages relationships with internal and external key stakeholders with supervision. Develops and performs analysis of reports, charts and graphs for use by the CBS leadership team such as monthly expense results, forecasts, and variances. Provides key decision-makers with briefings and reports. Coordinates the strategic planning process for the Division and assists in the development of and reporting on performance metrics and targets. Performs other projects and analytical work in support of Division initiatives. May provide work direction and assignments, as well as training, to staff who are not direct reports. The level of work required is considered advanced and staff must be able to work under minimum supervision. This job has no direct reports. Principal Duties and Responsibilities:Coordinates expense and project budget/forecasting and cost accounting activities including updating and maintaining financial systems and recordsCommunicates with management team on Bank budget guidance, schedules, and tolerancesEvaluates and communicates financial results with CBS management and stakeholders, prepares variance explanations and develops financial-related reports and recommendations for managementDevelops complex forecasts and recommendations for expense and capital budgetsIdentifies process improvement opportunities and may redefine operating proceduresCoordinates and supports management on Division wide strategic and budget meeting planning activitiesAssists in the development of the Division`s annual budget presentation to senior managementCoordinates and/or participates in Division analytic and strategic projects, including DDT analysisAssists Division management with facilities projects, budgeting, and planning by serving as liaison to the Facilities Dept.Develops management reports, presentations and briefing materials and responds to management inquiriesDevelops and maintains a thorough knowledge of financial and cost accounting rules, procedures and systemsReviews invoices for payment and approves requisitions in LawsonLeads and/or participates on projects and ad hoc studiesResponsible for directing the Division`s Asset Management process which includes provisioning of assets and maintaining accurate records of assets utilized by the DivisionLeads and/or participates on projects and ad hoc studiesAssists Division management with discretionary spending requestsCreates and maintains content for Division`s Internal WebsiteSupport facilities related work projects and needs of the DivisionEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience5 to 7 years of related working experienceKnowledge and Skills:Strong knowledge, budget and accounting and administrative practices and policiesProficiency with Microsoft Office applicationsExcellent analytical, problem-solving, organizational and project management skillsExcellent written and oral communications skillsKnowledge of financial modeling tools and current technologiesAbility to think strategically, apply independent thinking and appropriate judgments in decision makingStrong teamwork, interpersonal skills and ability to influence without authorityAbility to work under tight time constraintsStrong customer focusStrong organizational awarenessExperience with Sharepoint Site ManagementKnowledge of web content managementProficiency with financial automation toolsOther Requirements and Physical Requirements: This document indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. An employee's responsibilities, tasks, and duties might differ from those outlined in the job description, and other duties, as assigned, are a part of the job. The Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago reserves the right to modify the elements of this job description, as business needs require.

Name: Analyst Marketing Analytics
Description: OverviewHAVI is a privately held global company that innovates, optimizes and drives the supply chains and marketing promotions of many of the best known brands in the world. When you work at HAVI, you have a chance to make your mark – to be a part of work that drives value, brings a smile and keeps everyday life moving forward. Which means it’s not the size of our global footprint, but rather your personal fingerprint, that has the power to make a real difference for our customers… and to touch the lives of people both at home and around the world.ResponsibilitiesAs part of the Global Marketing Analytics and Consulting team, the Marketing Analyst role focuses on the execution and delivery of analytics initiatives for both internal and external clients. Initiatives span multiple disciplines including Marketing, Supply Chain, and Agency.  Specific projects examples are: Utilizing and improving advanced statistical models on marketing and sales dataDelivering an analysis of a marketing campaign’s resultsPresenting data driven solutions and tools to a marketing audienceGenerating high quality and understandable data visuals for presentations The ideal candidate is able to: Provide support to the Global Marketing Analytics Team in a wide variety of tasks, delivering Analytics Solutions towards a diverse group of customersDeliver analyses, tools, and reports in a way which is clearly understood by a multi-tier audience and allows the customer to use in a way which is meaningful to their businessSupport a team responsible for the planning and execution of successful analytics initiatives and projects for our clientsEmbrace continuous improvement of existing methodologies and analytics processesWork on innovative projects, applying creative skills to deliver new things that add more valueTake ownership for assigned projects and ensures clear internal communication on status and milestones.Build reports/dashboards and develop ad-hoc analysis of sales data and consumer activity to provide further insights and recommendations for Business Insights and Marketing customers. Desired Skills & ExperienceBachelor’s degree with a strong statistical component (e.g. business administration, psychology, econometrics)2-4 years of experience in the field of Marketing AnalyticsStrong statistical skills and good knowledge of marketing strategy and tacticsAdvanced capability in using analytics software such as R, Python, SPSS, SAS or SQLAdvanced capability in using visualization software such as Tableau, Power BI or Qlik is preferredStrong proven analytical skillsProven affinity with MarketingExperience in analyzing and drawing insights from large datasets is an additional benefit for this roleStrong proficiency in PowerPoint and Word, Expert knowledge of Excel requiredExcellent interpersonal and team skills, able to build a relationship with the customerStrong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex information to a broad audience of various levelsFast-learner who can work under pressure and with tight timelinesBe able to work independently, own work for smaller projects, as well as work collaboratively on small teams for larger projectsDemonstrated strategic problem-solving skills with the ability to organize, develop a work plan, analyze, and draw conclusions from dataStrong attention to detail, focus on efficiency, and delivers work with accuracy BenefitsOur total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. While individual program components may differ by country, some things remain constant:  …our commitment to rewarding results  …the opportunity to work with talented and driven individuals at every level of our company who respect each other, treat each other fairly and hold one another accountable for our customers’—and our company’s success

Name: Principal Analyst, Sales Operations
Description: The Opportunity: As a Principal Analyst at Venafi, you'll be part of an extremely motivated, dedicated, and experienced team that contributes directly and significantly to Sales Operations.  We're looking for inherently curious, intelligent, out-of-the-box thinkers. The Principal Analyst, Sales Operations reports to the Director of Sales Operations. Key Result Areas:Manage and analyze sales data from internal and external sources for advanced interpretation and predictive analytics to drive sales/marketing strategy and actions and to inform other functional areas as needed Includes field productivity analyses and the sales funnel contribution in lead to revenue modeling and analysesWork with marketing operations to advance lead to revenue modeling from lead through opportunity evolution to closed won statusSales forecasting for goal setting, using past data and trending indicatorsReport sales resultsWorking with other team members, define sales process steps to improve conversions, shorten sales cycles, and maximize winsWorking with other functional areas as applicable, define sales territories (e.g. named account dispersion)Key team player in defining and refining structured sales and operational processes for efficiency (e.g. ARR calculations for sales reporting, forecast criteria/steps, order fulfillment, etc.)Participate as a key player in sales and overall business operations planningPrimary team lead in gathering and defining business requirements associated with special sales operations related projects, including advancement of substantive operational/business processes in SFDC and other relevant systems managed by Sales Ops; work with responsible team players (e.g. Lead SFDC Administrator) to implement.System administration for AvisoThese responsibilities require effective communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to collaborate productively within the Sales Operations team and across functions, and strong analytical skills.Minimum Skills and Experience required:Advanced Excel skillsAbility to function in a fast-paced environmentTime management/Prioritization skillsExperience using SalesforceUnderstanding of financial forecast and modeling conceptsWhat sets you apart:Advanced Salesforce.com skillsAbility to effectively communicate at VP levels and aboveStrong PowerPoint skillsBI and data modeling/visualization skillsExposure to high-tech sales environmentsUnderstanding of subscription software conceptsAbout Venafi: Venafi is the cybersecurity market leader in machine identity protection, securing machine-to-machine connections and communications. Venafi protects machine identity types by orchestrating cryptographic keys and digital certificates for SSL/TLS, IoT, mobile and SSH. Venafi provides global visibility of machine identities and the risks associated with them for the extended enterpriseon premises, mobile, virtual, cloud and IoT at machine speed and scale.  Venafi puts this intelligence into action with automated remediation that reduces the security and availability risks connected with weak or compromised machine identities while safeguarding the flow of information to trusted machines and preventing communication with machines that are not trusted. Internally, we have an exceptional culture built around our core values comprised of honesty, transparency, leading by example, awareness, risk taking, and team before self.  Come join us!

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Salem Tech, a division of The Salem Group, is currently hiring a Business Analyst for a contract position at our client in Chicago, IL.  We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst who has experience working in customer-facing roles, providing consultancy and analysis services on a broad range of assignments.  As a Business Analyst you will work in our team of analysts on large and commercially important projects. Together with your team you will perform the business and software requirements analysis for external customers. Your team will also identify business opportunities and product features for products and work with an agile development team to deliver feature rich solutions.  Successful candidates will need to have the following in terms of experience:  ? Strong experience in a business consultancy or equivalent role  ? Good awareness and understanding of commercial bid and tendering processes  ? A proven background in working on software development projects in a requirements analysis role  ? Can articulate examples of large multiple system implementation projects in a customer environment  ? Experience of working as the analyst in an agile software delivery team  ? Experience of working on multiple and varied projects, delivering a variety of software applications, with lottery or gaming experience being an advantage  And will have the following in terms of skills and knowledge:  ? Perform the business, process and software requirements analysis on large projects  ? Analyze products, suppliers and competitors and advise on which actions to take  ? Possess a variety of analysis techniques that can be adapted to suit different projects and customers  ? Define the logical architecture for large product developments and implementations  ? Consult and advise customers on a variety of topics  ? Have an excellent knowledge of digital channels and e-commerce products and services  ? Have a good understanding of software/application architecture and design methods  ? Have sufficient technical skills in order to contribute to the design and architecture of technology solutions  In order to complement our team, it’s important to us that new team members have the following personal characteristics:  ? Excellent interpersonal skills  ? A professional, credible and measured demeanor  ? Engaging, influential, dynamic and authoritative  ? Flexible, pragmatic and capable of adapting to customer and project needs  ? Capable of operating in wide range of environments, cultures and customer situations  EEO  The Salem Group considers applications for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status or any other legally protected status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst - CHI
Description: DescriptionTeam Daugherty is looking to add a Business Analyst to the Chicago team! This individual will be involved in the creation, design and build of new business models and, upon completion, integration and operation of them. Working across the spectrum of management consulting activity and industries, you will have greater opportunities to broaden your career and tackle complex stimulating challenges. This will enable you to accumulate the requisite skills and experiences to develop the functional and industry expertise needed to progress within management consulting and continue to deliver value to our clients.  As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for the following: Serving as knowledge owner for a single system or business process area.Working with a team to analyze, diagnose and resolve unpredictable and varied problems using diverse methods and tools.Advising client users on application design alternatives and business process change opportunities.Connecting user needs to emerging technologies in order to acquire or design tools, techniques and approaches that allow client users to realize optimal project delivery results.Delivering integrated business systems support to users (internal and external to IT), and applying an expert understanding of the business issues and the impact of technology.Executing and managing moderate functional testing efforts.Identifying, addressing, managing and escalating risks and issues within a project. We are looking for someone with: 8+ years related experience in a business analysis role within IT departments and management consulting organizations.Preferred depths in at least one of the following areas: systems integration, business process management, financial analysis, marketing, supply chain, retail or telecommunications.Experience with UI/UX.Experience with Wireframe tools such as InVision.Strong knowledge of requirements gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.Familiarity with several software delivery methodologies (RUP/Agile/Waterfall).Proven experience working in an Agile environment.Strong knowledge of requirement gathering, use case analysis and user acceptance testing.CBAP for business analysis (preferred). We offer members of Team Daugherty: Excellent health, dental and vision insurance.Revenue sharing and a 401(k) retirement savings plan.Life, disability and long-term care insurance.Little to no travel.Robust career development and training. Do you think you’re a good fit for Team Daugherty? Apply now and find out why working here satisfies the smart, the talented and the curious!

Name: Management Consultant
Description: Strive Consulting, LLC is hiring for Management Consultants of all levels of experience to oversee large-budget programs within a variety of industries. These are full-time opportunities based out of our brand-new headquarters in downtown Chicago.  Strive is a nationally recognized leader in technology solutions and services with offices in Chicago, Atlanta, Dallas and Columbus. We have the people, processes, and tools to provide companies with strategic guidance on business-critical initiatives and deliver end-to-end solutions in a variety of areas.
