Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Details GENERAL SUMMARY: Maintains compensation models for physicians and mid-level providers. Assists with financial and statistical studies and analyses of strategic, business, operating and financial issues, and communicates the results of these analyses to management for decisions and actions in order to improve management control, profitability, process improvement and productivity.  Full-Time, Exempt position  Benefits status: Full-Time  Location: Edward Hospital, Naperville  PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (The following duties and responsibilities are all essential job functions, as defined by the ADA, except those that begin with the word "May.") Collects, calculates, analyzes and maintains compensation models and incentive plans for multispecialty physician and mid-level providers, including but not limited to Edward Medical Group.Prepares appropriate month end compensation calculations for accounting department.Assists with annual compensation analysis and fair market value reviews.Assists in development of business plans via analysis of financial proforma, market conditions, competitor services and internal resources. Monitors and revises approved business plans as requested.Assists in development and prepares monthly analysis, such as practice profitability analysis, quality analysis, productivity analysis, in order to identify opportunities for improvement consistent with corporate objectives.Prepares and submits annual financial benchmarking data for industry surveys.Assists departments in capital and operating budget preparation.Reviews and interprets compensation agreements.Maintains a variety of internal and external contacts necessary to gather and exchange information and coordinate projects and planning activities. Presents analyses and recommendations to managers as required.Maintains knowledge of current trends and developments in the field by reading appropriate books, journals and other literature and attending related conferences, seminars and the like.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:Required education and/or experience: Ø Bachelor's degree in a business-related or health-care related field  Ø Knowledge of Microsoft Office products Excel, PowerPoint, Word  Ø 1-2 yrs previous experience as a financial analyst Preferred education and/or experience: Ø Knowledge of database management programs ex. Business Object, Access  Ø Previous healthcare business-related experience  Ø Bachelor's degree in Accounting  > Previous experience with Physician Compensation ModelsSDL2017

Name: Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally. Our nine major business lines include Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Securities, and the Investment Portfolio. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following, and adhering to and if applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. Eastdil Secured LLCOverview Eastdil Secured is the foremost provider of financial advisory services to real estate owners. We combine superior capital markets expertise with a deep understanding of real estate fundamentals to execute a wide range of transactions for our clients ultimately producing superior results. By maintaining an effective platform that combines conventional real estate advisory and brokerage with the corporate finance and capital markets expertise of an investment bank, Eastdil Secured creates value for clients through unparalleled advisory services, individually-tailored structures, and marketing/placement programs that set the industry standard. Through the ability to navigate the challenges presented in any economic environment, Eastdil Secured maximizes opportunities with customer-crafted, revolutionary strategies that produce the most optimal and efficient transactions possible.  Our team is dedicated to the sale, financing and recapitalization of all major real estate product types including office, retail, and hospitality, industrial and multifamily properties throughout North America. Widely recognized for our capital markets and real estate expertise, our team is also known for their distinguishing access and credibility, incomparable experience, outstanding client service, and proven track record. Training Analysts start with an in-house training program in Santa Monica before beginning work with the Equity Sales group. The training focuses on financial accounting, cash flow analysis, credit analysis, financial modeling and valuation. Analysts will also receive on-the-job coaching, mentoring and feedback throughout their tenure. Opportunities Opportunities exist in New York, Boston, Santa Monica, Washington DC, Atlanta, Dallas, San Francisco and Chicago based on business need. The analyst program is an initial two-year commitment with an opportunity to stay longer at the firms discretion. ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with senior team members on presentations and financial analysis;Assisting team in underwriting for asset sales and debt placement across all property types;Performing comprehensive and in-depth company, real estate, and market analysis;Due diligence collection and review;Creating pitches, proposals, and marketing materials;Participating in client interactions to gain exposure to key executives and senior bankersRequired Qualifications1+ year of experience real estate experience, financial services experience, or a combination of bothOther Desired QualificationsA current student pursuing a bachelors degree with academic distinction and coursework in economics, financial accounting, corporate finance and/or real estate with anticipated graduation in May 2019.Professional experience through internships, part-time or full-time work and/or extra-curricular activities.Candidates must be able to work in the United States on a permanent basis.Candidates must demonstrate a combination of academic aptitude, quantitative skills, personal motivation, and distinguished written and oral communication skills. It is strongly preferred that your background includes:Dedication to building a career in the financial services industry with a focus on real estate finance;Willingness to work long hours in a demanding, highly focused, collaborative, and team environment;Energetic self-starter who is flexible, organized, conscientious, proactive, and detail-oriented;An individual who demonstrates a sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: DescriptionAt Exelon, we've got a place for you!  Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.  Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.  Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon! PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION This position serves as the primary Health and Safety resource for technical expertise and management of local safety issues 24/7/365 with primary responsibility for health and safety compliance, procedure development, local health and safety awareness and information sharing. Establishes appropriate metrics, monitors performance, facilitates culture change initiatives, and performs incident analysis/root cause investigations of personal injury and motor vehicle accidents.  Achieves results through communication and strong relationships with Operations regions/divisions. Key activities required of the position include maintenance of established safety programs, implementation of the utility safety operating plan and technical support to clients on Health and Safety issues.  Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies. PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIESAccountabilityProvide coaching, consultation, and technical support to EED Operation regions/divisions. Support local safety councils in the development and maintenance of safety plans. 40Manage the local resolution process of safety and health issues as they arise, via analysis, benchmarking, risk management and regulatory interface. 30Provide coaching and mentoring to leadership in the area of Safety Culture Change (Director thru Represented employees) 15Maintain injury record keeping in accordance with federal regulation, and manages overall accident reporting process including understanding of the facts of each event, determining recordability while maintaining the confidentiality of employee personal information and medical conditions. 10Interpret, advise recommend, and ensure compliance with local and federal regulations. (OSHA and DOT). Interface with regulators and external customers as needed. 5POSITION SPECIFICATIONSMinimum:B. S. /B. A. in safety, industrial hygiene, engineering or related technical field and 5-8 years experience in utility operations or in EH & S field or minimum 10 years field experience in utility operations.Attention to detail, sense of urgency.Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and self-initiating.Demonstrated ability to trigger action and achieve results through personal influence.Demonstrated ability to analyze data, interpret information, and formulate recommendations.Demonstrated ability to work effectively in both individual and team-based environments.Demonstrated ability to build consensus, establish trust.Demonstrated knowledge of the fundamental principles of leadership.Demonstrated ability to negotiate effectively and facilitate conflict resolution.Demonstrated business acumen, employee awareness and ability to create value.Working knowledge of PC, and Microsoft Office Programs.Excellent oral and written communication skills. Valid drivers license.Preferred:Broad knowledge of applicable state and federal safety laws and regulations.Broad knowledge of industrial hygiene principles.Broad knowledge of electric and gas distribution field operations.Broad knowledge of EH & S regulations and scientific principles.Demonstrated ability to support cross-functional teams.Demonstrated ability to implement process enhancements and efficiencies including technology and performance.Certified Utility Safety Associate, Certified Safety Professional or other comparable safety professional certification(s).Qualifications- This position serves as the internal expert for utility safety compliance. ; The incumbent provides technical guidance, support and direction for clients and key stakeholders with a goal of maintaining or improving the level of compliance in client operations. ; The position provides direction for the implementation of activities required to meet corporate strategic initiatives.This position is direct report to the Safety Lead for the applicable operating company and is a dotted line report to operations regional management. ; The job requires managing client services across multiple division/regional service locations and supporting a client base of 500 700 employees.This position includes response to safety emergencies outside of normal working hours, including on-call duty schedules and utility mutual aid assignments as required. Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.  VEVRAA Federal Contractor  EEO is the Law Poster

Name: Risk Analyst
Description: Avant is revolutionizing the world of lending by lowering the costs and barriers of borrowing for everyday people. At our core, we are a technology company that builds advanced platforms and uses custom analytics. Today, we help underserved consumers, the majority of whom get fast funding on our online platform without having to talk to anyone. Tomorrow we plan to use our world class technology and underwriting capabilities to launch new products and bank partnerships that improve peoples financial lives.Job DescriptionLets get to business. Avant is looking for a new seasoned analytics professional to join the team in Chicago. This position plays a critical role in Avants Fraud Analytics Team. This role would be working directly on developing new fraud prevention strategies to minimize risk and optimize the customer experience for Avants unsecured loan product. We are looking for a hands on candidate who takes ownership and seeks opportunities. Prior fraud analytics experience is not required. What you do at Avant:Using visualization tools to build dashboards and monitor key performance indicators Using data to understand new ways of finding impactful insights from limited data sets and develop recommendations Collaborating with cross-functional business partners on new initiatives, project requests, prioritization and deliveryDeveloping and implementing verification rules using analytical methods like segmentation, predictive models, hypothesis testing, etc.Communicating strategies/proposals/solutions to key stakeholdersWhy you are a fit for Avant:Bachelor's Degree in related field1+ years analytical experience1+ years of experience leveraging data tools such as SQL, R, PythonAbility to translate analysis results into clearly defined and implementable strategies/rulesStrong quantitative and problem-solving skills with key attention to detailHigh level of inquisitiveness, initiative and critical thinking Proven ability to effectively communicate with all levels of staff and managementWhy Avant is a fit for you:At Avant, we believe our values make a difference:We value, support, and help each other growWe are committed to active inclusion and diversityWe are transparent and believe the best idea winsWe succeed when our customers succeedWe get sh!t done responsiblyAnd we keep it fun!We believe that ideas are more important than titles, everything is more fun together, everyone drives change, and everyone is an owner. While we believe the perks and benefits that we offer are terrific, nothing excites us more than having the ability to collaborate with intelligent, highly-motivated and talented people on challenging problems as we work to change the face of online lending.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: We are seeking a Business Analyst who can work independently or with minimal supervision in a fast-paced environment. This requires high proficiency in IT requirements documentation and experience with custom web applications based on Microsoft technologies. closerlook's Business Analyst works with members of the Software Development, Quality Assurance, User Experience, and Project Management teams to help create innovative, high-quality web applications, advanced reports and digital offerings for our clients in the pharmaceutical industry. The Business Analyst ensures requirements are addressed before a technical solution is designed and implemented. The Business Analyst plays a key role in the closerlook project lifecycle and ensures that the final deliverable meets client expectations and adds to the bottom line. Responsibilities Requirements Planning & Analysis Determine a projects requirements by extracting them from documentation, as well as from the Account Manager, Project Manager, Strategist and clients, through interaction and research.Anticipate requirements that may be needed in the future.Maintain focus on core project need and not users personal preferences, functions related to trends or outdated processes, or other non-essential modifications.Translate project requirements to technical requirements. This includes analysis of strategic project objectives to practical technical solutions. Supports closerlooks Agile process Participates in scrum meetings; communicates a detailed understanding of scope, requirements, and deliverables of projects.Acts as a resource to clarify and scope tasks for members of the Agile team.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Continuous Improvement Improves systems by studying current practices; recommending and/or designing modifications.Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.Qualifications and SkillsBachelor's degree.5 + years relevant experience.Experience with commercial ERP, CRM, and/or Marketing Automation Systems required.Experience with SQL based database systems, T-SQL helpful but not required.Salesforce.com, Marketo experience preferred.Proven skills documenting business project requirements.Demonstrated project management skills.Demonstrated change management experience amongst executives, managers and endusers.Prior experience in high-tech or software company operations is preferred. To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Dealing with Ambiguity Effectively copes with change; ability to shift gears; can decide and act without having the total picture; embraces when things are up in the air.Curiosity Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity.Fast-paced Must thrive in a fast-paced environment.Functional/Technical Skills Has the functional and technical skills to do the job at a high level of accomplishment.Informing Provides information people need to know to do their jobs; provides individuals information so that they can make accurate decisions; is timely with information.Learning on the Fly Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes success and failures as clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.Listening Practices attentive and active listening; has the patience to hear people out; can accurately restate the opinions of others even when he/she disagrees.Skilled Can marshal resources (people, funding, material or support) to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently; arranges information and files in a useful manner.Teamwork Demonstrates teamwork skills, including mentoring and developing junior staff.Thought Partner Ability to be a strong thought-partner to cross-functional colleagues.SDL2017

Name: Business Operations Analyst Intern, Summer
Description: Are you passionate about data? Can you find and solve problems we haven't discovered yet? Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success.The Business Operations team bridges the operational and product sides of Groupon, using a strategic mindset, analytical thinking, and operational horsepower to drive business value from our product and engineering investments. With an alignment to specific product areas such as search, conversion, customer engagement and more, they develop the knowledge and insights that fuel our product strategy & development.As an intern on the Business Operations team, you'll partner with Product Managers, Engineering, Marketing and Sales to identify and drive strategic and operational improvements that deliver sustainable lift to the organization. You’ll apply your expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to understand how users interact with Groupon's offerings. You’ll also quantify the value & size of new opportunities to inform and prioritize product roadmaps. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?As an intern, you should expect:Exposure; Being a household name gives employees the opportunity to work in startup-like environment and focus on deeply interesting work that you wouldn’t get to do anywhere else - prepare to make a large scale impact in a short amount of timeProfessional Development; Participate in weekly “lunch and learns” with other engineering and business functions, skill building workshops, and networking sessionsFun; Explore the area through our planned intern social outings, and develop your network while getting to know your peers and Groupon’s leadersMentorship; Look forward to one-on-one time with dedicated managers and mentors to facilitate your growth throughout the summer internship experienceYou’ll spend time on the following:Develop & test hypotheses to explain both macro and micro trends and opportunities in the businessDesign both the business logic and the technical specifications required to extract key data elements from Groupon productsCreate dashboards to display and communicate product performance towards achieving product goalsReview product performance, advise on areas of opportunity, and analyze A/B testing and other experimental data to measure the impact of new features within our platformsDevelop effective statistical models for segmentation, classification, optimization, and moreWe’re excited about you if you have:Currently enrolled in a BS or MS program with a focus on business operations, engineering, analysis and strategyYou're passionate about data, product development and e-commerceYou are able to effectively convey complex information to a broad audienceYou’re able to work collaboratively in an environment that promotes constant team communicationYou're a creative problem solver who can identify problems unilaterally and recommend effective plans of actionStrong organizational, planning, quantitative, and problem solving skills; strategic and creative thinking with keen business judgment, focus, and ability to see the "big picture"You can translate business objectives and problems into analytic problems, and analytic solutions into actionable business solutionsYou are skilled in both Excel and SQL

Name: Implementation Consultant
Description: Position SummaryThe Implementation Consultant works with customers to implement various Descartes solutions. The most commonly implemented solutions related to this role include transportation and mobile resource management applications. The Implementation Consultant participates in, and sometimes owns and leads, customer projects. These projects typically consist of business process analysis, design, configuration, testing and go-live support activities related to the implementation of Descartes’ solutions. The Implementation Consultant is also responsible for training activities related to the implementation and deployment of Descartes’ solutions.ResponsibilitiesAnalyze and assess customer requirements.Analyze customer’s routing, scheduling, transportation management and related logistics operations and recommend improvements based on customer’s operational requirements.Design and configure systems according to client/server architecture.Analyze, design and test proprietary software applications.Apply knowledge of logistics operations and logistics software solutions using graphical user interface-based tools.Implement and configure Descartes’ proprietary applications and solutions.Train customers on Descartes’ proprietary products and solutions.Create and document future client business processes based on software to be implemented, including interface requirements.Interface with customer IT/IS department to facilitate software configuration and design changes.Respond to customer application problems and provide post-implementation technical support based on a detailed understanding of the functional conceptual features of Descartes’ proprietary software and applications.This position will require up to 20-35% travel.QualificationsBachelor degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain/Logistics Management, or related field of study is required.3 - 5 years of related experience is required. SQL: Ability to construct select, update, insert and delete Queries with multi-table joins (4+ tables).Understand the advantages and differences of a normalized database structure.Ability to create tables, stored procedures and agent jobs.Ability to set up and interpret SQL Profiles.Ability to analyze queries for improvements.Understand the difference between isolation levels (e.g. read uncommitted (NOLOCK), read committed and serializable). Server/Network: Experience with managing IIS-based applications.Ability to log files, application pools, etc.Understanding and experience with configuring clustering technologies.Knowledge of MSCS - Microsoft Cluster Services.Understanding of hardware load balancer (application configuration).Knowledge of NLB - Microsoft Network Load Balancing.Strong familiarity with Windows server environments.Working knowledge of Networking Components (switches, routers, VLAN's, tracing, ping, firewalls, etc.).Experience with disaster recovery planning. Programming/Integration: Experience creating/reading XML documents.Ability to create xpath statements to read specific data elements from XMLs.Ability to interpret/create XSL translations.Experience mapping data between 2 different systems.Knowledge of scripting (VBScript, JavaScript, CMD, etc.) and programming (C#, VB, etc.).OfferWe offer a flexible and casual work environment, as well as mentorship and on-the-job training to support your personal growth. You will have an opportunity to contribute new ideas and we welcome your fresh perspective.Application InstructionsPlease submit your resume and a covering letter describing why you are a unique fit for this position, to jobsna@descartes.com citing “Implementation Consultant” in the subject of your message. We thank all applicants for their interest in Descartes; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Agency calls will not be accepted. All final candidates will be required to provide professional references and complete a background check, which will include a criminal background check and verification of education and previous employment.  Descartes Systems (USA) LLC, inclusive of any of its American subsidiaries (Descartes), is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Arthur J. Gallagher, Inc., one of the world's largest insurance brokerage and risk management services firms, provides a full range of retail and wholesale property/casualty (P/C) brokerage and alternative risk transfer services globally, as well as employee benefit brokerage, consulting and actuarial services. AJG also offers claims and information management, risk control consulting and appraisal services to clients around the world. If you're looking for a professional career with an industry leader then you have come to the right place. Wherever your interests lie, we're sure you will agree on one thing: our continued prosperity hinges on our greatest resource --- our people.Do you like a challenge? If there is one thing the Insurance Industry agrees on, it’s that A Big Change is around the corner. Tech startups are bent on disruption, existing firms are exploring new methods and the industry is primed for a great idea to change the whole playing field. Arthur J. Gallagher is in the game, and is looking for individuals who are ready and able to challenge a trillion dollar industry.The Business Analyst will support the data and analytics initiatives at Arthur J. Gallagher. The analyst will research data trends to assist leaders in formulating strategic plans, create new analyses based on cutting edge analytical techniques and provide structure to data flows from a wide variety of sources. Focus will be on building new and upgrading existing, insights, tools, databases and processes.Position Summary:Advise on in-production data base improvements, and build Ad Hoc database.Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to complex datasets.Build new key performance indicators after researching and integrating new data sources.Identifies external/internal trends and developments and presents findings to management. Additional Considerations:Build production ready Macros and Functions for data cleansing and analysis.Ensure data quality is sufficient for analytical purpose.Work with IT to develop a data base structure that optimizes our ability to conduct analysis.Develop relationships with management to gain a deep understanding of the business and identify opportunities to positively impact results. Blend multiple analytical tools to analyze data and present those analyses.Use fact-based and forward-looking analysis to influence action.Required:Bachelors degree 2 or more years related work experience Desired:Degree in Accounting or Finance discipline Certified Management Accountant (CMA) or Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) #LI-KF1U.S. Eligibility Requirements:Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered. Must be 18 years of age or older. Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation. Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the U.S. For U.S. employment opportunities, Gallagher hires U.S. citizens, permanent residents, asylees, refugees, and temporary residents. Temporary residence does not include those with non-immigrant work authorization (F, J, H, or L visas), such as students in practical training status. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill. Gallagher will require proof of work authorization. Must be willing to execute the Company's Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement which requires, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality, and non-disclosure. Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, color, religion, sex, age, veteran status, disability, national origin, or any other legally protected status. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Name: Customer Sales Analyst
Description: Our CompanyThe Kraft Heinz Company is revolutionizing the food industry – we will be the most profitable food company powered by the most talented people with unwavering commitment to our communities, leading brands and highest product quality in every category in which we compete. As a global powerhouse, Kraft Heinz represents over $26 billion in revenue and is the 5th largest food and beverage company in the world. At Kraft Heinz, to be the BEST food company, growing a BETTER world is more than a dream – it is our GLOBAL VISION. To be the best, we want the best – best brands, best practices and, most importantly, the best people.It's a Question of TasteDo more, be more. Whatever your aspirations, experience something exceptional at Kraft Heinz. We'll give you the freedom to determine your own direction and deliver in your own style. Outperform our expectations and you'll move forward faster than you ever thought possible. Come ready to dream. Come eager to grow.Get a taste of what your career could be at kraftheinzcompany.com/careers.Job DescriptionUnder the direction of the Customer Business Lead, the Customer Sales Analyst (CSA) provides data management support to the sales team to enable the team to drive sales and consumption results with the customer. The CSA provides accurate reporting to allow for identification of drivers and drags for the business (positives & negative identification). The CSA ensures that customer, consumer, and internal information are used to build knowledge and insights that can be used to improve overall performance and results. The Customer Sales Analyst provides data into inventory management, identification of opportunities with the finance team to provide analytics based on sales margin contributions, and works with the category leadership teams to analyze and monitor distribution.Primary Responsibilities:Data Reporting and Analysis Responsible for pulling & creating daily, weekly, and monthly reports regarding sales and consumption for the sales teamArea expert in the analysis of syndicated (Nielsen AOD/SPARK) data and leading to key insights and business recommendations on the key sales controllables of distribution and assortment, pricing, and promotionManages internal team rewrites (for indirect customers) with SPARK teamIn depth understanding of KHC categories and how data bases differSales support to ensure that customer, consumer, and category insights are delivered for fact based decision-making.Other Job Related Activities Management of team site & folders consistent with area goals and objectivesConducts training of area personnel to broaden their understanding of sales information and tools available for business tracking and analysis.Job Skill Qualifications/Abilities:Minimum Bachelors degreeAdvanced Excel skills including vlookup, vlookup with match, index array with match, pivot tables and charts, nested logic formulas, charting, and other functionsSharepoint or internal web page understanding preferredExposure to Sales reporting data bases1-3 years related experienceKraft Heinz is an EEO employer – Minorities/Women/Vets/Disabled and other protected categories.Location(s)Chicago/Aon Center, Minneapolis Sales

Name: Business Analyst - IT
Description: OverviewGood people, working with good people, for our common good. Sound good? KeHE-a natural, organic, specialty and fresh food distributor-is all about "good" and is growing, so there's never been a more exciting time to join our team. If you're enthusiastic about working in an environment with a people-first culture and an organization committed to good living, good food and good service, we'd love to talk to you!Primary ResponsibilitiesThe IT Business Analyst provides functional and in-depth analysis in support of project scope and objectives. Applies problem solving and analytical skills to identify, communicate, and document business needs. Acts with curiosity and empathy to elicit requirements from business stakeholders, writes user stories, and acts as liaison between business stakeholders and the IT development team. Supports current processes and identifies areas for process improvement. Has the capability of leading projects from start to finish. Demonstrates a strong ability to own objectives, overcome challenges and become a deeply knowledgeable business analyst in a target subject area.Essential FunctionsCreate call center dashboards that enable continuous improvement of the customer experience and operational effectiveness.Develop regular executive level scorecards and industry benchmarks.Analyze performance metrics and develop training strategies to close performance gaps.Forecast labor requirements.Build operating budget for $4M Operating Unit.Utilize feedback from quality monitoring process to recommend and facilitate continuous improvement procedures.Systematically measure customer experience.Identify system enhancement opportunities and work with the appropriate internal resources to design and implement.Manages relationship with Customer Care Systems providers.Maintains ongoing system application issues log.Develop Ad Hoc reporting as required.Provides backup to the Customer Care floor as needed during times of high call volume.Maintains Customer accounts to stay in touch with the business process.Back up to the Training function for training on all applications.Must maintain good attendance.Maintain safe work practices.Maintain safeguards of confidential company information.Other duties and special projects as requested. Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, AptitudeBachelor's Degree with at least 3 years of professional experience in a Business Analyst role.Deep competency in the MS Office Suite.Qualifications / Additional Skills / Aptitude:Experience in an agile environment with an understanding of how each role performs to achieve team goals.Proactive, persistent, flexible. Operates independently and reacts quickly.Acts with empathy and curiosity. Listens and seeks to understand.Flexible and able to handle a variety of assignments in various stages at the same time.Flexible and able to handle a variety of assignments in various stages at the same timeStrong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Enjoys interacting with others.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and proven business acumen. Requisition ID2018-3057

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Under general supervision, perform intermediate level data research and financial analysis to support business operations and present findings to manager or project leader. Plan and prepare business, financial and data analysis. Develop recommendations to solve problems and issues related to business operations. Identify data and reporting tools necessary to/and perform business, financial and data analysis. Develop reporting/analysis for product manager, sales, and/or customers. Communicate the results of the business, financial and data analysis.Work directly with internal teams (such as Sourcing, Sales, Inventory Management, Finance) to provide intermediate level analysis and reporting as necessary.Develop and analyze scorecards, providing insight into trends or unusual performance.Organize, plan and recommend analysis and reports consistent with continuous improvement of processes and procedures. Recommend, develop, create and implement standard reporting for routine business reports. Recommend, develop, create and implement ad hoc reports as business conditions necessitate.Monitor for data accuracy, timeliness and integrity in data used in analysis and reporting. Communicate to appropriate personnel if data inaccuracies exist.Ensure follow-up so that analysis and reporting outcomes are reviewed and implemented. Medline offers a business casual, entrepreneurial work environment with strong growth potential, a competitive compensation package, and a complete benefits package including medical/dental/vision/life insurance; 401(k) with company match. And much more!

Name: Business Analyst

Some  Analysts will also operate as Execution Managers, driving analysis and  coordination across many teams.  As a member of the  Shared Services team, consultants will be part of highly visible and mission  critical initiatives.  Responsibilities: Understand business needs and explain  needs properly to both dev/QA staff, as well as stakeholdersWrite core business requirements, and  translate business requirements into Feature files for easy Cucumber adoption  and codingManage messaging formats and flows  between systemsUnderstand application dependency,  and modelFor Execution Management, ability to  coordinate analysis work between many teams.Track own progress to ensure timely  deliveryBring in fresh ideas to make  improvementsParticipate in code reviews for own  as well as others codeWork with other teams involved in  project life-cycle Requirements 8+ years of experience in a Business  Analysis roleExecution Managers would also have  experience in project management/Scrum/Agile CoachingExperience with application  architectureVery strong communication skills  (verbal and written)Agile and test-driven development  experienceJava/C/C++ knowledge will be a plusTrading industry experience will be a  plusBachelors Degree (Preferably CS,  MIS, CE or IT)

Name: Sales Analyst
Description: Sales Analyst req8443 Employment Type: Regular Location: CHICAGO,IL Have you ever enjoyed Arnold®, Brownberry® or Oroweat® bread? A Thomas’® English muffin or bagel? Or perhaps snacked on a Sara Lee®, Entenmann’s® or Marinela® cake or donut? If the answer is yes, then you know Bimbo Bakeries USA!Bimbo Bakeries USA is part of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company with operations in 32 countries. Bimbo Bakeries USA (“BBUSA”) includes BBUSA and its subsidiaries and affiliated entities, including, but not limited to, Wholesome Harvest Baking, East Balt, and Acelerada. BBUSA employs 20,000 associates across the U.S. in bakeries, sales centers, corporate offices and on sales routes to ensure our consumers have the freshest products to feed their families at every meal. But our associates come to work for much more – the chance to feed their own lives through exciting work that offers the opportunity to make a real difference in their professional and personal lives every day.Description:  The Sales Analyst will provide operational support to our National Sales Director and Regional Sales Managers for our In-Store Bakery Business Unit. Create and maintain reporting systems for an efficient analysis of key metrics to the business unit. Key Job ResponsibilitiesRun & Analyze reportsWorking with Oracle, QlikSense and other data services to gather precise data.Proficiency with MS-Excel & PowerPoint to glean insight from data and provide team with recommendations. Identify areas for growth/gap.Manage the team’s annual volume budget processDevelop Presentations and Team CommunicationsProficiency with MS-Excel & PowerPoint to create presentations reports that streamline the data in a coherent and accessible way.Administrative & Operational TasksManage sample orders and POS materials with cross functional teams.Troubleshoot/assist in solving customer order issues internally and externally.New Item setup/Introductions; including 1worldSync.Ad Hoc ProjectsLead customer-driven projects cross-functionally.Represent sales team in other cross-functional projects/meetings.Pricing & ForecastingWorking with finance to ensure that pricing is set up correctly for all items and price changes are handled internally and with customer.Develop monthly forecast with Supply Chain for select accounts.Position Requirements: Education and Work History Bachelor’s Degree preferred or a High School diploma/ GED with a combination of skills and experience.  Ideal Candidate Will Possess: Previous experience in reporting and analytics highly preferred.Great communication skills with a high level of professionalism.Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs – specifically MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.Prior experience with business unit software.Ability to work independently and efficiently.Key Behavioral CompetenciesUnderstands how to effectively execute activities on time and on budget.Works collaboratively with cross functional team members to gain their support and follower-ship.Effectively leads teams & projects.Analytical – understanding WHB and customer thresholds to develop a pricing recommendation.Identifying opportunities for growth.Assisting Sales team with executing growth opportunities.Monthly forecasting with supply chain for selected accounts.Working with our marketing team to understand our product and program offerings.Developing sales presentations that are customer-specific to ensure we are selling to customer priorities.Understanding and developing sales tactics (pricing, promotion, merchandising) to optimize sales. Bimbo Bakeries USA is an equal opportunity employer with a policy that provides equal employment opportunity for applicants and employees regardless of race, color, religion, disability, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law. Name: Compensation Analyst w/Benefits - HR (New Grads Welcome!)
Description: OverviewHAVI is a privately held global company that innovates, optimizes and drives the supply chains and marketing promotions of many of the best known brands in the world. When you work at HAVI, you have a chance to make your mark – to be a part of work that drives value, brings a smile and keeps everyday life moving forward. Which means it’s not the size of our global footprint, but rather your personal fingerprint, that has the power to make a real difference for our customers… and to touch the lives of people both at home and around the world. ResponsibilitiesThis exciting role will focus primarily on compensation, with benefits and retirement plan management through our broker partners. Employee benefits administration is handled by our Employee Services team. The Compensation & Benefits Analyst is a key member of the global Total Rewards team that helps build and align the company’s compensation and benefits programs with the Company’s overall business objectives. The ideal candidate will possess strong functional knowledge of HR business processes and have proven experience with the design, implementation and administration of robust compensation and benefits programs. Additional Responsibilities: Conduct the job evaluation process and market pricing of current and new jobsAssist in the research, design, development, implementation, communication, and ongoing administration of a variety of compensation programs and plans targeting all levels of associatesParticipate in annual compensation surveys. Analyze salary survey results for purposes of determining employee compensation and recommending changesCollaborate on salary quotes for new hires, promotions, transfers, change and other compensation actions; Analyze internal and external pay equity issues and provide recommendations. Review salary adjustments to ensure that actions are within established guidelines and policiesResearch and evaluate new or changing compensation practices and policiesSupport Year-End Compensation processHelp manage Compensation and Benefits department budgetHelp administer on-line systems and tools to track all job grade and salary range information Audit systems data for accuracy and integrity.Proactively identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions and new approaches to effect continual improvementsGenerate ad hoc reports for internal use and management reviewAssist with the administration of the HAVI Benefit and Retirement plans. Maintain relationships with benefit vendorsAssist in the benefit renewal process by interacting with our benefit consultants and insurance providersAnalyze current benefits, evaluate the usage, services, coverage, plan experience, competitive trends in benefits programs and provide recommendations regarding program enhancement and cost controlStay current on compensation and benefit best practices and relevant laws and regulationsReview, revise and write job descriptions to ensure compliance with ADA, FLSA, and other regulatory requirements Desired Skills & ExperienceBachelor's degree Experience working with highly confidential material across all levels of the organizationHigh attention to detail; ability to work autonomouslyKnowledge of HRIS systems for data extraction and reportingStrong knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLookUp, Macros)Experience working with long-term incentive programs desired, but will trainUltiPro HRIS experience is a plusCBP, CCP and/or PHR is a plus BenefitsOur total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. While individual program components may differ by country, some things remain constant: …our commitment to rewarding results …the opportunity to work with talented and driven individuals at every level of our company who respect each other, treat each other fairly and hold one another accountable for our customers’—and our company’s success Contact InformationRecruiting AgenciesHAVI does not accept agency resumes submitted by third-party vendors unless a valid agreement has been signed and the HAVI Talent Acquisition Team has granted authorization for submissions for a specified position. Please do not submit or forward resumes to our site, HAVI employees, or any other company location. HAVI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.#LI-VO1

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Job TitleHRIS AnalystJob Description SummaryOverview: Evaluates, analyzes, designs and maintains company Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS). Analyzes, tests, and implements HRIS computer system modules including, but not limited to, human resources, compensation, payroll, benefits, etc.Job DescriptionResponsibilities: Partner with business (HR) and technical resources (IT) to address business information and application needs. Research system changes to help achieve the goals of the functional groups within HR. Evaluate and test system changes prior to implementation to ensure that business needs are met. Participate in the implementation of new HR systems and participate in upgrades and / or new releases. Create, modify and execute jobs and programs. Provide daily interface between vendors, payroll systems and Workday to assist with troubleshooting, transferring files, etc. Manage cultural and technological changes, consulting with the appropriate business partners to drive organizational changes as necessary. Research, correct and/or reconcile daily system/user errors as identified through reports or as referred by clients. Liaison to IT for the various functions within HR. Coordinate with IT to correct errors and inconsistencies in software applications. Ensure assigned systems, procedures, projects and reports are in compliance with internal policies and procedures, in addition to laws and regulations which apply. Identify process improvement opportunities within existing departmental policies and procedures, ensuring appropriate documentation, implementation and communication of these changes. Provide project support to multiple areas, including non-HR areas, involving multiple, complex ad hoc requests for data and/or reports. Provide leadership and direction to the team of analysts through training, coaching and mentoring. May perform as project lead for specific jobs that are large and/or complex, coordinating team members through project completion. Other Skills / Abilities:Project Management SkillsOther Qualifications:Experience with Publicly Traded OrganizationsExperience with Large / Complex ERP (HR) SystemsAdditional Information:Experience with HR concepts, practices and procedures.Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Name: Business Analyst within Manufacturing 3/4
Description: The Northrop Grumman Rolling Meadows Campus is looking for an experienced, highly motivated Manufacturing Business Analyst 3/4 to join our team.Roles and Responsibilities:The incumbent will assist Manufacturing with specific duties to include:Prepare monthly Sector Metric information in working with the OPM Managers to report Contract Delivery Performance, Program Financial Performance and Return to Green analysis, CPWL, DPWL, and other briefings/reports in support of division/sector manufacturing data calls.
