Name: IT Business Analyst Internship Summer
Description: DescriptionCME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.IT Business Analyst Internship – Summer 2019 CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.  We are looking for motivated and talented students who want to help us solve some of the most complex challenges in financial technology. Technology teams at CME write and maintain ultra low-latency electronic trading platforms, risk management systems, and front-end trading interfaces, all of which are central to CME’s business. We are focused on designing, building and deploying customer focused solutions with passion and precision.  CME’s Technology Summer Internship program offers students opportunities to learn more about CME’s business, our role in the financial industry, and the types of technology that keep our markets running. Students will develop both their technical skills and expand their network with access to industry experts, while working alongside other talented and ambitious students with a passion for FinTech.  The selected candidate will join the Shared Services Analysis Team, which serves as a primary interface with the business and partners with the development teams to provide integrated solutions across domains. With a proven ability to work across different offices, the Analysis Team provides project execution services such as impact analysis, requirements analysis, functional allocation & logical design, and centralized data modeling. The Ideal CandidateSelf-starter with an inquisitive mindsetOpen-minded and easy to work withConsistently demonstrates high ethical characterConsistently demonstrates positive energy and strong work ethicPrincipal AccountabilitiesContributing to storyboarding, prototyping, and business analysis activitiesGathering project analysis metrics and data: RequirementsUser storiesInterface specsData mapping specsUI specsReport specsDeveloping acceptance tests and supporting automated and functional testingReviewing QA testing strategy and test plansPartnering with development and QA on solution assessment and validationAccurately representing the needs of internal and external customersQualificationsPursuing a B.A. or B.S. in business, computer science, information systems, or a similar degreeBasic knowledge of SDLC and agile methodology/practicesBasic knowledge of analysis practices and techniquesBasic knowledge of visual and process modelingExcellent problem-solving skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to understand and absorb business & technology concepts quicklyAbility to work with individuals at all levels within and outside the organizationNice to HaveExperience in business systems analysis or relatedExperience in financial markets (e.g. exchange-based, OTC, FCM, brokerage house)Knowledge of derivatives, trade lifecycle, clearing, risk, or post-trade processingKnowledge of relational databases, XML, or programming languagesExperience using Atlassian products (e.g. JIRA, Confluence)

Description: Search by Keyword More Options Search by Location Loading... CountryAll StateAll ×Send me alerts every days  alert frequency in every certain days Create Alert ×Send me alerts every days  alert frequency in every certain daysShare this Job AddThis  Email  Facebook  Twitter  LinkedIn  Pinterest  Google+ Business Analyst (Summer 2019) - Rolling Meadows, IL  Apply now »Date: Nov 21, 2018 Location: IL, US#job-location.job-location-inline {  display: inline;  }Company: Hubbell IncorporatedCorporate OverviewHubbell Incorporated was founded in 1888 and has grown into an international manufacturer of quality electrical, lighting and power solutions with more than 75 brands used and recognized around the world. Our founder, Harvey Hubbell, developed tooling and equipment to serve the growing demand for new assembly and manufacturing machinery during the industrial revolution. An early, and one of many patents awarded, came for the creation of the first practical method to control electricity through the pull chain socket that remains unchanged today. As a market leader in reliable, electrical solutions, we provide more than half a million products delivered through our various business groups. Hubbell is committed to continually innovating solutions that work, transforming old products with new ideas, and ensuring that we Energize, Enlighten and Empower the communities that support us.Division OverviewHubbell Lighting (HLI) is committed to elevating the lighting experience. Empowered by lighting solutions that integrate seamlessly into their environment, save energy, provide improved quality of light, deliver return on investment and armed with Hubbell’s unflinching support, its customers are able to think differently about how, where, and when they can use light. As one of the largest lighting fixture manufacturers in North America, it features a suite of brands that provide a full range of indoor and outdoor lighting products serving the commercial, industrial, institutional, and residential markets.Posting Address  1225 Bowes Rd.  Elgin, IL 60123 USA  Position Overview  The Hubbell Summer Internship Program is a 10-week program providing students the opportunity to gain corporate experience, learn about all aspects of our business, and prepare students with the kind of experience needed to have a rewarding career at Hubbell.  The Operations Intern position offers a variety of opportunities including supporting the organization in the development and implementation of lean initiatives, 5S principles, and continuous improvement.  Operations Interns will typically support one or more experienced Operations teams in performance of assignments, spend time shadowing actual operations, and have unique assignments that support larger projects as well as the day-to-day operations of the Operations department. Interns may perform and/or participate in additional activities/events which will help them build a strong network within the Hubbell community. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Acumen Solutions drives excellence - not only in our performance, but also in the results we deliver for our clients. We are a global cloud consultancy that combines the insight of our strategists, the vision of our innovators, and the ingenuity of our engineers to achieve this extraordinary impact. The Fortune 500 trust us to build solutions focused on growing revenue and profits by amplifying competitive advantage and strengthening customer relationships. Our groundbreaking solutions in the public sector streamline operations and improve productivity. We apply this same focus on excellence to our unparalleled social responsibility program, generating sustainable impact across our local communities. Engage with us at www.acumensolutions.com or on Twitter @AcumenSolutions.   Acumen Solutions is currently hiring Salesforce Business Analysts to join our team in our Chicago, IL location.   Roles and Responsibilities As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to Fortune 500 Companies and Government Agencies. Our Salesforce Business Analysts wear many hats on their projects and are responsible for everything from requirements gathering, Salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects and Technical Architects to design, develop, and deploy large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.  Key roles and responsibilities include:   ​ Work with clients and end users to gather, understand, and define business requirementsDevelop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions for our clientsWork collaboratively with team members to design a solution that will meet a client’s business requirements and fulfill user storiesComplete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologiesCollaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirementsParticipate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user trainingRequirements   Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Products to develop client or business solutionsHands on experience configuring Salesforce or similar CRM Product, including workflows, validation rules, and security controlsProven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast paced environmentDetail-oriented individual with the ability to quickly ramp up on new clients, their business needs, and technologiesStrong presentation, communication (written and verbal) skills, and interpersonal skillsAbility to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks within a collaborative team environmentDemonstrates flexibility and willingness to do what it takes to get the job doneDrive and desire to learn and grow both technical and functional skill setsProficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, and VisioBachelor's degree requiredMust be authorized to work for any U.S. employerWillingness to travel up to 50%Preferred Experience and Skills Experience leveraging and configuring AppExchange products to develop a solutionExperience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirementsExperience documenting user stories and creating to-be process flow diagramsExperience collaborating with business stakeholdersExperience on a Salesforce implementation through the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)Salesforce Admin Certification and one Consulting Cloud Certification (Sales, Service or Community)Benefits    Acumen Solutions offers the opportunity for growth and advancement, as well as a competitive base salary, annual performance based incentives, medical, dental, and vision benefits, Paid Time Off, 401k, and more.  About Us As a leading management and technology consulting firm, Acumen Solutions offers a range of challenging and rewarding opportunities whether you’re just starting out in your career, looking to advance your career, or seeking a senior leadership position. Acumen Solutions employees are ambitious, committed, passionate problem solvers.  EOE M/F/V/D VEVRAA Federal Contractor

Name: Business Analyst / Financial Modeler
Description: Job DescriptionWhat You’ll Do at BTS The greatest ideas in the world will die on the vine if not properly implemented. At BTS, we turn our clients’ ideas and strategies into results. We do this by designing customized learning experiences that drive innovation, alignment, and performance.  As a BTS consultant, you’ll work directly with leaders from some of the world’s leading corporations. Global 100 and 500 largest companies. You’ll learn how their business works and what their strategies are, and you’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of their senior management.  Business Simulation Developers are responsible for designing and building the business simulations that are the foundation of the learning experiences we create. These simulations are often Excel-based, using VBA tools. The developer is key to conceptualizing and brainstorming with the design team to design challenges and experiences that will elegantly simplify and get to the core dynamics and tradeoffs of executing the client’s strategy in a competitive business simulation experience. In order to design these learning experiences, you’ll interview our clients’ executives and leaders, identifying the metrics and levers that are essential to the learning program. On site at a workshop, developers are responsible for processing the simulation results and presenting them to client audiences between 15-50 key decision makers.  There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you won’t fly to the same city every week for three straight months, sitting in a spare cube at the client’s office. You’ll work on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams. You’ll travel when your team is facilitating a program. This comes out to approximately 50% of the time.  The rest of the time is spent creating the amazing experiences we provide for our clients. You’ll laugh a lot and have a lot of fun. And this is all done in a team-based setting where our entrepreneurial culture of freedom and responsibility empowers you to contribute from your first day.  Are you ready for an adventure? Read below to see if you’ve got what it takes…Required SkillsWhat We’re Looking For Curiosity. Creativity. Good listening skills. Executive presence. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.  Intellectual horsepower with strong business and financial acumen. A love for problem solving and a structured approach to scoping and developer solutions to those problems. Excel skills and experience with programming languages are big pluses. Backgrounds in engineering, finance, science, math, or economics are well-suited. We have developers from all kinds of backgrounds, work experience, and education. We love diversity and variety.  We do have a few requirements. A Bachelor’s degree. Strong communication skills. Willingness to travel as indicated above. And eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship.Job Location  Chicago, Illinois, United States  Position Type  Full-Time/Regular

Name: Billing Project analyst - customer onboarding
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role This role is responsible for ensuring Uber Freight’s Billing process operates as efficiently as possible. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing all billing processes and controls, ensuring the BPO processes are maintained, invoice submissions are correct, timely, and accurate. In addition to owning Uber's AR on-boarding process for new shippers. The role will also work on payment options for freight customers.What You’ll DoCreate maps for existing processes, with the intent of planning, performing and implementing process improvement initiatives for billing activitiesOrganize, lead and facilitate team members across the organization, including sales, account managers and the finance operations BPO support team on freight billing processesDevelop and track metrics to provide data for process measurement while identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities.Ensure new shippers are on-boarded correctly from an AR perspectiveManage and lead all on-boarding calls for new shippers, specifically related to AR and invoicing methodsProvide consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance and product qualityDeliver presentations and training to team members and management around current billing processes and problems.Support Freight Business Operations Manager in leading the offshore BPO, serving as the key point of contact for customer billing escalations and helping them improve the processWork with Freight Business Operations Manager to develop additional data metrics to help track the health of the business, and better position decision making for all Uber stakeholdersProvide top-notch customer service to all Freight customers, and provided an Uber Quality product on a daily basisDevelop and grow the Uber on-boarding process for ARWhat You’ll NeedSome experience with Billing & PaymentsAbout the TeamBusiness Operations is pioneering how Uber Freight develops, maintains, and optimizes it’s business processes. We look at every single process needed to run the business, determine how it can be done more efficiently, and develop the framework to standardize and automate it. It takes someone special to be able to look at a problem at its surface, and develop ideas on how to do it quicker, easier, and more efficiently.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Americaneagle.com, we can accomplish anything with the right team members. Our talented employees have led to our company's incredible growth in all of the industries we service. A web business analyst is critical to linking our client's business objectives with the technical capabilities of the implementation team.  We need someone who is a team player and will help out wherever necessary in order to hit project deadlines. Americaneagle.com was recently named by Built in Chicago as one of the best places to work and to Inc.com's list of 5000 fastest-growing private companies for the past five years. We're looking to expand on our success within the Internet industry. Responsibilities:Support and develop custom web applicationsResearch, gather, analyze, document, develop and validate functional requirements for web solutions with project stakeholdersTranslate user requirements into system requirements, process flows, wireframes, mockups, etc.Understand how system capabilities can be used to meet our client's business objectivesFacilitate requirement review and approval with stakeholdersAct as a liaison between business experts and development teamsUnderstand the needs of multiple stakeholdersUnderstand current and desired state business processesAnalytical thinking and project issue resolutionBuild structured approaches for decision makingQualifications:Self-motivatedBA/BS degreeStrong organizational skillsStrong spoken and written communication skillsExperience with software development projectsMust thrive in a team environmentDesire to learn new technologiesAbility to clearly document, test, and validate requirementsAble to manage own workload, take initiative, and assume responsibility for tasksAbility to multi-task and work on multiple projectsAbility to meet internal and client deadlinesExperience with user interface designs and mockupsA range of previous experience as a business analyst in a client facing positionExperience working with government clients is a plusExperience working in an Agile environment and with Agile User StoriesExperience with Web Content Management SystemsPreferred experience with JIRA, Smartsheet, or other project management software Company DescriptionAmericaneagle.com, a family owned, privately held company founded in 1978, is truly a one-stop shop offering a full range of solutions for any organization looking to succeed in their online endeavors. As a leader in website design, strategy, development, and hosting, Americaneagle.com has provided thousands of online solutions for a variety of customers, from small and mid-sized businesses to Fortune 500 companies, professional sports teams, and large associations. Some of our clients include Stuart Weitzman, WeatherTech.com, Komatsu, and Portillos.  As an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, Americaneagle.com is committed to fostering a diverse, multicultural work environment where our employees respect one another and share a commitment to the company's values, mission, and strategies. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionA Fortune 500 company is seeking a Business Analyst for aContract-to-Hire assignment located near Schaumburg.  Based in their Global headquarter our clientis looking for a Business Analyst to support their Business Intelligence team. The BAwill report directly to theirBusiness Intelligence Portfolio Manager and have an opportunity to work collaboratively with theirteam of experienced BA's.  Assignments for BA's are pretty fluid within our clients environment, so projects can span a multitude of business functions, for example: Claims Management, Managed Care, Finance, New Product support, etc. Project assignments can include shorter term work requests or longer term strategic projects. Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAbout Codal  Codal is a user experience design and development agency with a focus on blending an Agile process with the latest technologies. Our clientele has ranged from small business to the Fortune 100, but our philosophy has always remained the same: to empower brand visibility and deliver the most elegant web and mobile solutions possible.  Roles & Responsibilities  Codal is searching for a highly experienced IT business analyst, a strategist with the right combination of technical knowledge and business acumen to provide our clientele with robust, informed solutions. Our ideal candidate will not only conduct rigorous analysis of a business' processes, objectives, and needs, but also translate these goals into functional requirements through comprehensive documentation. They will serve as a liaison between designers, developers, and the client, and recommend decisions based on the insights gained from intensive research.  Candidates must possess a mastery of organization, planning, and project management. You are responsible for ensuring all of our clients business and technical needs are fully realized during our multi-faceted design and development process. Other responsibilities include: Conducting analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into functional system requirements.Performing market, data, technical, and technology option analysis and recommendations.Creating relevant documentation, including but not limited to, user stories/use cases, wireframes, screen mockups, process flow documents, and data flow diagrams.Interfacing with stakeholders to ensure the functional and user design of the systems before and during development.Developing, defining & building technology business cases that advance a companys goals and digital presenceEvaluating research and recommending technology solutions/processes to improve business decision-making, with a focus on the firms core systems, technology strategies and standards.Coordinating with Application Development team members, vendors and Project Managers, as appropriate, to review the proposed solution and design to ensure that the requirements are met.Working with the QA group to review test plans and ensure requirements are covered.Evaluating solutions to ensure they have high scores on usability and user experience design. Requirements / Must Haves Bachelors Degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field3+ years of verifiable experience in business analysis/requirements management for a product or systemProficiency in mapping business processes to user and functional needsFamiliarity with software development lifecycleWorking knowledge of business processes, system development, process improvements and change management.Excellent written / verbal communication skillsAbility to operate in dynamic, fast-paced environment Why Work For Codal  As a Codal employee, you're a member of a dedicated & driven organization, composed of industry visionaries and auteurs. We take the utmost pride in our work and are truly passionate about the services we provide. As a world-class agency, we offer all of the benefits of an enterprise company, in a friendlier, tight-knit office community.

Name: Business Support Analyst
Description: At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.As a Business Analyst for Pitney Bowes, you can too.You are:A Performance driven individual who is committed to provide innovative service to our clients. You are approachable and relationship-oriented as you contribute to Pitney Bowes success.You will:Become the subject matter expert (SME) and provide product support for the company’s internal applications but not limited to POInTS, MailFlow, PROLink, etc.Proactively support the change management process for system life cycles: advocate business requirements, perform gap/process analysis and monitor performance to ensure continual business improvement.Collaborate with peers and SMEs via professional communication channels; troubleshoot and resolve issues; provide user support and act as a general resource for a variety of company requests.Perform gap analysis and define best practices to ensure solutions meet business needs.Partner with developers, system administrators, instructional designers and SMEs to translate technical data and procedures into well thought out, comprehensive documents; create, edit and maintain technical/user documentation, procedural documentation and/or user application guides.Collaborate with stakeholders to identify key success metrics and develop KPI dashboards; perform data analysis and statistical reporting; execute queries, extrapolate reports and provide business intelligence.Your background:As a Business Analyst, you have:A minimum of 4 – 6 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience required.Proficiency in process/task analysis and knowledge of change management processes and/or application system life cycle/support functionsProficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook) and Access and/or querying databases.Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills; problem resolution skills; analytical skills; organization and project management skillsAble to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneouslyPrevious business support, product support, customer experience or similar experience a plusFamiliar with POInTS, relational databases and/or SQL preferredWe will:Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your careerOffer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspective and ideasDeliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organizationOffer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)Our Presort Services team is a national outsource provider of mail presort services for first-class and standard-class mail in the U.S. and a workshare partner of the United States Postal Service (USPS). Our Presort Services network provides mailers with end-to-end solutions from pick up at their location to delivery into the postal system. Through our network of 33+ U.S. locations, and with our fully customized proprietary technology, we process approximately 15 billion pieces of mail annually and are able to expedite delivery and optimize postage savings for our clients.Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply.All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

Name: Financial Analyst, FP&A
Description: OverviewMagnetar Capital is a leading asset manager with AUM of over $13.7B as of July, 2018. We are conveniently headquartered in downtown Evanston, steps from public transportation and the lakefront. We operate substantial satellite offices in New York, London, Houston, and Minneapolis. When you join Magnetar, you will work alongside individuals who are among the best in the business at what they do. We attract highly skilled, dedicated professionals who enjoy working across practices and executing innovative ideas. Our culture is based on the core values of insight, integrity and passion. We have an intense level of intellectual curiosity, a profound passion for our work and care deeply about delivering results for the Firm and for each other. These qualities drive everything we do.We seek to generate consistent performance across a variety of market conditions by identifying differentiated investment ideas that we believe can be developed into scalable businesses. We invest across four core pillars: Fixed Income, Energy, Quantitative, and Fundamental Strategies.In addition to a competitive compensation package, we offer a broad range of employer benefits. These include: premium employer-subsidized healthcare coverage (PPO), dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents. Additional benefits include healthcare and commuter flexible spending accounts, 401(k) retirement plan with partial company match, life insurance and paid maternity and paternity leave. We know how important healthy choices are to our employees. We offer an onsite gym in our Evanston office (and subsidized memberships for other office locations), kitchens with healthy snacks, and health-conscious, catered lunches daily at no cost to our employees. Magnetar employees are passionate about philanthropy and there are plenty of ways for employees to give back through the Magnetar Academy (a nonprofit financial literacy program for high-school students), organized volunteer efforts, and our company matching contributions program. Employees also receive one Community Day per year to volunteer at a cause of their choosing. To further enrich our work environment, we also organize extracurricular activities such as our running club, kickball and bowling teams as well as company-sponsored social events for employees and families. We hope you’ll consider joining us as you explore careers at Magnetar!Position Overview We are currently looking for an experienced Financial Analyst to join our Corporate Finance team at Magnetar. This position will report to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis and will be a key participant in the development, preparation, and presentation of both short and long term financial forecasts and/or operating budgets. This person will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and reporting financial and operational data in support of overall management objectives at the firm. ResponsibilitiesDevelop, prepare and present key financial analyses including forecasts, budgets, strategic plans, balance sheet/cash flow projections, and business modelsAssist in the annual budgeting and quarterly outlook processes in order to ensure all departments and operations are adhering to financial plansAssist in preparation of presentation materials for the executive team, periodic management speaking engagements, etc.Maintain and manage corporate financial data provided from multiple departments and software applicationsProactively develop ad hoc financial analyses to improve reporting and understanding of underlying trends and performance QualificationsBachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or math preferred (3.5 minimum cumulative GPA) Minimum four years of relevant work experience. Experience in financial services, public accounting, or consulting a plusExperience in financial modeling, proficiency in maintaining and extracting data from proprietary firm software a plus Motivated self-starter, highly organized and committed to accuracy and quality of work productAbility and desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced environment and manage multiple workstreams simultaneouslyStrong quantitative skills and a willingness to immerse oneself in financial and market dataExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAdvanced knowledge and experience in Excel and PowerPoint required; knowledge of additional data analysis software a plusDisclaimerThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

huddles w/devs, desk checks, questions  Required -  3+ years of requirements, business, and systems analysis or similar experience  Working knowledge of Agile SDLC * Strong analytical and interpersonal skills  Excellent communication skills  Need Technical background in computer science  Ability to become an SME  Teams wide angle lens on user stories  Ensure they understand what solid, well-formed, well-split user stories should be and how they should map well to business goals  Understand the relationship between stories, dependencies  Experience performing Sanity tests  Preferred  Experience with tools that facilitate agile development such as Jira, Taiga, Rally, Team Foundation Server, etc.  1+ years of experience with Mobile Application development teams  Experience working with Customer Facing Digital Channels and/or travel industry  Experience working with modern technology such as web service, xml, json, iOS and Android platform features

Name: Software Implementation Consultant- Capital Planning Solutions
Description: The Organization At Kaufman Hall, we believe that sustained success is never an accident. It is the result of sound decision making, based on data-driven analysis and disciplined thinking, and guided by the fundamental principles of corporate finance. Kaufman Hall provides management consulting and software to help organizations realize sustained success amid changing market conditions. Since 1985, Kaufman Hall has been a trusted advisor to boards and executive management teams, helping them incorporate proven methods into their strategic planning and financial management processes, and quantify the financial impact of their plans and strategic decisions to consistently achieve their goals.Kaufman Hall services use a rigorous, disciplined, and structured approach that is based on the principles of corporate finance. The breadth and integration of Kaufman Hall advisory services are unparalleled, encompassing strategy; financial and capital planning; cost transformation; treasury and capital markets management; and mergers, acquisitions, partnerships, and joint ventures. Kaufman Hall’s Axiom Software provides sophisticated, flexible performance management solutions that empower finance professionals to analyze results, model the future, and optimize organizational decision making. Solutions for long-range planning, budgeting and forecasting, reporting and analytics, consolidations, capital planning, and profitability and cost management are delivered on a single integrated software platform. Kaufman Hall’s Peak Software empowers healthcare organizations with clinical benchmarks, data, and analytics to provide a higher quality of care for optimized performance and improved patient outcomes.The PositionKaufman Hall is actively seeking consultants to lead software implementation projects with our healthcare clients across the country. This position involves up to 65% travel and includes a highly competitive salary and benefits package as well as a comprehensive training and development program. Relocation may not be required as software consultants may work from a home office. This position will be a part of a team of consultants with a wealth of healthcare finance leadership experience. Reporting to the Healthcare Industry Practice Lead, this position will be responsible for:Leading multidimensional software implementation projects and developing valuable client relationshipsCollaborating with client executives to understand client business objectives and design optimal processes and software configurations to fulfill these goalsDeveloping project plans, monitoring and tracking progress, resolving client, project and consulting issuesConfiguring client systems and validating client software user-adoptionTraining client finance leadership teams on our software and recommended best practicesHelping clients to design detailed workflow processes and approval matricesProviding advisory services to help clients best use our software productsGenerating ideas for future product development and participating in testing of new product releasesQualifications:Eight to 10 years of progressively responsible experience in a consulting, or finance-related role with demonstrated success working with internal and/or external clientsHands-on financial experience in a corporate or consulting environment in the Health Care IndustryDirect experience developing, managing, and engaging the organization in strategic long-range planning and capital allocation decisionsHands-on financial experience leading a capital budgeting or capital spending tracking processFinancial modeling and pro forma development experience including the calculation of financial return metrics such as NPV, Internal Rate of Return, ROI and paybackStrong understanding of financial statements and ratios (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement)Deployed or administered a financial software application preferredUnderstanding of project management and systems development preferredExcellent communication and interpersonal skills; Strong analytical and critical thinking abilities; excellent attention to detailStrong analytical and critical thinking abilitiesAbility to work on multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines while providing quality resultsAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft ExcelAble to travel up to 65%; work from home when not travelingUS Citizenship or Permanent Residency RequiredEducation:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Finance or AccountingKaufman, Hall, & Associates, LLC. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation or preference, or physical or mental disability or other legally protected category.

Name: Business Analyst Intern
Description: OverviewKeHE-a natural, organic, specialty and fresh food distributor-is all about "good" and is growing, so there's never been a more exciting time to join our team. If you're enthusiastic about working in an environment with a people-first culture and an organization committed to good living, good food and good service, we'd love to talk to you!  Where KeHE goes, goodness follows. KeHE has grown tremendously over the years by exceeding expectations and bringing goodness in all we do. We’re now bringing that same goodness to our workforce by creating friction-free processes.  We’re focused on simple and intuitive ways to work. We’re building systems where our employees come together each day and do what truly makes us human; collaborate, share, and connect.  You’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in new and interesting ways. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a team where our collective intelligence, collective effort, and collective passion is brought together to do something worth doing!Primary ResponsibilitiesKeHE Distributors is looking for ambitious and energetic people to join our Summer 2019 Technology Internship Program. A technology internship at KeHE will help you develop the skills you’ll need to help you thrive throughout your career. Working alongside the best technologists in the industry, you will perform relevant work with direct impact on our business and customers. The Internship Program also provides opportunities for interns to tour a warehouse, participate in a trade show, and opportunities for networking.  Opportunities available in the corporate office in Naperville, IL, lasting between 10-12 weeks long. Our technology organization focuses on new, visionary ideas. You will learn about KeHE's continuous research, effective deployment, and rapid adoption of groundbreaking technology platforms. KeHE prides itself on its culture and values. During your time as KeHE technical intern, you will begin to build a foundation around understanding our culture and values as well as receive an introduction to the food distribution industry and the technologies that support it.Essential FunctionsCurious, passionate, good communicator with analytical skills and an understanding of Agile and the Software Development LifecycleShows great attention to detailHas the ability to break tasks down and communicate the tasks to the engineering teamParticipate in hands-on technical projects supporting our team Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, AptitudeHigh School diploma or equivalent requiredCurrent pursuit of Bachelor’s Degree in a Technology or Business majorCreativity and real passion for working with technology to tackle business problemsClient-focused, results-driven mindsetAbility to collaborate in a team-oriented, dynamic environmentCritical thinking skills and an entrepreneurial spirit Requisition ID2018-3421

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Essential Functions: 1. Calculate and analyze breakeven points by products, work centers and plants.  2. Analyze capital budgeting requests.  3. Analyze actual manufacturing costs, comparing to budgets and standard rates.  4. Look for cost saving initiatives and communicate with operations.  5. Analyze, initiate and implement best practices and procedures.  6. Establish financial controls to reduce costs. Develop, test and initiate strategies for auditing and testing of programs and procedures. Additional Responsibilities: 1. Ability to juggle multiple projects/assignments in a fast paced, dynamic environment.  2. Demonstrate expertise in resolving complex accounting issues and identifying accounting errors and discrepancies.  3. Coordinate and collaborate with business units to understand end-users needs and requirements. Qualifications GuidelinesExperience/Training/Education:Required: BS in Accounting and relevant work experience in cost accounting and manufacturing. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Analytical– Uses intuition and experience to design efficient work flows and procedures.Problem Solving– Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations.Customer Service– Responds promptly to customer needs; Uses customer feedback to continually improve service; Continually meets or exceeds commitments.Oral Communication– Speaks clearly and precisely in all situations; Maintains positive attitude in all situations when speaking with customers.Written Communication– Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Able to read and interpret written information.Teamwork– Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Supports everyone’s efforts to succeed; Brings ideas and contribution to the team to continually improve.Planning/Organizing– Works well with plans and priorities; Makes the most of their time; Remains organized.Safety– Observes safety procedures; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses Equipment and materials properly.Physical and Environmental Elements: This is primarily a sedentary office classification and employees work in an office with moderate noise levels, controlled temperature conditions and no direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. Finger dexterity is needed to access, enter and retrieve data using a computer keyboard, typewriter keyboard or calculator and to operate standard office equipment. Must be able to speak and communicate clearly. The position occasionally bends, stoops, reaches, pushes and pulls drawers to retrieve and file information and lifts and carries reports and records that typically weigh less than 30 pounds.

Our team members are given the opportunity to develop and grow professionally in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial work environment. Name: Quantitative Analyst Intern
Description: Group One Trading, a dynamic options trading firm, is seeking a Quantitative Analyst Intern to join our Trading Strategy team. Candidates should possess superb analytical, technical, and communication skills. Previous exposure to option theory is a requirement.  The primary focus of this position will be quantitative research and analysis. You will work with a small team to form a hypothesis and back test your ideas, while receiving continuous feedback from our quantitative developers and Trading Strategy team. At the end of the project, you will present your findings to our senior managers and traders. The ideal candidate will be able to learn the fundamentals of our trading style quickly, and propose enhancements which add value to our tools and trading.  You will be mentored by our Trading Strategy team and gain exposure to the business of equity options trading. You will gain hands-on experience with a team that designs proprietary trading strategies in an ever-changing, fast-paced, and competitive environment. You will experience the financial markets first hand, and come to appreciate the culture at Group One. Responsibilities:Research our existing trading strategies and propose improvements to our tools and trading.Evaluate the performance of proposed ideas, utilizing historical and live data to test against statistically significant data sets.Work closely with our quantitative developers to translate prototypes into production ready software.Collaborate with our Business Intelligence team so that we are always collecting new and relevant data metrics.Provide training and guidance for traders on how to use new features and apply the quantitative research from our findings.Communicate solutions effectively via documentation.Skills and Requirements:Previous exposure to option theory is a requirement.Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field; Masters/PhD candidates preferred.Superior quantitative and logical reasoning skills.2+ years of experience with computer programming languages.About Group One: Group One is a specialist and market maker across every US equity option exchange group (CBOE, NYSE, NASDAQ, MIAX, BOX). With almost 30 years since our founding, Group One has grown into one of the largest, privately held options trading firms in the United States. We maintain a floor presence in Chicago, New York, San Francisco, and Philadelphia and we have specialist posts in New York and Chicago. Our traders provide competitive liquidity across a broad range of securities by managing portfolios of several hundred issues, and simultaneously streaming quotes across multiple exchanges. Our software development team provides a diverse set of software for electronic trading, quoting, and trade analysis that is the lifeblood of our business.  We offer competitive compensation, including a performance-based bonus and comprehensive benefits, paid vacation, fresh fruit and snacks daily, casual dress environment, social events, and more!Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Senior QA Analyst - Processing
Description: At Relativity, we make software to help users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our e-discovery platform is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world to manage large volumes of data and quickly identify key issues during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.Here you can own your career in a community of values-driven people who help our customers around the world solve complex data challenges. If this sounds like the place for you, check out the details of this position below.As a Senior Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for driving customer confidence by assuring the quality of Relativitys current and future core products. With that, you will be involved in defining, developing and implementing quality assurance practices, procedures and test plans and guiding teams to develop the best software. The Processing Team:Relativity's "Processing" product is the fastest way to feed terabytes of complex and abstract data into the Relativity's Review platform. As part of the processing team, you will be dealing with the unique challenge of processing an incredibly diverse set of documents, a tremendous amount of data and do very complicated data extraction at blazing speeds. If an opportunity to deal with big-data, to solve complex scalability challenges, and to learn a distinct set of technologies on a secure SaaS platform gives you goosebumps, then this is the right team for you. Quality obsession and customer satisfaction are in our DNA, and we strive to exceed customer's and coworker's expectations. We are looking to add new members to our teams.Our tech stack includes a processing engine written in C#.NET, leveraging numerous document processing applications, and MSSQL as its database.ResponsibilitiesGuide the team in creation of thorough and organized documentation for test cases by clearly articulating test objectives, steps, and expected results Collaborate directly with business analysts, product managers, and software engineers to understand system requirements, use cases, and performance considerations Define, develop, and implement quality assurance practices, procedures, and test plans Lead teams and work with the support organization to ensure that root cause of any production or escaped defects is identified and mitigated against future occurrences Perform regression testing to assure changes to the current release do not adversely affect previously implemented functionality Craft, debug, and maintain manual and automated test cases Executescope of impact analysisfor code changes based on defect fixes and feature stories. Identify key test scenarios based on the changes. Perform exploratory testing for defect fixes and new features, create and discuss testing report based on the observed behavior and findings. Work with senior QA members to communicate unacceptable risks to quality Adhere to standard operating procedures and the collection of measures put in place to ensure consistency and improvement in the way we test software and suggest improvementsPreferred QualificationsExcellent knowledge of the Software Engineering and Quality Assurance discipline Strong problem solving skills, independent thinking Strong teamwork and partnering skills for cross-group collaboration Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus Strong verbal and written communications skills for technical and non-technical audiences Hands-on experience with the latest QA technologies related to their feature set or domain Strong manual testing proficiency using quality assurance test engineering techniques, methodologies and best practices leveraging any test management tools Strong automated test tool proficiency with practical experience on any automation framework/scripting Two or more years of experience working with database testing techniques and strong understanding of database schemas Certified Quality Assurance Analyst is a huge plusMinimum QualificationsBA/BS in Computer Science or related disciplines, or at least five years providing Software Quality Assurance for commercial-grade systems and applications 2+ Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process Hands on experience with tools like Selenium, NUnit, and Jenkins or other commercial automation tools Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting 2+ years of experience in CI/CD type environmentRelativity has over 160,000 users in 40+ countries from organizations including the U.S. Department of Justice, more than 70 Fortune 100 companies, and all of the Am Law 200. Relativity's cloud solution, RelativityOne, offers all the functionality of Relativity in a secure and comprehensive SaaS product. Our company has also been named one of Chicago's Top Workplaces by the Chicago Tribune for seven consecutive years.If youre ready to grow with us, wed love to hear from you.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Name: Mobile Business Analyst
Description: For more information on this opportunity, please contact APEX at 773.###.####. Job Title: Mobile Business AnalystDescription: This role is for an IT Business Analyst with the Mobile App development team. The analyst will provide a crucial link between the various product owners and development teams. They must have experience and be well versed in Agile software delivery lifecycle. They will be required to understand both the technical and business sides of the mobile app product and build knowledge so that they can represent from a subject matter expert as well. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit's systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. They will be required to work closely with the product owner and business story writers to ensure story mapping and story grooming sessions productive and outputs of each are complete and concise for the needs of the entire agile team. Must have strong communication and negotiating skills. Must be a skilled analytical and logical thinker. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. May be required to create requirements documents. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision and will report to a manager. Experience working on a mobile app development team is preferred. Responsibilities: Work with IT SME, Scrum Master, and product owners to build a mature backlog and translate that backlog concisely to the development team  Collaborate with product owners to assist with prioritization  Engage dependent services teams and facilitate integration discussions explaining requirement received and needs from service team  Ensure dependencies are met and provided to the development team in a timely manner, escalating when issues arise  Assist with resolving any road blocks that arise during development in a sprint  Work closely with the development team to ensure all requirements are met prior to handing off to QA testers  Assist development team with creating test data  Build trust with the business [IT or other Divisions] and throughout the organization  Foster speed, innovation and encourage continuous improvement  Required to be familiar with current mobile functionality and to continually build knowledge base with every enhancement/change that occurs  Ability to explain at a high level the current mobile architecture and service interactions  Obtain service endpoints and integration documents for the development team  Able to concisely provide status and explain scope/requirements of assigned projects  Work closely with DEVS and Business  Work with Designer to get stories ready for Development  Works with PO to define AC, when theyre done  Link with the Product owner and team with respect to requirements  Help with unplanned Backend work  Support release planning and delivery  Support for user stories in development - huddles w/devs, desk checks, questions Experience: Required -  3+ years of requirements, business, and systems analysis or similar experience  Working knowledge of Agile SDLC  Strong analytical and interpersonal skills  Excellent communication skills  Need Technical background in computer science  Ability to become an SME  Teams wide angle lens on user stories  Ensure they understand what solid, well-formed, well-split user stories should be and how they should map well to business goals  Understand the relationship between stories, dependencies  Experience performing Sanity tests  Preferred -  Experience with tools that facilitate agile development such as Jira, Taiga, Rally, Team Foundation Server, etc.  1+ years of experience with Mobile Application development teams  Experience working with Customer Facing Digital Channels and/or travel industry  Experience working with modern technology such as web service, xml, json, iOS and Android platform featuresEEO Employer  Apex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. Name: Business Analyst (BI / EDW)
Description: Resource 1 is in need of a Business Analyst with experience working within an Enterprise Data Warehouse/ Business Intelligence environment. Individual will join a 9-person team, composed of 5 ETL Developers, 2 Business Analysts and 2 QA/ Testers. Individual should have experience documenting requirements, user stories and training materials related to EDW/ BI initiatives. Selected Business Analyst will not do the data modeling, but general understanding and knowledge of logical or dimensional modeling would be useful on some projects. Individual should have solid SQL and T-SQL experience, including writing SQL queries and joins (inner & outer) against large tables with millions of rows. Individual should have experience working in an Agile or Hybrid Agile environment and have written User Stories. Selected Business Analyst should have knowledge of common data integration, business intelligence, reporting and database technologies . Individual must have good communication skills and have a background in gathering requirements and writing user stories for BI/ EDW - related projects. Prior experience working in the healthcare industry is a plus, but not a requirement for this position. - provided by DiceBusiness Analysis, Requirements Gathering, SQL (Queries/ Joins), BI (Business Intelligence), EDW (Enterprise Data Warehouses), Agile (User Stories), ETL, Documentation & Reporting.

Name: IT Senior Analyst Business Intelligence
Description: OUR STORY: Ulta Beauty is the largest specialty beauty retailer in the United States and the place for the true beauty enthusiast who gets butterflies as she shops for beauty and experiments throughout our store. We are the only one to provide our guests prestige, mass and salon products and services under one roof All Things Beauty, All in One Place. We put our guests at the center of all we do, committing to offer her unrivaled ways to be beautiful in an environment that provides the thrill of exploration and delight of discovery. POSITION SUMMARY: In the role of Sr. BI Analyst, you will interface with key stakeholders and apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including requirements elicitation, application architecture definition and Design. You will play an important role in creating the high level design artifacts. You will also deliver high quality code deliverables for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition and warranty. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, and excellence is rewarded. CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:Providing overall technical guidance, leadership, and solid execution of E2E technical design as relates to Business Intelligence projects.Technical Design oversight and coordinating activities across multiple teams/areas including SMEs, source systems, data acquisition, data integration, security, data quality etc.Technical oversight in delivering architectural principles, data integration, data warehousing and reporting/analysis.Providing conceptual/logical and physical data modeling design and integrated data transformation solutions.Providing BW, HANA and BOBJ services and solutions, ETL system delivery methodology and advice on all aspects of implementation, including work estimation, resources staffing and planning.Lead end-to-end design from project conception through deployment; managing solution design reviews, project gateway approval, security deployment, and overall projects solution design.Ability to conduct detailed data analysis, gap analysis, and data discovery/profiling.Capture high and detail level design documentation with experience presenting to Senior Business SMEs and Technical Leadership teams.Assesses readiness of technical solutions and hardware including systems, tools, technologies, and processes.Stays current in new technologies/features as well as new opportunities to develop knowledge and staff.Leads or coordinates IT business processes including translating business problems into technical requirements, developing technical specifications, technical development, troubleshooting, project management, estimation, conducting technical reviews, developing a test strategy/plan, supporting user acceptance testers, collaborating with technical leads/customers/IT teams, implementation support, creating training materials, creating system documentation, solution governance, providing accurate/summarized status to team.REQUIREMENTS FOR CONSIDERATION:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, a related field, or applicable work experience.Bachelor's degree in appropriate disciplineAt least 3 years of very strong experience with data extraction, transformation and loading. Leads development in SAP Business Warehouse 7.4 on SAP HANAAdvanced analytics experience including data visualization using one of BI tools such SAP BOBJ or Tabulea. Tools including Information Design Tool, Analysis for Office, Web Intelligence, Design Studio, Lumira, Analysis for office, BEx and TableauExperience in various Data Provisioning Options for Hana such as SDA/SDI integrating to SAP and non-SAP systems including Big Data integration is a plusExperience with data modeling, mining, mapping, and monitoring. Layered Scalable Architecture (LSA++) development and design experience is a plusBusiness Objects Business Intelligence Suite 4.2 or other business systems. Tools including Information Design Tool, Analysis for Office, Web Intelligence, Design Studio, Lumira, Analysis for office, BEx and TableauProviding BW, HANA and BOBJ services and solutions, ETL system delivery methodology and advice on all aspects of implementation, including work estimation, resources staffing and planningExperience with SAP HANA Modeler (HANA Studio), Designing Schemas, Creating Packages, Attribute View, Analytical View, Calculation view, Analytic Privileges, SQL Script, Stored Procedures and CE FunctionsAt least 3 years of experience in software development life cycleFunctional knowledge of retail domain across various source applications such as ERP and retail specific Loyalty & ecommerce applicationsAt least 2 years of experience in Design and architecture reviewExcellent communication (written and verbal) skills and leadership skillsAbility to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environmentsExperience in Retail, CPG or Logistics domain preferredThis position is ineligible for sponsorship at this time

Name: Pre-Sales Business Consultant
Description: If you love sales and business development, not to mention being highly innovative while working with a highly diverse client and partner base, then this is the place for you. We value effort, attitude, and collaboration. With a close-knit, highly collaborative team culture, you are always going to be in the middle of breaking new ground while delighting our clients and partners and ensuring CIC Plus continues to thrive and grow.What we’re all aboutWe are a leading-edge technology company. Our mission is to improve the lives and careers of HR, payroll, and benefits departments using our industry-leading employer compliance management products while providing the best client service in the industry. We work with over 40 Fortune 100 organizations and a range of HR industry leaders.Tell me more about this jobThe pre-sales Business Consultant plays a key role in driving sales revenue at CIC Plus. In this position, you’ll be a trusted advisor to our current and prospective clients and partners using your CIC Plus service expertise, HR and payroll knowledge, and consulting skills to solve their business challenges. You will increase sales performance by working directly with Sales, Business Development and Alliances to identify, develop, and present solutions to the Fortune 1000 marketplace. The Business Consultant will ensure client expectations are aligned with the CIC Plus offering through close collaboration with CIC Plus product and implementation stakeholders.This position is responsible for engaging with sales and collaborating on prospective opportunities. The Business Consultant will lead thorough discovery sessions to uncover current environment, infrastructure, and business/functional requirements and also work with key product, development and implementation stakeholders to architect solutions and scope for prospective opportunities. In addition, the Business Consultant will be responsible for demonstrating product and service capabilities for prospective clients. The Business Consultant also will help represent CIC Plus at trade shows and partner events.The successful candidate must have proven success in a pre-sales capacity within the HCM marketplace. They must have proven strategic, analytical and consultative skills and possess a strong knowledge of the employee life cycle for large employers. The candidate should also be a broad-based business thinker who can collaborate effectively with peers as well as all levels of functional and business leadership.Ultimately, the pre-sales Business Consultant will act as a subject matter expert and best practices advisor on all of CIC Plus products and services.Purpose of the roleCIC Plus is growing annually. We are looking to enhance our focus and diligence in complex client pursuits, while providing a creative approach to solutioning and a more seamless transition to implementation. This role will report to the Vice President of Sales.Responsibilities and skill sets IncludeIncrease sales performance by partnering with Sales, Business Development and Alliances to present CIC Plus strategies and business solutions.Strong functional and technical knowledge of the HCM marketplace.Strong functional and technical knowledge of the employee life cycle.Build trust and rapport with multiple stakeholders within a complex selling environment.Communicate effectively with a sharp focus on the client and their objectives.Highly organized with the ability to work independently.Highly adept in presentation and demonstration skills.Facilitate business and functional discussions with user groups and senior functional directors.Participate in conferences events and other marketing activities to promote awareness of CIC Plus and our products.Lead discovery sessions to understand client’s business/functional requirements.Collaborate with CIC Plus stakeholders to configure and align solution to client needs.Support RFP response process.Strategic use of competitive knowledge and intelligence.Ability to work and perform under pressure.Develop technical competence and functional expertise across CIC Plus offerings.Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training.Manage and maintain CIC Plus demonstration environment.Competencies RequiredSelf-starter, team player, super-collaborator, creative thinker, highly organized, goal driven, energetic, patient, multi-tasker, market driven, innovative, great communicator, problem solver!Qualifications Required1 to 5 years of related professional experience.Strategic consulting experience within human resources, payroll and or benefits.Superior relationship building skills.Willingness and ability to travel.Experience working with technology products and process within the employee life cycle.Knowledge of compliance and practice within human resources and payroll.Collaborative, team player with strong self-starter attitude.A leading Industry HR Certification a strong plus: PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, OR CPP.How do I apply?Please email your resume to andreww@cicplus.com with the following information:1. Compensation expectations2. Available start date3. How you heard about us4. Cover letter (Preferred but not required, we’d love to get to know you outside of the resume.)

Name: AVP Business Analyst - Databases
Description: AVP Databases and Business Analysis We are working with a global commercial real estate firm with it's USA headquarters here in Chicago. Name: Sr. Business Operations Analyst
Description: Launched in November 2008 in Chicago, Groupon is re-defining local commerce. Groupon offers unbeatable deals on the best stuff to do, eat, see, and buy in cities across the globe. With ambitions to transform local commerce and $1 billion in cash on its balance sheet, Groupon is looking for top-notch business operations (Biz Ops) professionals to lead the company through the next stage of growth.  The Biz Ops team bridges the operational and product sides of Groupon, using a strategic mindset, analytical thinking, and operational horsepower to drive business value from Groupon’s product and engineering investments. With an alignment to specific product areas (e.g., search, conversion, customer engagement, etc.) they develop the knowledge and insights that fuel our product strategy & development. This position is for Chicago and will report to a manager of business operations.  Typical responsibilities:  • Partnering with Product managers, and to a lesser extent, engineering, marketing and sales to identify and drive strategic and operational improvements that deliver sustainable lift.  • Applying your expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to understand how users interact with Groupon's offerings  • Developing & testing hypotheses to explain both macro and micro trends and opportunities in the business  • Quantifying the value / size of new opportunities to inform and prioritize product roadmaps  • Designing both the business logic and the technical specifications to extract key data elements from Groupon’s products  • Creating dashboards and communicating product performance towards achieving product goals  • Reviewing product performance, advising on areas of opportunity, and analyzing A/B testing and other experimental data to measure the impact of new features  • Develop effective statistical models for segmentation, classification, optimization, etc.  Ideal candidate will have:  • 3-5+ years (Bachelors + 5 / Masters + 3) of relevant work experience in highly analytical roles (consulting, investment banking, product analytics, etc.)  • Excellent communicator (written + oral). An ability to work well with a wide range of people.  • Demonstrated ability to influence outcomes and decisions (not just report on analytics)  • Advanced proficiency in Excel, SQL and Tableau  • Interest and passion for data, product development and e-commerce

Name: Business/Financial Analyst
Description: About Guaranteed RateGuaranteed Rate is eighth largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. The company has become The Home Purchase Experts® by offering industry-leading self-service tools and low rate, low fee mortgages through an easy-to-understand process and unparalleled customer service. Headquartered in Chicago with approximately 3,000+ employees in 200+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, Guaranteed Rate has helped hundreds of thousands of homeowners with more than $23 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in the past year.  Guaranteed Rate has been able to expand successfully nationwide through a business model that allows top originators to join the company and close more loans faster through its technology, pricing, process and support. The company now has more top loan originators in the annual national rankings from mortgage industry publications Mortgage Executive, Scotsman Guide and Origination News than any other bank or mortgage company. Having gone through explosive growth Guaranteed Rate has maintained being highly entrepreneurial while maintaining a healthy work life balance. If you’re interested in working with motivated and intelligent people while disrupting an industry then we want to talk with you.Who is GR? Guaranteed Rate is not your typical company and certainly not your typical mortgage company. We’re technology driven, have tons of energy and we love what we do – great people and great products alongside our impeccable customer service (83 NPS, unheard of!). We’re in a Ravenswood loft style office building with exposed brick and duct work, and windows we can actually open during the summer. The awesomeness doesn’t end there, we also have:Not just major holidays, we have any holiday parties -- Mardi Gras, Valentine’s Day, St. Paddy’s Day, Opening Day, Boxing Day, you get the picture.Access to our free nurse practitioner/acupuncturist and massage therapist.Blue Cross Blue Shield health care coverage – dental, vision, short-term disability, life insurance and a 401(k) plan.Best of all, we help you become a homeowners with a big fat employee discount on the origination fees. Already own? We offer discounted refinances through Guaranteed Rate.What's the Role?We are currently seeking a hard-working, dedicated business/financial analyst to play an active role in the analysis, evaluation, and execution of mortgage related information and financial reports.Primary Responsibilities:Provide analytical support and complete special projects for all functional areasGather and analyze data in order to make financial or business recommendationsEvaluate economic performance of loans/loan officers; Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Details:Summary:Leads projects and serves as a liaison between the business units, the IT organization and support/control groups, in order to recommend and document requirements for systems and operational solutions to meet user needs. For external projects, serves as a liaison between the external business customers - exchanges, members & vendors - and OCC's internal organizations, in order to recommend and document requirements for systems technical and procedural solutions. Possesses expertise in business partner's processes. Supports all phases of project development life cycle from requirements gathering, through design & development, testing and implementation.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Leads projects and may provide oversight for jr level members.Acts with increasing autonomy and is expected to display significant business insight, OCC and industry knowledge and communication finesse in achieving results.Will represent OCC externally.With limited supervision, analyzes business partners operations to understand processes and functions in order to recommend integrated clearing solutions.Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology, procedures and products.Documents and translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and business operation units. Manages changes to such specifications.Educates IT and business unit organizations on the direction of the business.Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business units, legal/support/control functions and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge.Position often includes QA functions for many of the projects, including assistance or generation of test plans and test cases, and test results verification. Supervisory Responsibilities:·Train junior level personnel in business and technical complexities of assigned work.Qualifications: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 5+ years professional experienceExtensive knowledge of Clearing and/or Functional areas.Strong analytical ability required to examine business problems, perform research and develop optimal solutions needed.Capacity to write well thought out, concise business plans and business requirements documents.Excellent oral communication skills.Strong organization skills needed.Ability to multitask between many projects simultaneously with changing priorities.Technical Skills:Proficiency on email, MS Office word, excel, PowerPoint packages.Familiarity with application development and project life cycle methodologies.Familiarity in application design, SQL, and other software analysis tools a plus.Education and/or Experience:Undergraduate degree required.MBA or related graduate level course work a plus.5 plus years in securities or financial derivatives industry required. Experience in the operations of markets from a clearing organization, exchange or member firm perspective required.Certificates or Licenses:N/AStep 1 When you find a position you're interested in, click the 'Apply' button. involved in their area of supportRemains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and thinks about new ways of applying them.We’re here to helpAt BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA.
