Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Sr Business Analyst OPE000578 Responsible for leading significant business analysis efforts and improving the overall impact of requirements in support of critical enterprise projects and programs. Responsible for working with key business and IT stakeholders to analyze business needs and document/manage requirements for large, complex, enterprise projects or programs. Serve as a senior-level requirements liaison between business leaders and technology to support the delivery of business and technology capabilities throughout the project lifecycle. Develop scope for Enterprise Projects.Elicit, analyze and document business requirements and business rules advising business on priorities, options, risks and costs versus benefits of various solutions.Identify and document the needs of customers, frontline associates and key business partners,Identify, document and update business processes, including identifying impacts to policies, procedures and controls.Assist with the analysis of impacts of proposed technology solutions on existing business and operational processes.Provide input to buy vs. build decisions based on input received from the business and other functions within technology.Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business, and if not, whether new solutions are feasible.Provide input to the development of formal business cases, when applicable.Provide input to resource needs at the project- or program-level to identify key / required skills. Project Delivery Responsibilities Elicit, analyze and document requirements for any new and/or changes to business processes or technology applications.Elicit requirements using appropriate facilitation techniques, including interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Develop and manage business scenarios / use cases to explain and demonstrate business requirements specifications to business stakeholders and the technology team.Review functional design and test deliverables to ensure that they meet the requirements.Develop and manage the requirements traceability process from requirements through to testing with appropriate gap analysis to ensure requirements meet the needs of the business through the delivery lifecycle.Assist User Acceptance Test (UAT) teams to ensure that requirements documentation can be easily translated into test plans, ensure that the proper testing plans have been reviewed and meet the business and technology testing needs.Provide relevant test scenarios for the UAT/testing team; partner with test team to develop system integration test scripts and ensure all testing plans and results correspond to the business expectations.Facilitate implementation of new functionality through training sessions, demos, and the development of appropriate documentation.Provide high-level business process and technical overviews and insight where appropriate.Identify and communicate risks to delivering solution on time.Provide input to resource needs at the project- or program-level to identify key / required skills.Lead, elicit and recommend significant business analysis process improvement initiatives.May be required to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Business Partnership Responsibilities Serve as primary contact between key business leaders/ stakeholders and technology to ensure requirements are delivered on time and in a comprehensive, quality manner to meet the needs of the project or program to deliver business capabilities.Establish strong working relationships with business partners, technology team members, functional counterparts, and related vendors.Maintain continuity between business team and IS organization throughout complete system development life cycle (SDLC). Individual and Team Accountabilities Manage individual workload and deliver to agreed upon project milestones.Actively suggest and lead process improvement initiatives to improve delivery of high quality requirements to meet business objectives.Proactively promote, implement and manage consistent performance metrics to measure the impact of the requirements discipline to support corporate initiatives.Lead and collaborate in a team environment and help resolve business analysis issues.Provide mentoring for less senior BAs on Business Analysis discipline, processes, and techniques as required.7+ years experience required in a Business or Systems Analysis role in a large enterprise environment.Masters (preferred) or Bachelors degree in related discipline or equivalent experience requiredInternational Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) Business Analyst certification a plus.Strong analysis, verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with business and technology stakeholders, team members and management.Experience with business process reengineering and business modeling concepts, tools and techniques.Process-driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods.Experience with Use Case and scenario-based process documentation techniques.Proficiency with requirements based on a waterfall project delivery methodology. Agile requirements experience a definite plus.Experience with wireless or telecom industry is highly desirable. Job : Operations Location(s) : Illinois-CHICAGO_IL U.S. Cellular® is an EEO employer and gives consideration to qualified applicants without regard to race/color/age/religion/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/national origin/disability/veteran status, pregnancy or genetic information.

Name: Business Analyst II (2)
Description: Business Analyst II  Chicago, IL The American Medical Association (AMA), the nation’s largest professional association of physicians, has a dynamic opportunity for the right individual. Join the AMA team as a Business Analyst II in Periodical Publishing. As part of the team, you will work closely with business partners to understand their business needs, investigate options and prepare requirements for all systems solutions. Convey the future direction of systems and the impact of those systems on the clients’ business. Analyze and document descriptions of user needs, including business process, workflows, data flows, use cases; and other requirements. Design program specifications, including the functions and steps required to develop or modify the computer systems to meet end user requirements. Partner with developers and other team members in the testing cycle of the systems solutions. Assist in the estimation process and implementation of the systems solutions. Objectives This position will work with internal stakeholders to analyze new feature requests and bug reports to support all JAMA Network web and mobile products. The position will be responsible for documentation of requirements, authoring and execution of test plans, and maintenance of final product release notes.  Three main skill set categories will be required for a candidate to be positioned successfully in this new role:  Experience in business analysis and process analysis with excellent communication and documentation skills. Experience generating sustainable and repeatable user-acceptance test plans and managing ongoing Quality Assurance routines for emerging features during final go-to-market development activities.Solid foundational understanding of web and mobile technologies such as HTML/CSS/JS with some basic coding experience being a plus. The AMA offers competitive salaries, including an incentive plan; excellent benefits and progressive technology. Our office is a business casual environment and we respect work-life balance. The American Medical Association is located at 330 N. Wabash Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611 and is convenient to all public transportation in Chicago.  We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity in our workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. As an EOE/AA employer, the American Medical Association will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and veteran or disability status. THE AMA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THE NATION

Name: Business Technical Analyst
Description: Business Technical AnalystWho We AreBurwood Group is not your average technology consulting firm. We are an innovative, culture-driven, industry leader and we are growing our team by leaps and bounds. Founded in 1997 in Chicago (and still headquartered here), we've grown to be a 200+ employee firm with people and offices spread from Southern California to NYC. Our specialty is closing the gap between business strategy and technology solutions. Our clients view Burwood as a trusted advisor and partner who can help them select the best technology for the job, manage and execute a first-rate implementation, and measure project success by the business outcomes achieved.What You’ll DoBurwood Group is looking for a passionate Business Technical Analyst to work in a team environment. Your team will be responsible for organizing and presenting data in a manner that will assist management and leadership in predicting future business and rationalizing critical decisions. Familiarity with IBM Cognos, Microsoft Power BI and Power Apps, and other business analytics platforms will be of great use to you in this role. As Burwood’s capabilities in these areas grow, there will be opportunities to work with Burwood clients as well.  Your main responsibilities will include: Gathering requirements from business leaders regarding required analyticsMaintaining and developing databases and data sourcesDeveloping insight through data analysis based on management and leadership requirementsModifying existing analytics as the organization transformsDeveloping policy and procedures to allow Burwood personnel to request specific analytics and/or use Burwood tools to develop these analytics themselvesWorking with Burwood service delivery to provide analytics services to Burwood clientsEvaluating existing analytics platforms and reports for effectivenessOrganizing Burwood analytics tools for ease of use and improved understanding Who You AreYou have proven work experience as a Business AnalystYou have experience designing interactive reportsYou are experienced with requirements gatheringYou’re able to document requirements and specificationsThe Tech StuffYou are proficient with ETL and SQLYou are familiar with IBM Cognos, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Excel and other analytics toolsYou have proficiency with Microsoft O365 tools and Power AppsThe PerksIf you ask any of our employees here at Burwood “what we love”, the top answer is always the same: our culture. Our employees are driven, innovative, fun-loving, and always willing to help. In addition to that, Burwood also offers some fantastic benefits: 401(k) and Roth 401(k) savings plan, complete with a company matchUnlimited vacation daysHealth, dental and vision insuranceLife and accident insuranceShort and Long-Term Disability coverageFlexible work-from-home policyFlexible spending accounts for pre-tax healthcare and transit/parking expensesAccess to financial planning expertiseOur Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe are not intent on being the largest company; but rather, the best. These are the words we live by. This means we welcome all of the best talent - regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, religion and age.Being open to all cultural backgrounds, life experiences, thoughts and ideas not only strengthens company culture but also encourages different-in-kind thinking and promotes economic success.

Name: Salesforce Administrator/Business Analyst
Description: SummaryLocated in the heart of downtown Chicago, The Ounce of Prevention Fund is an energized, future-focused organization devoted to early childhood development. Our goal is to improve the life chances for low-income children through our programs, advocacy, training, and research.The Salesforce Administrator/Business Analyst will be responsible for driving technology implementation, change management, and training for multiple projects across the Ounce. This individual will report to the Salesforce Platform Product Manager. The Salesforce Administrator/Business Analyst applies strong analytical/problem solving skills in working with stakeholders to determine what is needed to improve workflow, data sharing, and reporting to drive deeper engagement with Ounce constituents. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the design, configuration, implementation and integration of current and future technology-based solutions at the Ounce. This includes identifying the best solution to meet requirement given new technologies and capabilities with stakeholders. This position will elicit, facilitate and document; functional, non-functional, and transitional requirements. This work is followed through to include execution that ensures proper implementation of efforts with ongoing monitoring so they remain consistent with overall goals. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience will be considered. Name: People & Culture Business Analyst Manager
Description: Grant Thornton is collaborative, entrepreneurial and on the move. As part of a dynamic global organization of 42,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, we have the agility and focus it takes to be a leader.The Business Analyst Manager is a strategic, transformation  focused role that primarily works to identify and create efficiencies across the  People and Culture (P&C) organization to meet current and future business  needs. The Manager supports the P&C Transformation Leader to ensure  successful delivery of process improvements and change management to users  throughout the organization. The Manager will proactively identify improvement  opportunities across people, process and technology and participate in transformational  activities across multiple People & Culture functions, many of which will  be in conjunction with other ICS functions. The Manager will interface with team members  across various teams within the firm’s P&C organization, creating a unique  opportunity to learn various functions, including but not limited to strategic  learning, HR operations, compensation and benefits administration, employment  law compliance, recruitment, performance management, as well as assisting with  the design and implementation of a centralized delivery model in tandem with an  ERP implementation. The Manager serves  as a key member of the overall transformation of the P&C function in the  support of firm-wide goals and objectives, provides thought leadership,  distinctive internal client service and consultation and is critical in the  execution of systemic, value add enhancements to current processes. Founded in Chicago in 1924, Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is  the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd., one of the world’s  leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. Name: Mobile Business Analyst
Description: For more information on this opportunity, please contact APEX at 773.###.####. Job Title: Mobile Business AnalystDescription: This role is for an IT Business Analyst with the Mobile App development team. The analyst will provide a crucial link between the various product owners and development teams. They must have experience and be well versed in Agile software delivery lifecycle. They will be required to understand both the technical and business sides of the mobile app product and build knowledge so that they can represent from a subject matter expert as well. Possess expertise in the customer area he/she supports and has technical understanding of the business unit's systems, capabilities, and respective technologies. They will be required to work closely with the product owner and business story writers to ensure story mapping and story grooming sessions productive and outputs of each are complete and concise for the needs of the entire agile team. Must have strong communication and negotiating skills. Must be a skilled analytical and logical thinker. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. May be required to create requirements documents. Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Performs a variety of tasks. Works under general supervision and will report to a manager. Experience working on a mobile app development team is preferred. Responsibilities: Work with IT SME, Scrum Master, and product owners to build a mature backlog and translate that backlog concisely to the development team  Collaborate with product owners to assist with prioritization  Engage dependent services teams and facilitate integration discussions explaining requirement received and needs from service team  Ensure dependencies are met and provided to the development team in a timely manner, escalating when issues arise  Assist with resolving any road blocks that arise during development in a sprint  Work closely with the development team to ensure all requirements are met prior to handing off to QA testers  Assist development team with creating test data  Build trust with the business [IT or other Divisions] and throughout the organization  Foster speed, innovation and encourage continuous improvement  Required to be familiar with current mobile functionality and to continually build knowledge base with every enhancement/change that occurs  Ability to explain at a high level the current mobile architecture and service interactions  Obtain service endpoints and integration documents for the development team  Able to concisely provide status and explain scope/requirements of assigned projects  Work closely with DEVS and Business  Work with Designer to get stories ready for Development  Works with PO to define AC, when theyre done  Link with the Product owner and team with respect to requirements  Help with unplanned Backend work  Support release planning and delivery  Support for user stories in development - huddles w/devs, desk checks, questions Experience: Required -  3+ years of requirements, business, and systems analysis or similar experience  Working knowledge of Agile SDLC  Strong analytical and interpersonal skills  Excellent communication skills  Need Technical background in computer science  Ability to become an SME  Teams wide angle lens on user stories  Ensure they understand what solid, well-formed, well-split user stories should be and how they should map well to business goals  Understand the relationship between stories, dependencies  Experience performing Sanity tests  Preferred -  Experience with tools that facilitate agile development such as Jira, Taiga, Rally, Team Foundation Server, etc.  1+ years of experience with Mobile Application development teams  Experience working with Customer Facing Digital Channels and/or travel industry  Experience working with modern technology such as web service, xml, json, iOS and Android platform featuresEEO Employer  Apex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. Name: Sr. Business Analyst - JDE
Description: Company Overview  Brookfield Properties Retail Group has an immediate need for a Business Analyst at Chicago.  Brookfield Properties Retail Group is a retail real estate company headquartered in Chicago, Illinois and owned by affiliates of Brookfield Asset Management. Our regional shopping centers are destinations for retail, lifestyle, dining, entertainment and so much more. Our extensive portfolio of properties spans the nation, encompassing 163 locations across 42 states and representing over 146 million square feet of retail space. All of our properties are strategically located in regional and coastal areas that constitute the "heart" of America.  Our passionate team is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving and innovating to meet the needs of our communities. Our company culture celebrates collaboration, encourages an entrepreneurial spirit and values diversity. We are very proud to have a team of premier talent who are in it to win it. We invite you to be part of our success story.  Position Overview  We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to join our IT team and primarily support our primary Accounting and Finance application JD Edwards. We are looking for someone who wants to be a part of a world-class organization that delivers results and is focused on building solutions based on sound architectural principles and operating per industry-leading frameworks. This position requires a candidate with a strong JD Edwards background. Our Business Analysts partners closely with business and technical teams to align both perspectives into cohesive and strategic solutions that provide exceptional business value.  The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting projects primarily for the Accounting & Finance department hat cross business departments in a fast-paced environment. Experience in accounting is necessary. Key systems under the IT Accounting Program have applicability across all the business departments and are heavily integrated with other systems. In addition to our key accounting systems like JD Edwards (JDE), there are a variety of on Premise and Cloud-based systems that deliver solutions across the company.  This is an exciting opportunity for candidates with a strong track record of delivering world-class IT business analysis in an organization investing in rapidly-evolving technologies and capabilities for our employees.  Key Responsibilities Act as a primary liaison between key business partners and IT to leverage functionality within JDE to gather business requirements and propose solutions by performing gap analysis, researching, and evaluating alternative approaches.Stay abreast JDE software updates, evaluate and work with key business partners to prototype, evaluate and implement applicable JDE features that are delivered as part of Oracle's continues delivery modelProvide JDE support oversight and participate in audit reviews as neededDocument and develop business and functional requirements as user stories through hands-on facilitation between business and technical teams.Participate in Agile Scrum ceremonies to ensure all proposed changes are thoroughly evaluated for alignment with business goals and business impact.Lead system and UAT testing, documenting issues and engaging developers as needed.Use a "train the trainer" approach to train the business prior to go-live of the project or enhancement.Qualifications7+ years' experience in an IT Business Analyst role with increasing responsibility.5+ years' experience with JD Edwards with a well-rounded functional experience in AP, AR and GL modules. Experience in Property Management is preferred.Experience with ReportsNow and/or SQL is a PlusExperience with requirements development in a complex technical environment with integrations between ERP and other applicationsAgile experience or certification is a plusJira and SharePoint experience is a plus.Ability to understand and translate complex business challenges into application, process or reporting solutions, document business needs as requirements and user stories.Ability to define software testing approach and facilitate user acceptance testing.Experience at working both independently and in a team-orientated, collaborative environment is essential.Exceptional verbal and written communications skills.Academic background in business, technology or a related field. Undergraduate college degree in Accounting or equivalent experience minimum. Behavioral Characteristics Ability to think strategically and suggest creative solutions.Forward-thinking mindset to continue to respond to the needs of business partners.Ability to build partnerships and effectively establish and maintain relationships with internal and external clients and vendors.Comfortable interacting with different levels of management and leading cross-functional teams.Ability to facilitate effective meetings with business and technical teams in a timely manner.Proactive approach to problem identification and solving.Ability to synthesize complex requirements into simple business practices.Ability to seamlessly communicate with business partners and technical teams. We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.  #LI-CP1SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst, Consulting
Description: About JLL –We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. As a Fortune 500 company, we help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. We have nearly 300 corporate offices across 80 countries, with a team of more than 80,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4 billion square feet, all on behalf of our clients.If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. With us, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections and be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions—join us at JLL!Our Consulting practice is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst in Chicago or New York.About JLL Consulting: our consulting practice combines long-term strategy with practical implementation. We provide Corporate Real Estate (CRE) strategies and integrated workplace solutions that help our global clients achieve long lasting competitive advantage.JLL Consulting capabilities include:Optimizing CRE PortfoliosEnhancing CRE Organizational Performance and ProcessesImproving Enterprise Workplace Performance via TransformationManaging Workplace Organizational ChangeWhat this job involves?At JLL we are committed to becoming a data and analytics industry leader with a focus on real estate. Join us in this exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing Consulting, client facing, global analytics team. Our BI Analyst works closely with our Integrated Portfolio Services BI lead to develop and deliver data-driven portfolio management solutions to our clients and internal stakeholders. These will include insightful reports, dashboards, and other BI products leveraging simple and complex datasets.Our agile team determines our clients’ requirements and builds a solution best suited to address their business challenges. A successful candidate will be able to clearly communicate with our clients, understanding their challenges, and work with a team to develop a solution using creativity, technical skills, industry knowledge, and above all a passion for results.Responsibilities:Assist with business intelligence projects to monitor, analyze, model, and predict opportunities to improve solutions.Communicate the value, market, and sell our BI services and capabilities internally in JLL and directly to clients.Design and promote creative data visualizations to derive actionable intelligenceGather and evaluate economic, demographic and real estate market dataAssist in the preparation of client presentations and or deliverablesSound like you? Before you apply, it’s also worth knowing what we’re looking for:SmartYou must hold a Bachelor’s degree, with 1 – 3 years’ of related work experience, and get excited about corporate real estateSkilled and KnowledgeableExperience with business intelligence and reporting tools (Tableau required)Strong communication skills and comfort with senior management and clientsCurious by nature with an interest in growing technical and analytics skills through training, project experiences, and explorationAbility to digest data and communicate results.Solid understanding or interest in database concepts, data warehousing, and business intelligence toolsGood organizational and time management skills.Highly proficient with Microsoft ExcelExperience with database applications is a plusAbility to function effectively in a dynamic work environment (and have fun!)What you can expect from us You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things. Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, well-being, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.With us, you’ll develop your strengths and enjoy a career full of varied experiences. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL.Apply today!JLL Privacy StatementWhen you visit JLL websites, JLL may collect information related to those visits, without you actively sending that information. This information may include, for example, the internet browser you are using, your access device’s operating system, the language in which that system presents information to you, your IP (Internet Protocol) address, the web search that took you to the JLL website, the web pages and advertisements displayed to you, and the links you click on.For additional details please see JLL's Global Privacy Statement or our career site pages for each country.For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here.

Name: Business Analyst--SAP SD/OTC
Description: Job Description:Medline Industries in Northfield, IL has an opening for an experienced SAP SD/OTC Business/Configuration Analyst. This individual will work with the business, functional, and technical teams to define, document, design, implement, and support solutions to meet business objectives and ensure that the overall composition of the solution meets the business goals. The incumbent would be expected to play a role in influencing business leadership and management decisions and drive ownership and acceptance of changes to the business.Responsibilities:· Lead initiatives and support the SAP SD/OTC team responsible for development and maintenance of Order to Cash and related functions.· Work closely with the business community to elicit and define requirements, goals and objectives, critical success factors and risk factors with the goal of delivering the correct solution.· Organize and facilitate effective requirements elicitation meetings and manage conflict with stakeholders or project team members with limited supervision.· Collaborate with various technical and functional teams to evaluate and propose design alternatives, optimize design solution while minimizing impact to system stability and performance.· Proactively present areas of expertise to broader groups, including management in the user community, with little or no direct guidance from team manager.· Communicate system issues and impacts to business stakeholders in clear non-technical terms.· Have proven ability to research, assess and implement SAP solutions in support of new business requirements· Document detailed requirements documents, solution design documents and test plans using standard templates as part of Medline’s SDLC. · Assist in the QA process and approval for production system signoff.· Assist the team manager in determining scope and impact of enhancement requests, estimating effort, developing detailed project plans, manage cutover tasks and communicating status as required.· Provide off-hours support as needed including, but not limited to, participating in the on-call rotation.· Maintain a calm and professional demeanor at all times and consistently interact professionally and productively with all levels of Medline employees. Follow Medline’s Code of Ethics and other corporate policies.Qualifications:· Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related field.· Strong hands-on configuration experience, including experience in integration with other systems and modules.· Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to translate business processes or concepts into technical requirements are essential. · Broad functional and process knowledge of the core business functions involved in order processing, delivery processing, billing, pricing agreements and rebates.· The ability to identify the impact of process or data across more than one functional area or SAP module is necessary. · Excellent data analysis and analytical skills along with the ability to debug and trouble-shoot issues. · Must be highly motivated and dependable with excellent communication and collaboration skills.· Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and be able to multitask and prioritize as needed.· Proficient in MS Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio) software· The ability to successfully interact with off-site team members and to work in a matrix environment is required.

Name: Analyst, Business Applications
Description: Vista Consulting Group helps drive value creation through operational excellence, and the tip of the VCG spear is the Business Applications team (BOSS). The BOSS team gets involved in every new portfolio company early in the investment in order to help the company transition to best practice processes by implementing a best practice systems footprint. BOSS is widely recognized as one of the most important steps in the entire value creation process.  We are hiring entry-level Business Applications Analysts responsible for helping Vista companies manage the migration to new business systems (including CRM, ERP, CPQ, marketing automation, and others). The analyst will partner with employees of the portfolio company to map existing business process flows and determine future state processes and systems design that will enable the company to implement Vista Best Practices. Business Applications Analysts will participate in an in-depth, rigorous, and rewarding training experience which will prepare them for delivering successful outcomes for the Vista family of companies. Duties and ResponsibilitiesSupport an implementation track (e.g., Sales, Finance, Support, etc.) within Business Applications transformation projectsBecome an expert on Vista Best Practices and how VCG implements business systems to enable them, including creating workflows, reports, and dashboards requiredPartner with project team to map future state data flows and determine data transformation requirements to meet future system needsBuild relationships with and guide working teams at portfolio companies and within VCGWork with the VCG Program Manager to develop and deliver recommendations for business process improvements and support implementation of recommendationsSupport business users in developing training on the new systems and help train end usersParticipate in internal initiatives to improve VCG and Business Applications tools and processesBachelors or Masters degree; all majors considered.Possess strong presentation and group facilitation skillsStrong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage to a tight scheduleExcellent problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills, including using ExcelStrong ability to ascertain tasks from open discussion, develop a plan of action, and guide others through executionWillingness to travel 2-3 nights per week on a consistent basis, with longer and/or weekend travel required at critical periodsPrior experience in CRM, ERP and/or experience with SQL a plus

Name: Sr. IT Business Analyst
Description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy. Job DescriptionInvenergy believes inclusion drives innovation Diverse teams are better teams. The perspectives and experiences that people from different backgrounds bring to an organization drive better decisions and improved business results. Invenergy employees are inclusive and welcoming of all colleagues of all backgrounds, genders, races, sexual orientations, religions and abilities. Position Overview The IT Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for communicating with department leaders to gather business requirements in order to recommend solutions to help the organizations achieve its goals. ResponsibilitiesWork directly with business SMEs to determine business needs and opportunities to provide technical business improvementsUnderstanding the needs of multiple stakeholdersFacilitating the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholdersIdentifying the current- and future-state business processesHelping the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support the future.Design solutions, tools and policies to meet dynamic business requirements across the organization and third partiesValidate proposed solutions and ensure they meet internal standardsDefine and document system requirements utilizing process flows, uses cases and other methodsImplement processes and procedures for strategic business requirementsProvide IT change management, training, and communication to the user community in order to effectively use tools and systemsCreate system and regression test plans to aid in solution implementation and upgrade effortsWork with 3rd party managed services to provide additional breadth to IT delivery capabilitiesRequired Skills5-10 years related work experienceBroad knowledge of computer systems and web based servicesHands-on experience gathering and writing requirements for business applications is requiredDemonstrated ability to organize information, manage tasks and projects to support business needsDemonstrated ability to interface effectively with intermediate levels of management (senior management through end users)Ability to flexibly accept dynamically changing prioritiesMicrosoft Dynamics CRM experience preferredSharePoint experience preferred

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Americaneagle.com, we can accomplish anything with the right team members. Our talented employees have led to our company's incredible growth in all of the industries we service. A web business analyst is critical to linking our client's business objectives with the technical capabilities of the implementation team.  We need someone who is a team player and will help out wherever necessary in order to hit project deadlines. Americaneagle.com was recently named by Built in Chicago as one of the best places to work and to Inc.com's list of 5000 fastest-growing private companies for the past five years. We're looking to expand on our success within the Internet industry. Name: Billing Project analyst - customer onboarding
Description: At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. About the Role This role is responsible for ensuring Uber Freight’s Billing process operates as efficiently as possible. The successful candidate will be responsible for implementing all billing processes and controls, ensuring the BPO processes are maintained, invoice submissions are correct, timely, and accurate. In addition to owning Uber's AR on-boarding process for new shippers. The role will also work on payment options for freight customers.What You’ll DoCreate maps for existing processes, with the intent of planning, performing and implementing process improvement initiatives for billing activitiesOrganize, lead and facilitate team members across the organization, including sales, account managers and the finance operations BPO support team on freight billing processesDevelop and track metrics to provide data for process measurement while identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities.Ensure new shippers are on-boarded correctly from an AR perspectiveManage and lead all on-boarding calls for new shippers, specifically related to AR and invoicing methodsProvide consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance and product qualityDeliver presentations and training to team members and management around current billing processes and problems.Support Freight Business Operations Manager in leading the offshore BPO, serving as the key point of contact for customer billing escalations and helping them improve the processWork with Freight Business Operations Manager to develop additional data metrics to help track the health of the business, and better position decision making for all Uber stakeholdersProvide top-notch customer service to all Freight customers, and provided an Uber Quality product on a daily basisDevelop and grow the Uber on-boarding process for ARWhat You’ll NeedSome experience with Billing & PaymentsAbout the TeamBusiness Operations is pioneering how Uber Freight develops, maintains, and optimizes it’s business processes. We look at every single process needed to run the business, determine how it can be done more efficiently, and develop the framework to standardize and automate it. It takes someone special to be able to look at a problem at its surface, and develop ideas on how to do it quicker, easier, and more efficiently.

Name: Data Performance Analyst
Description: “TransUnion is committed to finding innovative ways information can be used to help businesses and consumers make smarter decisions.” - Chris Cartwright, President of USIS What we’ll bring:A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile.Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars.Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.Requirement:Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration and other related fieldsRelevant project management experience working with big data, data management, and data performance; at least an internship experienceStrong problem-solving skills and able to work in a sometimes ambiguous environmentProven verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate analytical and statistical concepts and resultsQuick learner with uncanny ability to pick new technologies, tools, processes, and make recommendations for continuous improvementPreferred requirement:Some exposure to Tableau, SQL, Ab Initio, MS Office Suite including strong ExcelImpact you’ll make: The Data Performance team is part of the Data Strategy Business Unit. Our key objective of TransUnion's Enterprise Data Quality Program is striving for continuous improvement of the database. TransUnion's data quality is monitored, measured, and reported at all stages of data acquisition, transformation, posting, and maintenance on the Credit Database. In addition to the daily monitoring and reporting activities, the Data Performance group also provides services to other TransUnion business groups and these services include Impact Analysis, Data Quality Investigations, Hit Rate Investigations, Data Performance Testing, Customer Analysis, Production Data Inquires, and File Comparison.  Some of the major impact you will make include the following: Data Performance Testing – conducting detailed shift and score analysis for all major data events which potentially impacts consumers and customers.Data quality investigations – investigating and researching data anomalies identified from internal monitoring or direct customer inquiries for potential data quality issues.Attribute review – assist team with defining and creating attributes by our various customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Support Analyst
Description: At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.As a Business Analyst for Pitney Bowes, you can too.You are:A Performance driven individual who is committed to provide innovative service to our clients. You are approachable and relationship-oriented as you contribute to Pitney Bowes success.You will:Become the subject matter expert (SME) and provide product support for the company’s internal applications but not limited to POInTS, MailFlow, PROLink, etc.Proactively support the change management process for system life cycles: advocate business requirements, perform gap/process analysis and monitor performance to ensure continual business improvement.Collaborate with peers and SMEs via professional communication channels; troubleshoot and resolve issues; provide user support and act as a general resource for a variety of company requests.Perform gap analysis and define best practices to ensure solutions meet business needs.Partner with developers, system administrators, instructional designers and SMEs to translate technical data and procedures into well thought out, comprehensive documents; create, edit and maintain technical/user documentation, procedural documentation and/or user application guides.Collaborate with stakeholders to identify key success metrics and develop KPI dashboards; perform data analysis and statistical reporting; execute queries, extrapolate reports and provide business intelligence.Your background:As a Business Analyst, you have:A minimum of 4 – 6 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience required.Proficiency in process/task analysis and knowledge of change management processes and/or application system life cycle/support functionsProficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook) and Access and/or querying databases.Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills; problem resolution skills; analytical skills; organization and project management skillsAble to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneouslyPrevious business support, product support, customer experience or similar experience a plusFamiliar with POInTS, relational databases and/or SQL preferredWe will:Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your careerOffer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspective and ideasDeliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organizationOffer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)Our Presort Services team is a national outsource provider of mail presort services for first-class and standard-class mail in the U.S. and a workshare partner of the United States Postal Service (USPS). Our Presort Services network provides mailers with end-to-end solutions from pick up at their location to delivery into the postal system. Through our network of 33+ U.S. locations, and with our fully customized proprietary technology, we process approximately 15 billion pieces of mail annually and are able to expedite delivery and optimize postage savings for our clients.Pitney Bowes is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that values diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace.W/M/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/LGBT are encouraged to apply.All interested individuals must apply online. Individuals with disabilities who cannot apply via our online application should refer to the alternate application options via our Individuals with Disabilities link.

Name: Financial Analyst, FP&A
Description: OverviewMagnetar Capital is a leading asset manager with AUM of over $13.7B as of July, 2018. We are conveniently headquartered in downtown Evanston, steps from public transportation and the lakefront. We operate substantial satellite offices in New York, London, Houston, and Minneapolis. When you join Magnetar, you will work alongside individuals who are among the best in the business at what they do. We attract highly skilled, dedicated professionals who enjoy working across practices and executing innovative ideas. Our culture is based on the core values of insight, integrity and passion. We have an intense level of intellectual curiosity, a profound passion for our work and care deeply about delivering results for the Firm and for each other. These qualities drive everything we do.We seek to generate consistent performance across a variety of market conditions by identifying differentiated investment ideas that we believe can be developed into scalable businesses. We invest across four core pillars: Fixed Income, Energy, Quantitative, and Fundamental Strategies.In addition to a competitive compensation package, we offer a broad range of employer benefits. These include: premium employer-subsidized healthcare coverage (PPO), dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents. Additional benefits include healthcare and commuter flexible spending accounts, 401(k) retirement plan with partial company match, life insurance and paid maternity and paternity leave. We know how important healthy choices are to our employees. We offer an onsite gym in our Evanston office (and subsidized memberships for other office locations), kitchens with healthy snacks, and health-conscious, catered lunches daily at no cost to our employees. Magnetar employees are passionate about philanthropy and there are plenty of ways for employees to give back through the Magnetar Academy (a nonprofit financial literacy program for high-school students), organized volunteer efforts, and our company matching contributions program. Employees also receive one Community Day per year to volunteer at a cause of their choosing. To further enrich our work environment, we also organize extracurricular activities such as our running club, kickball and bowling teams as well as company-sponsored social events for employees and families. We hope you’ll consider joining us as you explore careers at Magnetar!Position Overview We are currently looking for an experienced Financial Analyst to join our Corporate Finance team at Magnetar. This position will report to the Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis and will be a key participant in the development, preparation, and presentation of both short and long term financial forecasts and/or operating budgets. This person will be responsible for aggregating, analyzing and reporting financial and operational data in support of overall management objectives at the firm. ResponsibilitiesDevelop, prepare and present key financial analyses including forecasts, budgets, strategic plans, balance sheet/cash flow projections, and business modelsAssist in the annual budgeting and quarterly outlook processes in order to ensure all departments and operations are adhering to financial plansAssist in preparation of presentation materials for the executive team, periodic management speaking engagements, etc.Maintain and manage corporate financial data provided from multiple departments and software applicationsProactively develop ad hoc financial analyses to improve reporting and understanding of underlying trends and performance QualificationsBachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or math preferred (3.5 minimum cumulative GPA) Minimum four years of relevant work experience. Experience in financial services, public accounting, or consulting a plusExperience in financial modeling, proficiency in maintaining and extracting data from proprietary firm software a plus Motivated self-starter, highly organized and committed to accuracy and quality of work productAbility and desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced environment and manage multiple workstreams simultaneouslyStrong quantitative skills and a willingness to immerse oneself in financial and market dataExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAdvanced knowledge and experience in Excel and PowerPoint required; knowledge of additional data analysis software a plusDisclaimerThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Name: Mobile Business Analyst

huddles w/devs, desk checks, questions  Required -  3+ years of requirements, business, and systems analysis or similar experience  Working knowledge of Agile SDLC * Strong analytical and interpersonal skills  Excellent communication skills  Need Technical background in computer science  Ability to become an SME  Teams wide angle lens on user stories  Ensure they understand what solid, well-formed, well-split user stories should be and how they should map well to business goals  Understand the relationship between stories, dependencies  Experience performing Sanity tests  Preferred  Experience with tools that facilitate agile development such as Jira, Taiga, Rally, Team Foundation Server, etc.  1+ years of experience with Mobile Application development teams  Experience working with Customer Facing Digital Channels and/or travel industry  Experience working with modern technology such as web service, xml, json, iOS and Android platform features

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: We are looking for a Business Analyst II to join our Chicago team. The ideal candidate must be a self-starter with strong business analysis skills for web-based and mobile projects. The Business Analyst will be responsible for gathering business requirements, performing business need assessments, and determining technical requirements. Name: IT Business Analyst Internship Summer
Description: DescriptionCME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.IT Business Analyst Internship – Summer 2019 CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.  We are looking for motivated and talented students who want to help us solve some of the most complex challenges in financial technology. Technology teams at CME write and maintain ultra low-latency electronic trading platforms, risk management systems, and front-end trading interfaces, all of which are central to CME’s business. We are focused on designing, building and deploying customer focused solutions with passion and precision.  CME’s Technology Summer Internship program offers students opportunities to learn more about CME’s business, our role in the financial industry, and the types of technology that keep our markets running. Students will develop both their technical skills and expand their network with access to industry experts, while working alongside other talented and ambitious students with a passion for FinTech.  The selected candidate will join the Shared Services Analysis Team, which serves as a primary interface with the business and partners with the development teams to provide integrated solutions across domains. With a proven ability to work across different offices, the Analysis Team provides project execution services such as impact analysis, requirements analysis, functional allocation & logical design, and centralized data modeling. The Ideal CandidateSelf-starter with an inquisitive mindsetOpen-minded and easy to work withConsistently demonstrates high ethical characterConsistently demonstrates positive energy and strong work ethicPrincipal AccountabilitiesContributing to storyboarding, prototyping, and business analysis activitiesGathering project analysis metrics and data: RequirementsUser storiesInterface specsData mapping specsUI specsReport specsDeveloping acceptance tests and supporting automated and functional testingReviewing QA testing strategy and test plansPartnering with development and QA on solution assessment and validationAccurately representing the needs of internal and external customersQualificationsPursuing a B.A. or B.S. in business, computer science, information systems, or a similar degreeBasic knowledge of SDLC and agile methodology/practicesBasic knowledge of analysis practices and techniquesBasic knowledge of visual and process modelingExcellent problem-solving skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to understand and absorb business & technology concepts quicklyAbility to work with individuals at all levels within and outside the organizationNice to HaveExperience in business systems analysis or relatedExperience in financial markets (e.g. exchange-based, OTC, FCM, brokerage house)Knowledge of derivatives, trade lifecycle, clearing, risk, or post-trade processingKnowledge of relational databases, XML, or programming languagesExperience using Atlassian products (e.g. JIRA, Confluence)

Name: Sr HRIS Analyst
Description: Sr. HRIS Analyst  The Human Resources Department at Rush University Medical Center is seeking a detail-oriented and driven Sr. HRIS Analyst! Position Highlights: This position is responsible for the support and maintenance of the assigned systems and applications supported by the HRIS team. Acts as technical resource to assigned functional areas and subject matter experts to ensure data integrity, troubleshoot and resolve system issues in partnership with IT, define requirements for new modules or enhancements, test and implement solutions, and support and/or manage mass update processes. For approved changes utilizing Configuration Console, develop technical specifications, make changes in test environment, conduct testing, and approve for move by IT to production.Investigates and analyzes system problems and develops and implements solutions in partnership with functional clients and IT; includes developing functional requirement specifications and test scripts; and testing and implementing system changes and enhancements.Maintains HR system configuration tables in Lawson Talent Management (LTM), S3 and other applications as assigned to facilitate accurate and timely entry and maintenance of employee data.Manages and/or supports the uploading of mass data changes within the various support systems.Responsible for running ad hoc processes and for auditing and troubleshooting both scheduled and ad hoc processes, such as interfaces between LTM and S3 applications.Creates and maintains standard reports within HR and Payroll business support systems and responds to data requests for ad hoc and smart notification reports. Also responsible for maintaining Lawson Business Intelligence (LBI) Dashboard.Participates in system upgrades and patches by performing fit/gap analysis, table configuration changes, preparing test scripts, test execution and implementation.Trains and coaches super users/subject matter experts on the appropriate use of the assigned applications/modules. Maintains training documentation as needed.Develops and maintains HRIS-related procedures to ensure consistent use and maintenance of the systems.Makes recommendations on structure and system changes to improve processes and data integrity.Leads small to medium-scale projects (teams of 2 or more) from conception to implementation: develops project plan, obtains approvals, manages timelines and milestones, writes test plans, documents and implements solutions.Maintain awareness of current trends in HRMS and with current applications; participates in periodic Lawson Great Lakes User Group meetings.Position Qualifications Include:Bachelor’s degree.At least six years of experience in an HRIS role supporting HR and Payroll applications.Experience working on implementation(s) and/or upgrade(s) of HR/Payroll-related systems/applications.Demonstrated experience in large-scale ERP systems, including implementation, maintenance, upgrading, testing, front and backend processing.Strong functional knowledge of HR and Payroll practices and procedures.Experience in a team lead role on two or more successful smaller scale projects.Company Highlights:Rush is an academic health system comprising Rush University Medical Center, Rush Copley Medical Center and Rush Oak Park Hospital.Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care.Ranked among the top 20 best places to work in healthcare by Indeed.In U.S. News & World Report's 2017-2018 Best Hospitals issue, Rush ranked among the top 50 hospitals in 8 of 16 categories. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Job Summary  Responsible for collecting and summarizing data that will assist Pharmacy and Retail Operations management in both long- and short-range strategic planning, and the development and implementation of programs. Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of business processes pertaining to all aspects of Pharmacy and Retail Operations. Analyzing data to develop cost benefits of proposed programs through collection and data. Work on projects in Pharmacy and Retail Operations including process improvement, strategy development, industry trends, competitive analysis, and company positioning.  Job Responsibilities Responsible for collecting and summarizing data that will assist Pharmacy and Retail Operations management in both long- and short-range strategic planning, and the development and implementation of programs.Develops and maintains a comprehensive understanding of business processes and practices pertaining to all aspects of Pharmacy and Retail Operations within the Retail Hub.Analyzes corresponding data to effectively recommend system and operational procedure changes, enhancements, development of functional specifications or interface opportunities with costs and or return on investment summarized.Serves as operation point of contact for various projects to drive project execution. Communicates relevant project information to stakeholders, both corporately and in the field.Collects, analyzes, makes specific recommendations, and presents information pertaining to proposed programs to meet the business and strategic goals of Pharmacy and Retail Operations and Company.Plans, designs and deploys appropriate reports and tools.Collaborates across Pharmacy and Retail Operations, IT, legal and regulatory, process improvement teams, and others, to develop operational solutions. Walgreens, one of the nation's largest drugstore chains, is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., the first global pharmacy-led, health and wellbeing enterprise. More than 10 million customers interact with Walgreens each day in communities across America, using the most convenient, multichannel access to consumer goods and services and trusted, cost-effective pharmacy, health and wellness services and advice. Walgreens operates 8,175 drugstores with a presence in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Walgreens omnichannel business includes *************. Approximately 400 Walgreens stores offer Healthcare Clinic or other provider retail clinic services.  As the neighborhood drugstore and retailer, our goal is to make health and happiness simpler, easier and within reach. And we remain a trusted wellness provider offering convenient access to important health services, such as immunizations and an array of pharmacy services that can help patients improve their health. To our team members, Walgreens represents a unique opportunity to excel in their careers in a welcoming and inclusive environment. We offer the chance to work in a truly supportive environment, and be a part of a progressive organization dedicated to the well-being of our customers, team members and the communities we all call home.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree and at least 2 years of experience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions; OR, High School Diploma/GED and 5 years of experience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions.Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Word (for example: inserting headers, page breaks, page numbers and tables and/or adjusting table columns).Intermediate level skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: using SUM function, setting borders, setting column width, inserting charts, using text wrap, sorting, setting headers and footers and/or print scaling).Intermediate level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: applying a theme, formatting character spacing, inserting a picture, changing slide layout and theme colors, adding transitions, customizing slide numbers, changing chart style and/or formatting font).Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state). Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree or MBABachelor's DegreeRetail Pharmacy Experience

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:This position is accountable for providing leadership and business analysis to managers and business owners for projects and ongoing process improvement. The business analyst performs needs assessments, feasibility analyses, and requirements gathering, and prepares basic cost/benefit analyses. S/he negotiates agreement and commitment by facilitating communication between business units and IT from initial gathering of requirements through implementation. S/he provides business analysis leadership in the planning and execution of process and technology projects. S/he identifies process improvement opportunities. The business analyst is responsible for completing assigned activities and projects on schedule according to cost, benefit, and quality objectives..Primary functionsActs as a resource for colleagues to lead projects, document requirements, manage risks and resources, and deliver solutionsSolves complex problems by designing optimal solutions to best satisfy business requirementsWorks collaboratively with business leaders and IT to achieve objectivesJob ResponsibilitiesProvide leadership to assigned projects that are broad in scope or deep in complexity operating through staff in a project environment. Work collaboratively with business resources, IT, and business analysts for the purpose of needs assessment, work direction, and issue resolution.Analyze business operations to understand strengths and weaknesses and perceived and unperceived needs, and identify improvement opportunities in the three areas of people, process, and technology. Balance all three and ensure each is optimized appropriately in conjunction with the others.Exercise initiative and creativity in seeking solutions to business issues and problems. Consult with key stakeholders in understanding the impact of process or technology changes, evaluate alternatives, and design solutions.Oversee development of requirements, and work with steering committees, business owners, and project teams to prioritize activities and estimate resources. Participate in vendor negotiations and contract development. Share responsibility for business results.Effectively utilize the Requirements Management, System Development, and Project Management methodologies to deliver assigned activities which meet business and project goals and objectives. Use technical concepts and techniques such as business process modeling, context diagrams, use cases, and state transition diagrams to scope, communicate, and document requirements.Oversee the effective and efficient use of technology to support business process modeling, the development and maintenance of business rules, and documentation as defined by business process, system, and product owners.Work with staff to coordinate the quality assurance phases of test planning, testing, defect resolution, and test tracking. Help ensure software meets or exceeds specified requirements.Provide project supervision, coaching, and guidance to business analysis and testing environment in support of projects and assigned activities.Job Specifications / QualificationsBachelors degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or related professional work experience.5+ Years of related work experienceDemonstrated ability to effectively use and practice the Requirements Management methodology.Demonstrated ability to effectively use and practice the Project Management methodology.Thorough knowledge of technical concepts, including software development and design and business process modeling, and ability to understand mathematical formulas and algorithms.Demonstrated organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Demonstrated planning and facilitation skills and ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities.Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work with minimal direction.Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly, concisely, logically, tactfully, and effectively, both verbally and in writing, including presentation and negotiation skills.Demonstrated strong leadership, team-building, and coaching skills.Demonstrated ability to challenge, influence, and persuade, directing a group of stakeholders to the best decision. Proficient in XML.Proficient Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server.Proficient in Agile project methodology.
